Summary: The American Sign Language Club is intended to spread awareness of ASL and Deaf culture on campus as well as give advice and opportunities for the advancement of ASL skills.

Name: American Society for Engineering Education Student Chapter at the University of Michigan
Description:
We are a student organization looking to:
- Inform students about various aspects of a career in academia
- Enhance the teaching and presentation skills of prospective educators
- Assist students in their search for academic positions
- Develop skills needed to establish and lead a research program
- Encourage underrepresented minority participation through focused recruitment efforts and by addressing concerns unique to minorities
Summary: The American Society for Engineering Education Student Chapter at the University of Michigan is a nonprofit organization of students committed to furthering education in engineering and engineering technology.

Name: American Society for Muslims in Architecture
Description: The American Society for Muslims in Architecture (ASMA), is a community of Muslims in architecture dedicated to growth, knowledge, empowerment, service, and advocacy. Islam has a long and rich architectural legacy of mindful, environmentally conscious, and beautiful architecture that is seldom sufficiently covered in architectural curriculums. ASMA provides a platform through which students can not only learn this heritage, but become empowered to bring its principles and gems into their own design approaches. As one chapter of a larger national professional organization, the ASMA Taubman chapter provides events, resources, mentorship, and other opportunities for Muslim students to find their voice in the profession of architecture. To learn more about ASMA national please feel free to visit our website at: asma.archi
Summary: The American Society for Muslims in Architecture (ASMA) is an organization dedicated to uniting, educating, empowering, and advocating for Muslims pursuing architecture and related fields.

Name: American Society of Civil Engineers
Description: The American Society of Civil Engineers chapter at the University of Michigan is a professional organization designed to relate students’ knowledge from the classroom to practical applications, while teaching students about teamwork, ethics, leadership, and responsibility.
Summary: The American Society of Civil Engineers chapter at the University of Michigan gives opportunities to students to network and become leaders in the civil and environmental engineering field.

Name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
Description:
Overview
ASME International was founded in 1880 as the American Society of Mechanical Engineers.  Today's ASME is a 120,000-member professional organization focused on technical, educational and research issues of the engineering and technology community. 

ASME at the University of Michigan is one of the largest and most active Engineering Societies out of more than 70 registered groups. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers at the University of Michigan strives to enhance the professional and social lives of its members as well as other students in the college through a variety of academic, professional, social, community service, and student-faculty events.

General Body Meetings
ASME holds bi-weekly general body meetings for its members, during which members hear from a variety of speakers. For some meetings, we invite mechanical engineering professors to speak about their research to show students the broad range of applications of a degree in Mechanical Engineering as well as emerging technologies. We also have professional development seminars to aid our members in their career development. 

Corporate Luncheons
One of ASME’s more popular events is its company luncheons. Our group invites both technical and recruiting staff to speak to students. Company representatives speak about the current state of their industry, the functions of engineers in their company, and opportunities for students (be it summer jobs, or permanent hires). These events are open to all engineering students, not just ASME members or mechanical engineering students. These events are designed to allow students the opportunity to learn about potential employers and allow company representatives a chance to reach talented students at the University of Michigan. Lunch is provided to students and speakers. See our corporate information page for more details and our calendar for upcoming luncheons.

Social Events
In addition to meetings held on campus, ASME strives to provide a social atmosphere to its members outside the academic setting. Our group does this by sponsoring intramural sports teams in which members join together and compete against other societies at the university. In addition to sporting events, ASME hosts a variety of social activities. Some examples include bowling night, ice skating night, and card tournaments. The strong bonds and team-member atmosphere developed in these events extend into the classroom setting. Upper-class members are brought together with lower-class members to help students create a network of contact and friendship within such a large Mechanical Engineering department.

Service Events
ASME strives to be a community service group as well. One of our biggest events is the Fun Run, a 5K run for charity. We co-sponsor this event with the Society of Women Engineers (SWE). The purpose of this event is to raise money for the local charities in Ann Arbor. Corporate sponsors are sought to help make this event possible. In addition to Fun Run, ASME participates in other community service events. We make and host a dinner at the children’s hospital twice a year, we participate in a clean-up of local parks twice a year, and we volunteer at soup kitchens in Ann Arbor. 

Student-Faculty Relations
To encourage communication between students and faculty, ASME co-hosts a student-faculty-mixer once a semester. During this event, ASME provides a full buffet of breakfast to students and faculty in the Mechanical Engineering department. ASME officers and engineering professors make pancakes for students and other faculty.
Summary: ASME at the University of Michigan strives to provide a variety of academic, professional, social, community service, and student-faculty events that enhance the professional and social lives of its members and other students at the University.

Name: American Student Dental Association at the University of Michigan
Description: ASDA is a national student-run organization that protects and advances the rights, interests, and welfare of dental students.
Summary: ASDA is a national student-run organization that protects and advances the rights, interests, and welfare of dental students.

Name: American Vacuum Society Southeast Michigan Student Chapter
Description: AVS-SEMI student chapter provide a platform for students to engage in social events, networking opportunities, professional development activities, and access to industry connections. Through seminars, workshops, and events, AVS student chapters provide an opportunity for students to engage in a community where members can expand their knowledge, gain practical skills, and contribute to advancements in the field of science and technology.
Summary: AVS-SEMI student chapter is a social and professional organization that aims to cultivate a community where we connect with like-minded individuals through networking and professional development in the area of vacuum science and related fields.

Name: Anchor Fellowship
Description: Here at Anchor Fellowship (Anchor), you’ll find a wide range of people — from those who have grown up in the church to people hearing about Jesus for the first time, and everyone in between! We're a warm, welcoming community where you can find close friends and mentors to do life with, and we're so excited to meet you! :)
Summary: Acts 2 community at the University of Michigan

Name: Anesthesiology Student Interest Group
Description: ASIG is a student organization dedicated to promoting student interest and knowledge of anesthesia. Events include a faculty-student dinner at the Department Chairs house, discussions with physicians and residents to gain perspective on the various aspects and subspecialties of this exciting field, networking to allow for mentorship and research opportunities, and simulation center events covering topics such as airway, IV, and central line placement. We hope you join us at our next meeting/event!
Summary: ASIG was created with the goal of fostering interest in anesthesia by providing resources and information for medical students.

Name: Animania: The Japanese Animation Film Society
Description:
Animania is the anime club at the University of Michigan. With over 40 years of storied history, the Japanese Animation Film Society at the University of Michigan, colloquially dubbed Animania, is one of the oldest collegiate Anime clubs in the nation. Our goal is to provide an inclusive environment for anime fans to create lifelong friendships and have fun. We are a social club that is passionate about anime and we host a wide variety of activities and events for our members. We have meetings every week, and a special weekend event every month. Weekly meetings consist of an anime screening (voted for by members), weekly announcements, and an activity.

Some highlights of our club activities include:

  • Weekly Meeting Activities: anime charades, anime bingo, pitch a new anime (with constraints from EBoard!), anime trivia, karaoke, game shows, and many more!
  • Monthly Weekend Events: game nights, movie nights, seasonal binges, picnics, and arcade visits
  • Conventions: Organized trips (with group cosplays!) to nearby anime conventions such as Youmacon (Detroit, MI).
  • Seasonal anime discussions
  • Discord gaming groups

 

Manga Club

Alongside anime club, we also have Manga Club, which meets every week, 30 minutes before Animania meetings. Facilitated by the Vice President, Manga Club is basically a book club for manga. This group reads a few volumes (or sometimes the entirety of!) a manga series every week, and meets to discuss their thoughts. Whether it’s diving in depth on overarching themes and characterization, or simply sharing which parts you liked and didn’t like, everyone is encouraged to attend manga club! 

 

Con Ja Nai

Animania even has our own annual anime convention: Con Ja Nai! Con Jai Nai is a free-entry anime convention staffed entirely by our club members, and takes place here at the University of Michigan! Con Ja Nai has been going on strong for over 30 years!

Activities at Con Ja Nai include:

  • Artist Alley
  • Maid Cafe
  • Anime Music Performance
  • Speaker Panels
  • Keynote speakers
  • Cosplay Contest
  • A Giveaway!

 

Dues

Members will also have the option to pay dues, which will give them access to a variety of benefits, including: 

  • Convention logistics & hotel discounts 
  • T-shirt discounts
  • Free access to weekend events with refreshments
  • The privilege to help staff our very own anime con: Con Ja Nai!

Dues are $20 a year and are used to fund club activities!

 

If you are interested in learning more about Animania, join our Discord server (https://discord.com/invite/bkM7UvJ) or contact us directly via email (animania@umich.edu)! Additionally, sign up for our email list here: 

https://forms.gle/tRVMKSaUnYPKAa7H8

 

To join Animania, all you have to do is join the Discord server! We're super friendly, so feel free to introduce yourself and join the chat! If you can, come to our weekly meetings, usually Fridays at 6 PM! Meetings are usually 1-2 hours long, and no commitment is required!

 

Feel free to also follow us on Twitter and Instagram!

Twitter: https://x.com/animaniaumich?lang=en 

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/animania_umich/
Summary: Animania is a social club for anime fans comprised of UM undergrads, grad students, alumni, and Ann Arbor community members. If you'd like to join our club, please join our Discord (https://discord.com/invite/bkM7UvJ) or email us (animania@umich.edu).

Name: Ann Arbor FGC at the University of Michigan
Description:
This is the student chapter of the Ann Arbor Fighting Game Community at the University of Michigan.

We hang out every Friday at 6:00 PM and host a variety of games ranging from GGST, Tekken 8, S6, MBAACC, Granblue, and honestly any niche fighting game you can think of, even tough love arena! Our community is ever growing, but we always welcome new comers. Whether you're a fighting game veteran, or you're just getting started, this club will welcome you with open arms.

For the people who have never played fighting games, please still come! We always have room, in case you need a reliable community of understanding people to talk to. 

We host brackets and casuals for GGST, tekken 8, MBAACC and SSBU etc... We also have other games available as casuals when people bring setups!

Join our discord server here: https://discord.gg/VMFmrVGBnJ
Summary:
This is the UofM chapter of the Ann Arbor Fighting Game Community at the University of Michigan.

We host brackets and casuals for all types of fighting games from traditional fighters to platform and anime fighters. Feel free to bring your own setup!

Name: Ann Arbor Melee
Description: Ann Arbor Melee is a club created to host Super Smash Brothers Melee tournaments and meetings. We wish to create a safe space for people to enjoy themselves and compete against other students. By also trying to get new members involved in the club, we hope to educate the U-M population on the growing world of e-sports.
Summary: A club dedicated to hosting weekly tournaments/hangouts for Super Smash Brothers Melee. Our goal is to provide a location for people to hang out and be able to have fun or meet new people. A secondary goal is to increase general knowledge of e-sports.

Name: Ann Arbor Salt Company
Description: We are the college ministry of Treeline Church in Ann Arbor. We exist to help students follow Jesus, find community with each other, and love the campus of Michigan.
Summary: We are the college ministry of Treeline Church in Ann Arbor. We exist to help students follow Jesus, find community with each other, and love the campus of Michigan.

Name: Ann Arbor Smash Ultimate Club
Description:
The Ann Arbor Smash Ultimate Club is a group dedicated to running weekly Friday tournaments for Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. Our goal is to create a safe, friendly environment for anyone interested in the game, improving, and getting more involved in the competitive side of the game. Alongside each of our weekly Friday tournaments, we host group session "Smashfests" each Tuesday that are free to enter and offer a friendly environment for people to improve together in. 

 

Join our discord! https://discord.gg/GUFhdJz
Summary: The Ann Arbor Smash Ultimate Club is a group dedicated to creating a safe group environment to make friends, play smash bros, and participate in tournaments. It provides novices with practice to get better, as well as competitive tournaments for veterans

Name: Ann Arbor Stuttering Awareness and Research Club
Description: We are a group of students passionate about pediatric neurodevelopment and academic-community partnerships. In collaboration with Dr. Soo-Eun Chang's Speech Neurophysiology Lab, we aim to provide education on and increase awareness about speech and language disorders, in particular stuttering, in the local area through community partnerships, outreach events, and support groups, while also expanding access to research participation among underrepresented groups.
Summary: With Dr. Soo-Eun Chang's Speech Neurophysiology Lab, we aim to provide education and increase awareness about speech and language disorders, in particular stuttering, in the local area through community partnerships, outreach events, and support groups.

Name: Annappella Acappella Group
Description: An A cappella group perform/write/adapt mainly Chinese songs. Annappella consist of both male and female students, ranging from freshman to Ph.D students from any majors.
Summary: An A cappella group perform/write/adapt mainly Chinese songs.

Name: Anthro Art Association at the University of Michigan
Description: The purpose and mission of the Anthro Art Association at the University of Michigan is to establish a safe and welcoming community for those of any background or identity who are interested in the creative development and appreciation of anthropomorphic art including, but not limited to, engagement in furry art, fursuits, and the furry community. Our organization works to enable an environment where creativity and inclusivity are valued and diversity is respected, while providing fursuit makers and anthro artists with the space and resources to collaborate, learn and express their authentic interests in realizing their personal and artistic goals.
Summary:
UofM's one and only Furry club! 
AAA is a furry-run organization dedicated to creating a safe and welcoming environment for those interested in the creation of fursuits and other anthropomorphic art!

Name: APEX Consulting Group
Description:
The purpose of APEX Consulting Group is to give students exposure to interacting in a client driven business and developing solutions to real world business problems. We specialize in providing quality work for organizations in their developmental stage, with projects ranging from product development to revenue strategies to human capital programs. 

During semester long engagements with clients, analysts will develop skills in data analysis, effective communication, and problem solving. We also provide professional development and private networking opportunities for students interested in a variety of careers including consulting, finance, and technology.

If you are interested in joining our organization, please join our mailing list at https://tinyurl.com/W23interest and check out our website at apexconsulting.org
Summary: APEX Consulting Group is an undergraduate organization that provides pro-bono consulting services for local businesses, startups, and nonprofits. Through our work, we strive to create value for clients and provide development for our members.

Name: Apex Trading Group
Description: Apex Trading Group was founded in October, 2014 with the goal of fostering advancement in financial literacy on a University-wide scale. Our organization began as a group of like-minded individuals seeking the opportunity to create a portfolio management club with an emphasis not only on managing money as a team, but providing members with educational sessions as well. Everything we do focuses on one idea: educating our members and providing them with the opportunities for leadership positions in an effort to build prospective leaders in the finance world.
Summary: Apex Trading Group is a premier financial organization at the University of Michigan emphasizing portfolio management and professional development.

Name: Arab American Dental Society
Description:
The Arab American Dental Society seeks to unite Arab, Arab-American, and any dental professionals, students, or affiliates while promoting public awareness about Arab culture and its contributions to dentistry and oral health. We aim to guide Arab and Arab-American pre-dental students by providing mentorship on the steps needed to achieve their goals in dentistry.

AADS emphasizes raising public awareness about Arab culture, especially the contributions to dentistry and oral health in various educational activities, such as workshops, seminars, and information campaigns, that show pioneering Arab dentists and their techniques, as well as traditional and modern dental care rooted in Arab cultures. In doing this, AADS builds awareness among the general public while instilling pride in its members toward their cultural heritage.

AADS is committed to guiding Arab and Arab-American pre-dental students by outlining clear pathways to success in the dental profession. This is done through a structured mentorship program set up to match prospective dental students with experienced professionals in one-to-one guidance. These mentors help navigate the complexities of dental school applications, DAT preparation, and career planning. By pairing students with mentors who share similar cultural backgrounds and professional interests, AADS ensures that the mentorship is both relevant and deeply supportive.
Summary: The Arab American Dental Society acts as a support system for pre-dental students with Arab heritage by providing mentorship on the steps needed to achieve their goals in dentistry and creating a supportive network of peers and professionals.

Name: Arab American Pharmacist Association at the University of Michigan
Description:
AAPA is a community-oriented, non-profit organization. The U-M student chapter will coordinate numerous events throughout the school year, consisting of community outreach, health clinics, educational events, service opportunities, and fundraisers. Any money raised will be either donated to underserved clinics or communities in Michigan, or will be used to fund supplies for our outreach programs.

 

The mission of AAPA is to develop and implement outreach programs and provide educational services within our local communities.
Summary: The mission of AAPA is to develop outreach programs and provide educational services to our local communities.

Name: Arab Business Society
Description:
The Arab Business Society is comprised of MENA leaders in the fields of business, economics, and commerce. Our purpose is to inspire, connect, and grow our community through cultural engagement and professional development. ABS's mission is to establish purposeful leaders, a united association, and lifelong connections to enrich the MENA business community. 

The Arab Business Society supports its members through mentorship and professional development opportunities. These include learning about various business industries, networking, and developing recruiting skills such as writing strong resumes/cover letters. ABS also leads outreach to encourage more MENA students to pursue careers in business.
Summary: The Arab Business Society’s purpose is to inspire, connect, and grow the Arab community in the field of business, economics, and commerce through cultural engagement and professional development.

Name: Arab Student Association
Description: The Arab Student Association (ASA) serves to unite and uplift the Arab community on campus by organizing educational workshops, hosting cultural events, and establishing professional development opportunities. ASA aims to foster a community for all Arabs, regardless of their nationality, creating a space for students to feel welcome and represented. ASA is committed to educating and advancing public awareness among the U-M student body about Arab culture and heritage.
Summary: ASA aims to unite the Arab community on campus by organizing socials, workshops, events, and professional development opportunities. We are committed to educating and increasing public awareness among the student body about Arab culture and heritage.

Name: Arab-Jewish Alliance
Description:
Arab-Jewish Alliance was founded to create an environment for open dialogue between Arab and Jewish students. Given the high population of both groups in Ann Arbor, AJA feels that we have the unique potential to bring these two communities together. Diversity is a key aspect of our club's success, for it is crucial to collaborate with and better understand the different perspectives of our community to achieve our ultimate goal: creating friendships.

Arab-Jewish Alliance seeks a future of peace and coexistence regardless of one's background or beliefs.
Summary: Arab-Jewish Alliance is a social, apolitical club bringing people of Arab & Jewish backgrounds together to build friendships, spread love, & promote understanding. AJA seeks a future of peace and coexistence regardless of one's backgrounds or beliefs.

Name: Arabesque Dance Troupe
Description: Arabesque Dance Troupe is an organization that is focused on educating the University of Michigan campus and the greater Ann Arbor community about the variety of Middle Eastern/North African countries and cultures by hosting workshops of different traditional dances present throughout these countries. Furthermore, Arabesque participates in a variety of cultural organization shows both on and off-campus, as well as various inquiries for performances at other events. Arabesque has its marquee performance at Arab Xpressions, a cultural performance put on by the Arab Student Association.
Summary: An official organization on campus focused on educating the University of Michigan campus and the greater Ann Arbor community about the variety of Middle Eastern/North African countries and cultures through performance and dance.

Name: Archery Club
Description:
This club is for anyone interested in archery, regardless of skill. We will meet once a week to go to a nearby archery range to practice and will participate in optional tournaments around the state. The archery range, Adam's Archery, will provide free recurve bows for training and also sells recurve and compound bows.

 

---Frequently Asked Questions---

 

Do I need any archery experience?

 

Nope! Archery Club is open to all staff and students regardless of skill level. Whether you’ve never held a bow before, shot in summer camp once, or already compete, the club is for you! Many of our members were brand new to archery before joining.



Do I need my own equipment?

 

Feel free to bring your own compound, recurve, or olympic recurve if you already have one, but it’s NOT necessary! If you don’t have your own equipment, free  recurve rental is available at the range, as well as several club owned bows are available for use.



How do I join?

 

Send an email to archeryclub-requests@umich.edu to get more information, meeting times, and to be put on our mailing list! We send out practice and carpool sign ups through this email list, so you must be on it. JOINING OUR MAIZE PAGES ROSTER DOES NOT GET YOU ONTO OUR MAILING LIST, TO JOIN YOU MUST EMAIL archeryclub-requests@umich.edu.



How much does it cost?

 

Your first two practices are free! After that, if you decide Archery Club is for you then dues are $70 per semester, or pay by practice. These dues include bow rental, range time, and transportation to and from the range.



When are practices? How do I get to practice?

 

We practice on Monday and Wednesday evenings, from about 7:00 until about 9:00, more or less depending on attendance, however the range is a little under half an hour off campus, so carpools meet at 6:30 and will get back to campus around 9:30. Some members go out for food and to socialize after practice (this is optional but highly encouraged!) If you want to carpool you can sign up to be a driver or to ride with someone. The sign up sheet is sent out weekly to our mailing list, so be sure to email archeryclub-requests@umich.edu to be added!



What if I can only make it to a few practices? What is your attendance and due-paying policy in this situation?

 

If you wish to stay after your free practices but you’re worried about being able to come regularly, we offer a pay-by-practice alternative. Instead of paying dues, you will be paying a smaller fee per practice you attend. While this pay-by-practice program does not grant you the full Archery Club membership, such as t-shirts and participation in collegiate competitions, it is more economically-suited for those who can only come out to a few practices each semester.



Do you compete?

 

We compete against each other in low pressure internal competitions for fun, and most people keep score during practices to track their progress. Some members also compete in local, state, and national events and we’re currently working on offering more competitive opportunities for those serious through the club. Competitions and scoring are optional.



Are you part of any other organizations?

 

Archery Club is a part of USA Archery and NFAA Archery as a collegiate club, and a member of MET, a local archery organization.
Summary: Archery Club was established to organize students interested in casual or competitive archery for the purpose of training and learning, as well as building camaraderie and friendship. Our mission is to build interest on campus for the sport of archery.

Name: Architectural Representative Committee
Description:
Through active participation in the architecture community at the University of Michigan, this independent student advisory board will:

·   Empower students to determine the direction of their education.  

·   Establish a recognizable channel through which students can express and act upon their academic, social, and global interests

·   Foster an open network of thought exchange within the architecture program, respecting every voice.

·   Inspire students to diversify, enrich, and strengthen his/her academic experience.
Summary: Architectural Representative Committee (ARC) is an independent student advisory board that supports and encourages active participation in the architecture community at the University of Michigan.

Name: Armed Forces Association @ Ross
Description:
The Armed Forces Association @ the Ross School of Business mission is to advance the role of veterans in business through three core initiatives:

Assisting applicants: Help the highest quality veteran applicants achieve acceptance into the Ross School of Business by aiding each veteran with insight from recent experience.

Build camaraderie: Advantage all current Ross students by maintaining an active leadership role and sharing military experience with fellow students immersed in Ross’ trademark “Action Based Learning” program.

Connect with alumni: Enlist the support of Ross veteran alumni to ensure success in the private sector through active mentorship, educational resources, and extensive veteran networking.

Success is defined as assisting all Ross military veterans from B-school application to graduation.
Summary:
The Armed Forces Association's mission is to advance the role of veterans in business through three core initiatives:
1. Assist veteran applicants
2. Build camaraderie among current veteran students 
3. Make lasting connections with alumni

Name: Armenian Students' Cultural Association
Description: We are an organization that aims to unite Armenian students, and students interested in Armenian culture, here at the University of Michigan.  We practice and promote our culture by organizing educational, cultural, social and fundraising events.  We also work closely with the Center for Armenian Studies to provide educational and cultural opportunities for our members.
Summary: We are an organization that aims to unite Armenian students, and students interested in Armenian culture, here at the University of Michigan.  We practice and promote our culture by organizing educational, cultural, social and fundraising events.

Name: Artificial Intelligence Law and Policy Society
Description: Through collaborative events and expert engagements, we endeavor to promote open discussion, joint learning, and professional development in the areas of artificial intelligence law and policy.
Summary: Through collaborative events and expert engagements, we endeavor to promote open discussion, joint learning, and professional development in the areas of artificial intelligence law and policy.

Name: Arts Ambassadors
Description: The Arts Ambassadors serve as the bridge between the arts and the University of Michigan Central and North Campus student population. This organization allows students to explore, appreciate, and create various forms of art. Active members can expect to participate in regular meetings and events, and contribute to our biweekly Press Play in the Arts at Michigan newsletter.
Summary: The Arts Ambassadors serve as the bridge between the arts and the University of Michigan Central and North Campus student population. This organization allows students to explore, appreciate, and create various forms of art.

Name: Arts at Michigan
Description: Arts at Michigan's mission is to integrate the visual, performing, and literary arts into the undergraduate experience at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor campus. Arts at Michigan programs actively engage students in the arts as a meaningful way to build connections between academic and co-curricular experiences, and to support students in their diverse roles as creators, audience members, and leaders in the university's vibrant arts community.
Summary: Arts at Michigan exists to integrate arts and culture into the undergraduate experience at the University of Michigan. We do this through the Events, Programs, Funding and Resources that we provide to students both on campus and on our Web site.

Name: Arts Chorale
Description:
Arts Chorale is an all-gender choir open to undergraduate and graduate students at the University of Michigan. We are the only mixed choir on campus specifically for non-music students! We are a musical and social group that has existed at the University for over 60 years. Through our affiliation with the School of Music, Theatre, and Dance, Arts Chorale has access to input from many professional musicians and we perform in venues such as Hill Auditorium once per semester. 


If you would like more information please visit our website at https://www.artschorale.com or our Facebook Page at https://www.facebook.com/UMartschorale?fref=ts
Summary: A mixed, non-audition choir affiliated with the School of Music, composed of predominantly non-music majors that has existed as a class and student organization for over 60 years.

Name: Arts Initiative
Description: The University of Michigan Arts Initiative seeks to illuminate and expand human connections, inspire collaborative creativity, and build a more just and equitable world through the arts. The University of Michigan Arts Initiative will make the arts central to the University’s identity and mission. To achieve this, we will expand access to the arts on campus and beyond, activate them in student learning, and integrate the arts into research across disciplines. We will strengthen the arts ecosystem of southeast Michigan while also shaping national and global understandings of how the arts can lead social change.
Summary: The University of Michigan Arts Initiative seeks to illuminate and expand human connections, inspire collaborative creativity, and build a more just and equitable world through the arts.

Name: ArtsEngine
Description: ArtsEngine is an interdisciplinary initiative of the North Campus schools and colleges: A. Alfred Taubman College of Architecture + Urban Planning; Penny W. Stamps School of Art & Design; School of Music, Theatre & Dance; College of Engineering; and School of Information. ArtsEngine’s mission is to deepen and enrich the Michigan experience by providing a framework in which curiosity, creativity, collaboration, and passion are engaged through interdisciplinary teaching, learning, research, and community. We do this by promoting, expanding, and enhancing programs and initiatives through which students and faculty develop as interdisciplinary thinkers, outcome-driven makers, and collaborative practitioners across the arts, design, engineering, information sciences and technology.
Summary: ArtsEngine’s mission is to deepen and enrich the Michigan experience by providing a framework in which curiosity, creativity, collaboration, and passion are engaged through interdisciplinary teaching, learning, research, and community.

Name: Ascend Consulting Group
Description: Ascend Consulting Group is a student-run consultancy that provides critical feedback to early-stage tech startups. We ensure members gain real-world experience and develop professionally.
Summary: Ascend Consulting Group is a student-run consultancy that provides critical feedback to early-stage tech startups. We ensure members gain real-world experience and develop professionally.

Name: Asia Business Conference
Description:
The Asia Business Conference (ABC) is the longest student-run conference in North American that focuses on businesses in Asia. For more than 30 years, the landmark conference has brought leaders of multinational companies and organizations to the University of Michigan's Stephen M. Ross School of Business to discuss issues facing the Asian markets.

 

Some notable speakers from previous conferences included C-level executives at General Motors, Nike, Morgan Stanley, Google, BCG, and Nomura. Through networking sessions, keynote speeches, and panel discussions, the annual event provides excellent opportunities for attendees to connect with global business leaders.

 

Every year we recruit around 20-30 board members to take up leadership positions in making the conference happen. We welcome undergraduate and graduate students of all majors to join our community.
Summary: The Asia Business Conference at the University of Michigan is the pioneer and longest-running student-organized conference about Asia.

Name: Asian American Association
Description: Asian American Association (AAA) is a nonprofit student organization aimed at promoting racial diversity, community, and tolerance at the University of Michigan through collaborative social, service, and cultural events. AAA is the first and oldest Asian-interest organization on the University of Michigan campus, serving the Asian and Pacific Islander American community since 1971.
Summary: Asian American Association (AAA) is a nonprofit student organization aimed at promoting racial diversity, community, and tolerance at the University of Michigan through collaborative social, service, and cultural events.

Name: Asian American Business Association
Description: The Asian-American-Business-Association (AABA) is an MBA student-led organization that is focused on building a fun and diverse community at the University of Michigan - Ross School of Business. Our simple yet unwavering belief is that cultural differences should be celebrated, not ignored. Through our various events and programs, we seek to share and celebrate all cultures, including Asian-American culture, with our members. Our club is open to everyone regardless of race, ethnicity or gender. Join us - we'd love to have you!
Summary: We are a group of MBAs who are passionate about diversity and inclusion. Our simple yet unwavering belief is that cultural differences should be celebrated, not ignored. Our club is open to everyone regardless of race, ethnicity or gender!

Name: Asian American High School Conference
Description: The Asian American High School Conference (AsAm HSC) is a free, annual one day conference hosted at the University of Michigan Ann Arbor campus. This conference is designed to guide high schoolers in exploring their identity and provide insight into college life. University of Michigan students serve as workshop facilitators, small group leaders, and panelists to guide high school attendees.
Summary: The Asian American High School Conference (AsAm HSC) is a free, annual conference hosted at the University of Michigan Ann Arbor campus for A/PIA high school students.

Name: Asian Consortium for Economic Development
Description:
ACED is a Ross School of Business student organization that aims to provide a professional, educational, and social platform for students and participants to learn about the impacts of Asian, with an emphasis on Chinese, development on society, culture, and the global economy. The purpose of the organization is to help members develop their professional perspectives on the emerging business opportunities in China and Asia. We pride ourselves in providing our members with an abundance of resources and activities such as yearly business conferences (previously named Wassup China), monthly social gatherings with free food, weekly education sessions, mentorship pairings, and consulting projects to create an all-rounded experience to understanding Asia, China, and the global economy today.

 

Applications open at the beginning of each semester.
Summary: The mission of our club is to provide the collegiate community with a professional, educational and social platform to explore China under globalization.

Name: Asian InterVarsity Christian Fellowship
Description:
Asian InterVarsity Christian Fellowship is a home for individuals who seek to learn more about Jesus and be a part of the Asian/Pacific Islander American (A/PIA) community at the University of Michigan. We invite and welcome everyone regardless of background to our student-led small group Bible studies, large group gatherings on campus, leadership training, and thoughtful discipleship and life-changing conferences and events. 

AIV is affiliated with InterVarsity Christian Fellowship, a non-denominational parachurch campus ministry with over 1,000 chapters across the country that is a part of the International Fellowship of Evangelical Students (IFES). IFES is a global movement dedicated to seeing students built into communities of disciples, transformed by the gospel and impacting the university, the church and society for the glory of Christ, with more than half a million students in over 160 countries.

We are committed to:

  1. Welcoming and providing safe spaces for individuals seeking to learn more about Jesus and the intersection of their racial and ethnic identities,
  2. Being a part of the greater Asian/Pacific Islander American (A/PIA) community at the University of Michigan,
  3. Cultivating intimacy with God and growth in Christ-like character through personal and corporate disciplines, including the rigorous study of Scripture and regular prayer that expresses our faith, love, and dependence on God,
  4. Embracing Christ’s call to foster both divine and human reconciliation and restoration through an active pursuit of personal and systemic justice, and
  5. Transforming students and faculty, renewing campus, and developing world changers through the power of the gospel.
Summary: With a Pan-Asian focus, we want to establish and advance witnessing communities of students and faculty who follow Jesus as Savior and Lord: growing in love for God, God's Word, God's people of every ethnicity and culture, and God's purposes in the world

Name: Asian Pacific American Law Students Association
Description:
The Asian Pacific American Law Students Association (APALSA) is an organization of law students dedicated to advocating for the Asian Pacific American community at Michigan Law, providing academic and professional resources for our members, and creating a social and professional network to connect students and alumni. 

As part of our contributions to our members, we host social gatherings such as dim sum brunches and Lunar New Year's feasts, sponsor 1L Summer Fellowships for public interest and government work, and hold an annual gala celebrating our members, alumni, and work.
Summary: The Asian Pacific American Law Students Association (APALSA) serves as an academic, social and political resource for Asian Pacific American students in the Law School.

Name: Asian Pacific American Medical Student Association Undergraduate Chapter (APAMSA-UC)
Description:
APAMSA-UC’s goals are:

a) To promote the dissemination of information relative to Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) issues in the field of medical education;

b) To explore and possibly resolve the unique challenges, obstacles, and responsibilities specific to Asian American and Pacific Islander pre-medical students;

c) To provide opportunities for Asian American and Pacific Islander pre-medical students to give back to their community (i.e.) through service.

We offer:

  • Mentorship with University of Michigan medical students
  • Mentorship between upperclassmen and underclassmen
  • Wide array of volunteer opportunities
  • Health initiatives on campus 
  • Speaker events with medical professionals and students
  • Awareness of mental health within the AAPI community
  • A welcoming and strong community of pre-medical and pre-health students
  • Social events and collaborations with other student organizations
Summary: APAMSA-UC is a welcoming and strong community of passionate students who strive to raise awareness of Asian American and Pacific Islander Issues (AAPI) in medicine while providing guidance with the process of entering any health-related field.

Name: Asian/Asian American Psychology Student Association
Description: The Asian/ Asian American Psychology Student Association (APSA) is made up of psychology graduate students and faculty members at the University of Michigan with Asian/ Asian American backgrounds. APSA provides a warm support network and promotes the professional development of our members.
Summary: The Asian/Asian American Psychology Student Association is an organization of graduate students and faculty in psychology, seeking to enhance the development of Asian/Asian American psychologists and to increase awareness of relevant cultural issues.

Name: Asian/Pacific Islander American Students in Business
Description:
ASIB will provide professional resources in the forms of workshops, panels, and dialogues to develop and achieve students' academic and career interests. Through culture-based and social events, ASIB will foster community within A/PIA students interested in business and awareness throughout campus.

To join ASIB, please fill out: https://forms.gle/Kw7pr4oCnVVuJdzy5
Summary: ASIB is established for the purpose of guiding students of Asian/Pacific Islander American background to find personal and academic success in the business world through professional resources and strong community support.

Name: Association for Women in Mathematics UM Student Chapter
Description:
The  Association for Women in Mathematics (AWM) is a national organization, founded in 1971 "to encourage women and girls to study and to have active careers in the mathematical sciences, and to promote equal opportunity and the equal treatment of women and girls in the mathematical sciences."

The University of Michigan Student Chapter of the AWM was founded in the fall of 2016 to support women and non-binary mathematicians, especially graduate students, in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Michigan.

The AWM Chapter at Michigan primarily serves graduate students, post-docs, faculty, and staff.  We frequently partner with Women in Math, a club for undergraduate students.
Summary: The University of Michigan Student Chapter of the AWM supports women and non-binary mathematicians, especially graduate students, post-docs, and faculty members, in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Michigan.

Name: Association of Black Social Work Students
Description: Our mission is to enhance the quality of life for students of Black/African descent on the University of Michigan campus, and empower people of Black/African Descent through advocacy, community service, relationship building, and creating safe spaces for said groups to feel free from cultural persecution and stigma. Like our national chapter, ABSW-UM is guided by the Principles of the Nguzo Saba, which are Unity, Self-determination, Collective Work and Responsibility, Cooperative Economics, Purpose, Creativity, and Faith, and the Seven Cardinal Virtues of Ma’at, which are Right, Truth, Justice, Order, Reciprocity, Balance, and Harmony. In collaboration with other students groups, community organizations, and the national ABSW chapter, ABSWS will continue to leverage our collective expertise to help Black and African students on campus feel included and empowered, and assist the larger surrounding communities of African Descent in working toward social and cultural progress.
Summary: ABSWS is a student chapter of the National Association of Black Social Workers. Our goal is to foster the growth and development of Black/African students who are committed to addressing social issues faced by communities of Black/African descent.

Name: Association of Latino Professionals For America
Description:
ALPFA is the premier business organization for expanding opportunities for Latino Leadership in the global market. ALPFA creates opportunities, adds value, and builds relationships for its members, the community, and its business partners while expanding Latino leadership in the global workforce.

ALPFA provides many programs and benefits to aspiring Latino students interested in accounting, finance, consulting, or any career related to business professions. Benefits of student membership include access to scholarship opportunities, skills development workshops, networking with key hiring professionals and sponsors, and discounts on various ALPFA events.

Registration for the 2024-2025 school year will open in late August, 2024. Please visit our site and follow us on instagram to stay updated. For any other questions, please contact Ariza (ariza@umich.edu) or Valeria (valeriav@umich.edu).
Summary: ALPFA is the nation's leading Latinx/Hispanic professional association focused on business, finance, accounting, and related sectors. ALPFA is dedicated to enhancing opportunities for Latinx professionals along with its membership's holistic development.

Name: Association of Women Surgeons - Michigan Student Chapter
Description:
The Association for Women Surgeons (AWS) is a national organization that strives to meet the needs of women surgeons throughout their careers. The AWS Student Committee was created to unite medical student leaders across the country and develop shared resources to support and inspire female medical students interested in pursuing a career in surgery. The Michigan Student AWS Chapter links Michigan medical students with women surgical residents and attendings, organizes lunch lectures/talks given by women surgical leaders, and promotes community, outreach, and mentorship in the realm of surgery.

https://www.womensurgeons.org/
Summary: The mission of the Association of Women Surgeons is to inspire, encourage and enable women surgeons to realize their professional and personal goals.

Name: Astrology Club
Description:
The mission and purpose of the Astrology Club is to bring together any and all people with an interest in the ancient study and practice of Astrology. The club seeks to create and foster a welcoming, educational, and inclusive environment for anyone hoping to learn or discuss anything about astrology.

Groupme: https://groupme.com/join_group/87586691/Fn363b9x
Summary: This is a casual club for anyone interested in Astrology. Beginners to advanced, all are welcome!

Name: Athletes in Medicine
Description: AIM aspires to provide formal mentorship and assistance to student-athletes seeking a career in the medical field. This will be done through group-wide conferences, networking events, formal one—on—one advisory meetings, and other such endeavors where trainees and professionals in medicine (many of whom are former student-athletes) meet with student-athletes seeking such guidance.
Summary: AIM will provide formal mentorship and assistance to student-athletes seeking a career in the medical field.

Name: Athletics - Leadership Development
Description:
We help develop the intangibles

     - To build confidence, communications skills, and strength of purpose

     - We do this through workshops and mentorship

     - We integrate with lessons Student-Athletes are learning in the classroom and through their sport

 

Lead Yourself, Lead others, Lead Culture+
Summary: Leadership Development

Name: Atlas Consulting Group
Description: Atlas Consulting Group is an undergraduate consulting organization with the goal of giving undergraduate students the exposure to the field of consulting and providing them with relevant skills and knowledge to take forth to their professional careers. We also aim to make a positive impact on our community and on local businesses by giving them a new and fresh perspective on their business affairs.
Summary: We are an undergraduate student consulting group that provides consulting services to local businesses. We hope to make an impact on our community while giving our members the experience and skills to aid them in their professional careers.

Name: Atlas Digital Consulting Group
Description:
Technology is expanding faster than ever. In today’s increasingly tech-oriented world, keeping up to date with the latest innovations and technologies in the industry is a necessity towards a business’s success.

 

Our organization caters to this need by providing clients with the latest technological solutions. Our talented team of consultants based in the University of Michigan provides a wide range of services in full-stack development ranging from web development to machine learning solutions.

 

By providing technological solutions, not only are we able to help businesses and enterprises of all sizes and make a positive impact within our community, but we are also able to further develop our technical and soft skills, improving ourselves as students.
Summary: Atlas Digital is a student-run consulting group dedicated to making a positive impact by providing assistance to enterprises, businesses, start-ups, and nonprofits seeking technological solutions.

Name: Atmospheres Making Positive Moments
Description: Atmospheres Making Positive Moments (AM~PM) is established for the purpose of creating a positive and comforting atmosphere in the Michigan Medicine Hospital and local medical facilities in order to help medical personnel, patients, and their families achieve a wholesome healing experience. We promote a curative healing atmosphere by incorporating art and other means into the hospital or clinic to make an unfamiliar, isolating medical setting a more cheerful experience for everyone.
Summary: The goal of AM~PM is to create a positive, comforting atmosphere in the UM Hospital or other local medical facilities, such as assisted living communities, in order to help patients and their families achieve a wholesome healing experience.

Name: Audio Engineering Society (Student Section) at the University of Michigan
Description:
The University of Michigan Audio Engineering Society Student Section is part of a international society devoted exclusively to audio technology. The AES unites audio engineers, creative artists, scientists and students by promoting advances in audio and disseminating new knowledge and research.

The University of Michigan Audio Engineering Society Student Section is geared toward the diffusion and increase of educational and scientific knowledge in audio engineering, the stimulation of interest in audio engineering, and the promotion and maintenance of high professional standards among its members.
Summary: The Audio Engineering Society (Student Section) at the University of Michigan is part of a international society devoted exclusively to audio technology. It unites audio engineers, creative artists, scientists and students by promoting advances in audio.

Name: Autism Spectrum Club
Description: The purpose of this organization is intended to be a safe space strictly for Autistic people that is managed entirely by Autistic people. Its goals are to give us rest from the stress of life, provide social interaction in a way that fits us as Autistic people, give assistance navigating the issues of life, and give kindness and support to one another when we struggle. The club is intended to be low committal and low stress. We’re here to help, not to add another burden to your schedule. It’s counter-productive to the purpose of the club if it hurts more than it helps. If you are interested in joining, please contact aansbro@umich.edu.
Summary: A student organization that is intended to be a safe space strictly for Autistic people managed entirely by Autistic people.

Name: Automotive Enthusiasts Club
Description:
Automotive Enthusiasts is an automotive enthusiast club which aims to explore different aspects of the automotive industry. This includes bringing in speakers within the industry, hosting charitable car events, keeping the University of Michigan community up to date on the state of the automotive industry, and bringing together fellow car fanatics. 

​

Aspects of the Automotive Future Club:

 

Automotive events - Car shows aimed to excite the next generation of automotive enthusiasts, while raising donations for charitable organizations. 

 

Industry insights - Speakers from all over the automotive industry attending our meetings and speaking on their role in the industry, and how interested parties can get involved. 

 

Automotive news - Articles posted on the Automotive Future website, as well as an automotive news hour in which we discuss the most pressing news coming out of the automotive industry.

 

Automotive enthusiast gatherings - Social events designed to bring together UMich students who have a shared love of cars.
Summary: A student-run organization dedicated to automotive enthusiasm, the automotive industry in general, and inspiring the next generation of car fanatics.

Name: Autonomous Robotic Vehicle Team
Description:
The University of Michigan Autonomous Robotic Vehicle Team (UMARV) is a student-led project team founded in the fall of 2016, with the goal to create a fully autonomous robotic vehicle for the Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition held annually at Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan. We incorporate sensor fusion, path planning, computer vision, embedded systems, mechanical engineering, and more to provide our members with a hands-on introduction to autonomous robotics. We want to engage and educate our community about intelligent and autonomous systems, through outreach efforts like demos and hands-on workshops where audiences can interact with our vehicle and learn more about autonomous systems.

In 2024, we competed at IGVC and ended with a third place design finish, demonstrating our commitment to innovation. We will strive to improve our standing over the next academic year as we look to complete the Auto-Nav course and begin Self-Drive. Moreover, we will be scaling our vehicle to the size of a compact car over the course of the next several academic years.

All the work we do is driven by our core beliefs:

  • Hands-on education complements classroom learning
  • The work we do has a larger social impact
  • All students, regardless of their backgrounds, can participate in robotics

We envision a world where autonomous robotics is used to solve many problems that face us around the world, and it all starts here. We would like to invite you and your organization to become a part of our journey.

 

Check us out at umarv.com!
Summary: The University of Michigan Autonomous Robotic Vehicle Team aims to design, build, test and deploy a fully-autonomous robotic vehicle while providing hands-on engineering experience to its team members.

Name: Auxocardia
Description:
Auxocardia is a place for students and future providers to share in the process of becoming. It is a place for the heart growing, the heart-breaking, or literal questions about the heart. Auxocardia seeks to share the triumphs, trials, and tribulations of medical, social work, midwifery, nursing, dentistry and PA school.

It seeks to recognize the immense privilege of working in the healing professions, honoring the patients we serve, and recognizing the teachers who shape us, while also offering an honest take on the challenge of becoming a healthcare provider.
Summary: An organization for students and future healthcare providers that provides space for artistic and literary expression through journal publications.

Name: Aventus Investing
Description: Aventus is a group of individuals who invest with a donation based fund, currently around $5000 with the goal of beating the S&P 500. The group has two meetings per week with members expected to attend one per week, but are welcome and encouraged to come to both. This club specializes in its ability to allow all members to be involved as all members are expected to participate in discussions of what to invest in, and expected to pitch a few investments throughout the semester.
Summary: Aventus is a non profit investment club managing a small donation based portfolio. The group meets weekly where all members have the opportunity to pitch stocks and ideas, and the group decides what to do from there.

Name: Baits II Hall Council
Description: Dedicated residents of Baits II come together to aid in making the community better.
Summary: Dedicated residents of Baits II come together to aid in making the community better.

Name: Ballet Folklorico de Metztli
Description: Ballet Folklorico de Metztli is a dance organization that strives to teach about Mexico's traditional dances. Its main focus is to teach about Mexico's different styles/regions of dances. This org is open to everyone regardless of previous dance and culture experience. This is for anyone open to learning more about authentic Mexican culture through dance and music.
Summary: Ballet Folkloriko de Metztli celebrates Mexican heritage through traditional folklore dancing, offering members an immersive experience in Mexican culture, history, and traditions.

Name: Ballroom Dance Club
Description: Ballroom dancing is a class of partner dancing which includes Standard style dances such as Waltz, Foxtrot, Tango, Viennese Waltz, and Quickstep, and Latin dances such as Cha Cha, Rumba, Samba, Swing, Jive. The Club shall also promote other forms of social partner dancing such as Salsa and Hustle.
Summary: The Club shall focus on educating students and community members in all aspects of ballroom, Latin and social dancing.

Name: Ballroom Dance Team
Description:
The Ballroom Dance Team at the University of Michigan is a team comprised of over 100 active members from all majors, backgrounds, and at all levels. The team aims to foster and promote competitive ballroom dancing among the students at the university, and participates in the competitive collegiate ballroom circuit, traveling to competitions held at other universities across the Midwest. We compete every year at the National Collegiate Championships in Columbus, Ohio, and are proud to have won the National Championship every year since 2005!

The team offers lessons starting at the newcomer level, and no prior dance experience is necessary to join the team! We have two expert instructors, Steve and Susan McFerran, who have not only been among the top professional competitive ballroom dance couples in the world themselves, but have also judged at the highest levels including the current world professional Latin dance championship. They also coach Olympic-level ice dancers when they aren't teaching our team. We offer free lessons at the beginning of each semester, and the events can be found under the "events" tab or on Instagram. The welcome week events are completely commitment-free, but as all of our members know, ballroom dance will keep you wanting more! 

Aside from practices and competitions, we also have frequent social events, and have a close relationship with the community ballroom dance club. We are a tight-knit, diverse group of students with a love for ballroom dance, and all are welcome to join! Email us at ballroom-exec@umich.edu, or visit our website at michiganballroomteam.com for more information, photos, and videos!
Summary: The Ballroom Dance Team at the University of Michigan is competitive collegiate ballroom dance team that seeks to share our love of dance by fostering a fun and supportive environment, while striving for continuous improvement.

Name: Bangladeshi Students Association
Description:
The Bangladeshi Students Association's mission is to provide to students on campus a community-like space, while also promoting Bangladeshi culture. This is accomplished by creating an embracing environment in which students can create long-lasting connections with one another. Our main goal is to preserve the history, culture and traditions of Bangladesh by actively promoting the region, as well as raising awareness of issues pertaining to it.

Check out our instagram (@bsaumich) for upcoming events. Reach out to us via email/DM to get added into our newsletter and group chats!
Summary: We, the Bangladeshi Students Association at the University of Michigan, intend to create a community for Bangladeshi students and increase awareness of Bangladesh's issues pertaining to its people, culture, language, history, economics, and politics.

Name: Bankruptcy Law Society
Description: The Bankruptcy Law Society (BLS) provides a forum for law students and others in the university who are interested in all facets of bankruptcy law, including creditor rights, business reorganization, out of court workouts, sovereign debt defaults, liquidation, and individual debtor bankruptcy. BLS hosts guest speakers with expertise in this field, organizes Michigan Law students to participate in bankruptcy moot court competitions and conferences, and with a goal of promoting community service initiatives to help low-income individuals or struggling small businesses access bankruptcy counseling.
Summary: BLS is an organization for University of Michigan students studying law and related disciplines interested in debtor-creditor rights, liquidation procedures, and business reorganization.

Name: Barger Leadership Institute
Description:
Welcome to the Barger Leadership Institute:

The home for immersive and interdisciplinary undergraduate leadership experiences at the University of Michigan. Here, we take a holistic approach to help you explore, nurture, and realize your authentic leadership potential.  

Through the power of empathy, understanding, and mindfulness, we explore a leadership approach based on dedicated practice, deep human connection, and inspiration. Student members of the BLI have access to a diverse array of opportunities including leadership-based classes, grants and funding for special projects, retreats and trips, mindful and peace leadership workshops, and much more!

Do you want to join our immersive leadership community? Become a member by filling out our fast and easy form: Click here to join the BLI
Summary: A flexible leadership program for any Michigan undergraduate.

Name: Basement Arts
Description:
Basement Arts is a student theatre group housed within and subsidized by the University of Michigan Department of Theatre and Drama. Our goal is to produce high-quality, free theatre for the U-M and Ann Arbor communities. We strive to present not only plays but all types of performances free of charge. 
Basement Arts is student-run theatre organization that has given the University of Michigan and the Ann Arbor community FREE theatre for over 20 years! From classic dramas to contemporary farces, original musicals and late night events, there's something for everyone at Basement Arts.
 
Called “Ann Arbor’s best kept secret” by the Ann Arbor News, Basement Arts produces a different show almost every weekend of the school year (about 6-8 shows a year). Basement Arts has been a training ground for hundreds of aspiring actors, writers, directors, and designers. Our alum include Lucy Liu (Ally McBeal), Matt Letscher (Mask of Zorro), Jessica Cauffiel (Legally Blonde), Miriam Shor (Hedwig and the Angry Inch), and Tony Nominee Ceilia Keenan-Bolger (The Putnam County Spelling Bee).
 
All shows are directed, designed, and performed by students, allowing them to experiment and explore all aspects of theatre. Basement Arts continues to be a playground for artists, and the premiere venue for diverse and adventurous productions.
Summary: All shows are directed, designed, and performed by students, allowing them to experiment and explore all aspects of theatre. Basement Arts continues to be a playground for artists, and the premiere venue for diverse and adventurous productions!

Name: Basketball Club at Ross
Description: The Ross Basketball Club will provide an outlet for MBAs to coordinate court time and organize competitive basketball games while building lifelong friendships. In addition, the club will organize watch parties and Detroit Pistons field trips to stay engaged with the current happenings in the basketball world.
Summary: The Ross Basketball Club will provide an outlet for MBAs to coordinate court time, organize competitive basketball games, and arrange basketball related watch parties/events while building lifelong friendships.

Name: BBA Marketing Club
Description: The BBA Marketing Club is the University of Michigan’s primary undergraduate business marketing organization. Our membership consists of 120+ talented BBA, Ross Minor, and Ross One-Year Masters students pursuing marketing careers in a wide variety of industries and locations. We provide a platform for our members to learn more about the field of marketing and pursue career opportunities through exclusive networking events with top companies. These events include meet & greets, case studies, our annual Detroit and Chicago Treks, among others. Beyond recruitment, our members have access to our study breaks, resume reviews, and mentorship program. BBA Marketing Club is a great opportunity for students looking to exchange ideas and meet people with similar interests, while gaining academic and professional exposure to marketing.
Summary: BBA Marketing Club (BBAMC) is the original and largest marketing organization at the University of Michigan's Ross School of Business. BBAMC is designed to help students learn about and excel in marketing professionally.

Name: Best Buddies
Description:
Best Buddies matches U-M students with peers from Washtenaw County who have intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) to form one-on-one friendships. We host inclusive monthly events and attend outings in the Ann Arbor community.

Our application for the 2024-2025 school year is coming soon! Please email president Megan Loren (msloren@umich.edu) with any questions before that point!
Summary: Best Buddies matches U-M students with peers from Washtenaw County who have intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) to form one-on-one friendships. We host inclusive monthly events and attend outings in the Ann Arbor community.

Name: Beta Alpha Rho Pre-Law & Public Service Fraternity
Description: Our ultimate purpose is to create an inclusive bond, uniting students, teachers and professionals; to promote scholarship; to support community service and excellence; to foster professional competence; to promote the welfare of its members; and to encourage their cultural, intellectual and moral advancement. We accomplish this through a variety of professional development, community outreach, and internal fraternity events.
Summary: Beta Alpha Rho is a co-ed professional pre-law and public service fraternity committed to providing service to the greater community and campus; promoting a strong sense of fraternalism among members; and advancing members professionally and personally.

Name: Beta Mu Epsilon
Description:
Go to our website at http://betamuepsilonsite.wixsite.com/michigan to see more.

As a club we aim to accomplish the following:

a.) To promote biomedical engineering as a major and career path to incoming students

b.) To support the local and global biomedical engineering community

c.) To aid in networking between peers, faculty, and industry professionals

d.) To establish an industrial reputation for biomedical engineers

e.) To aid in career opportunity through professional development

g.) To provide mentorship to underclassmen interested in biomedical engineering

f.)  To foster personal development through leadership opportunities, service work, and intergroup dynamics
Summary: We offer opportunities for meeting classmates, service work, professional development, and leadership for undergraduates interested in the field of biomedical engineering. If you are interested, fill out our form (http://goo.gl/forms/YV8muKfe5T)

Name: Beta Theta Pi
Description:
Beta Theta Pi is a social fraternity dedicated to building men of principle for a principled life - focusing on academic success, responsible conduct, leadership development, community involvement, and a brotherhood built on trust, mutual assistance, and integrity.

 

For rush information go to: https://linktr.ee/michiganbeta
Summary: Beta Theta Pi is a social fraternity dedicated to building men of principle for a principled life - focusing on academic success, responsible conduct, leadership development, community involvement, and brotherhood.

Name: Beta Upsilon Chi
Description:
We are a lifelong brotherhood of committed Christian men seeking the bonds of brotherhood and unity in Christ through the avenue of a social fraternity on a college campus.

Established in 2013. 

Questions about rushing? Email ethanlan@umich.edu (President) for more information. 

RUSH BYX!
Summary: Beta Upsilon Chi, a National Christian Fraternity, exists for the purpose of establishing brotherhood and unity among college men based on the common bond of Jesus Christ.

Name: Beyond the Book: Feminist Activism Book Club
Description: We are a feminist book club that meets once a month on a book chosen by the group. We hope to inspire feminist activism on campus and offer opportunities to engage with feminist topics in the community. If you are interested in joining, you can contact us through this google form or contact us through the email below.
Summary: A feminist book club aimed to spark conversation and action and give space to different ideas and experiences in relation to feminism and identity.

Name: Beyond The Diag
Description: Beyond The Diag provides information, support and resources for students living off-campus. This can relate to housing, safety, wellness, community participation, and linking back to on-campus resources. We have an off-campus housing search website, as well as many other informational events and activities that take place throughout the year.
Summary: Beyond The Diag provides information, support and resources for students living off-campus. This can relate to housing, safety, wellness, community participation, and linking back to on-campus resources.

Name: Big Ticket Productions/UAC
Description:
Big Ticket Productions is the University of Michigan's premier concert-production organization. Our mission is to bring quality, big name entertainment to campus that students want to see and can enjoy at an affordable rate. BTP has brought artists such as Glass Animals, Chance The Rapper, The Chainsmokers, Lupe Fiasco, We The Kings, Schoolboy Q, Rich the Kid, A R I Z O N A, Electric Guest, and BBNO$ to Hill Auditorium for some of the biggest music events on the University of Michigan's campus.These concerts are not only for Michigan students but are open to the public--although the group's management is run solely by Michigan students.

Additionally, this club designs unique and creative events for students benefit like Michigan versions of the Price is Right and Family Feud. If you have an event you want to see happen on this campus, this is the place to help design it! 

Interested in learning more about planning concerts and events, then join Big Ticket today!

Your Campus, Your Entertainment.
Summary: Big Ticket Productions strives to provide quality, big name entertainment at an affordable rate for the University of Michigan student body.

Name: Bioastronautics and Life Support Systems
Description: BLiSS participates in NASA's X-HAB challenges. These are university-level challenges designed to develop strategic partnerships and collaborations with universities to help bridge knowledge gaps and increase knowledge in capabilities and technology risk reduction related to NASA’s vision and missions. Previous BLiSS X-HAB projects include turning human wastewater into nutrients for plants, designing and constructing a full-scale mock Mars habitat, 3D printing soil for plants, and creating cutting-edge user interfaces to advance the ways astronauts can interact with their habitats in space.
Summary: BLiSS is an independent project team started in 2015 by Professor Renno and several graduate and undergraduate students, with the goal of developing the necessary technologies to test and build technology for crewed deep-space missions.

Name: BioCatalyst
Description:
Our goal is to revolutionize the field of biological research by ensuring that the necessary resources and funding for impactful research are available to everyone. BioCatalyst offers a platform where students can access space, resources, funding, and guidance to bring their research ideas to life. Through this community, we aim to facilitate meaningful research and transform the culture of undergraduate biology not only at Michigan but also beyond.

We are dedicated to supporting student-led projects that have the potential to make a lasting global impact through the application of biology. Furthermore, we are committed to promoting inclusivity and expanding scientific education and opportunities for underrepresented groups. We believe that diversity plays a crucial role in driving progress and fostering innovation. With great enthusiasm, we are determined to pursue this mission and utilize biology as a means to create a brighter future for everyone.
Summary: BioCatalyst is a platform where students can access the space, resources, and guidance needed to bring their research ideas to life. Our mission is to foster a collaborative community at Michigan centered around biology that moves the world forward.

Name: Bioethics Society
Description: The Bioethics Society at the University of Michigan is for students interested in the humanities and social science aspects of medicine. Offering an alternative perspective of the medical field, we explore the controversial social and ethical issues impacting patients and their providers. Working with medical students, physicians, lawyers, and researchers, club members will discuss, debate, and discover the medical ethics behind patient autonomy, physician-assisted suicide, abortion, gene editing, Ai, and much more. The Bioethics Society offers numerous opportunities to grasp authentic ethical issues and real cases through the Center for Bioethics and Social Sciences in Medicine through Michigan Medicine. Check out our website here for more information!
Summary: The Bioethics Society is for students interested in the humanities aspects of medicine. Offering an alternative perspective of the medical field, we explore the controversial social and ethical issues impacting patients and their providers.

Name: Bioinformatics Graduate Student Association
Description: A student-run organization with two main goals: building community among the graduate students in DCMB and acting as a conduit between students and faculty/staff. BGSA hosts social events throughout the year, including social hours and a Friendsgiving (a potluck Thanksgiving for students). Another aspect of BGSA is placing students on departmental committees to increase student representation in the department.
Summary: A student-run organization with two main goals: building community among the graduate students in DCMB and acting as a conduit between students and faculty/staff.

Name: Biointerfaces Interlaboratory Committees
