Description: BIONIC is a student, post-doc, and staff (i.e. non-faculty) group dedicated to finding opportunities to foster collaboration among researchers within BI at the University of Michigan’s North Campus Research Complex. We aim to facilitate interactions that enhance the flow of knowledge across disciplines, labs, and individuals by taking advantage of overlapping physical location and goals. This engagement will result in paradigm-shifting discoveries; lead to deeper, more frequent discussion on interdisciplinary solutions to critical problems in biomedicine; and create a stronger sense of unity among those with similar interests but different home departments.
Summary: BIONIC is a student and post-doc group dedicated to finding opportunities to foster collaborations among researchers within the Biointerfaces Institute at the North Campus Research Complex.

Name: Biology Outreach Team
Description: BOT provides an opportunity for both undergraduate and graduate students to gain outreach experience, while promoting science to the public
Summary: The mission of BOT is to connect University of Michigan students with outreach opportunities in the biosciences

Name: Biology Student Alliance
Description:
Biology Student Alliance (BSA) is the largest biology-related student organization on campus with an aim to provide all students interested in biology a platform to socialize, connect with peers and mentors, help around the Ann Arbor community, and gain exposure to the different biology-focused career paths and topics. Through our academic talks, academic workshops, social events, and community service events, BSA encourages students to investigate new careers and research topics through our faculty and guest speaker presentations as well as our post-graduate panels. 

Email the executive board at bsa-eboard@umich.edu for more information. Also like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram. We look forward to having you onboard!
Summary: Biology Student Alliance (BSA) promotes the exploration and discussion of the field of biology. Events feature faculty and guest research presentations, student panels & professional workshops, and community service as well as mentoring and networking.

Name: Biomedical Engineering Graduate Student Council
Description: The Mission of the Graduate Student Council is to build community within BME at the graduate level through supporting BME initiatives and to advise the department on graduate student issues including curriculum, recruiting, visibility and placement.
Summary: The Mission of the Graduate Student Council is to build community within BME at the graduate level through supporting BME initiatives and to advise the department on graduate student issues including curriculum, recruiting, visibility and placement.

Name: Biomedical Engineering Society
Description: BMES is a group of undergraduate and graduate students who are committed to enriching the academic and professional lives of students passionate about Biomedical Engineering. BMES hosts a variety of technical, professional, volunteering, and social events over the course of the year in hopes to expand student's opportunities!
Summary: BMES is a group of students (undergrad+grad) interested in the biomedical engineering field. We host a variety of technical, professional, volunteering, and social events to expand student's opportunities!

Name: Biomedical Graduate Student Government
Description: BGSG is a graduate student organization at the Medical School composed of representatives from each training program in the Office of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies (OGPS). This encompasses all the 14 PhD programs at U-M Medical School (PIBS), the Medical Scientist Training Program (MSTP), and the Post-baccalaureate Research Education Program (PREP). Meetings are held each month to organize outreach and social events, more importantly to address any graduate student concerns by working closely with OGPS. We provide a sounding board for student concern, mentoring, a social network, and opportunities to be involved in the community.
Summary: Graduate Student Council for Biomedical Graduate students

Name: Biophysics Club
Description:
Biophysics is the branch of knowledge that applies the principles of physics and chemistry and the methods of mathematical analysis and computer modeling to understand how biological systems work. The Biophysics club is open to anyone interested in Biophysics! As a club, we have meetings every week to discuss research done in the field and to hear about each others' experience with biophysics. We also have other events like movie/game nights and study sessions! This club also can be the opportunity to connect to a worldwide community of Biophysicists through the Biophysical Society (BPS). Come meet people who share the same interest and passion! And learn more about what biophysics has to offer you and the world!
 
Meetings times change semesterly and are held in Chem 4041 (Biophysics Lounge). 
 
Please contact for info regarding meeting locations, as they are subject to change.
Summary: The Biophysics Club serves to provide opportunities for students to pursue an academic interest in the field of Biophysics and related disciplines, the sciences, and academic/industrial research.

Name: Biophysics Graduate Student Council
Description:
Purpose: Biophysics GSC was established to create events to meet the needs of the Biophysics graduate students, such as social events, workshops, and lectures. Biophysics GSC also will create outreach activities with the local community.

Mission: Our mission is to create a better social environment for the department’s graduate students and to further enrich the overall experiences of the graduate students.
Summary: Biophysics GSC was established to create events to meet the needs of the Biophysics graduate students, such as social events, workshops, lectures, and outreach events.

Name: Biorhythms
Description: Biorhythms is a medical student-run performance group that holds biannual shows on the University of Michigan campus.  Biorhythms welcomes all levels of participants, from beginners to advanced artists who have studied dance or music for years.  Past performances have included forms of dance from around the world, vocal performances, and instrumental pieces. Choreographers and band leaders meet with their groups once per week throughout each semester and the entire group assembles the week of the show for rehearsals.
Summary: Biorhythms is a medical student performance group that holds semiannual shows on the University of Michigan campus.

Name: Biostatistics Student Association
Description: The Biostatistics Student Association (BSA) is an organization that consists of master's and doctoral students studying biostatistics at the School of Public Health at University of Michigan. BSA offers students the opportunity further their professional and academic goals. BSA also organizes extracurricular activities, giving students the opportunity to get together on their leisure for events outside of the academia.
Summary: The Biostatistics Student Association (BSA) is a student-run organization that organizes academic, professional, and social events to supplement learning outside the classroom.

Name: BIPOC Builders
Description: BIPOC Builders is an organization open to all members of the University of Michigan community. Its goal is to help students of color find community, opportunity, and development both personally and professionally. With a focus on tech, business, entrepreneurship, and career development, the organization helps students gain the skills and network they need to thrive throughout their undergraduate journey and beyond.
Summary: By fostering an inclusive community, BIPOC Builders champions personal and professional growth, career opportunities, and holistic development to further advance and thrive students of color at the University of Michigan.

Name: BIPOC Peer Led Support Group
Description:
BIPOC Peer-Led Support Group (PLSG) is a partnership between the Sexual Assault Prevention and Awareness Center (SAPAC) and the Office of Multi-Ethnic Student Affairs (MESA). BIPOC PLSG is a confidential support group for survivors of color who have experienced sexual assault, intimate partner violence, stalking, and/or sexual harassment. We know that, while these experiences can be difficult for anyone, it can be particularly complex to be a survivor of color, especially at a predominantly white institution. BIPOC PLSG is a place to find not only community but healing opportunities, including anxiety reduction, self-care activities, mindfulness, and coping mechanisms!

 

If you are interested in attending our weekly meetings, please fill out the interest form to be added to our participant list. Meetings will be held in person on the 4th floor of the Michigan Union in room 4100. Our meeting schedule for the Fall 2024 is Wednesday from 5:00-6:00 pm in person. Visit our website for more information.
Summary: BIPOC PLSG is a confidential support group for survivors of color who have experienced sexual assault, intimate partner violence, stalking, and/or sexual harassment.

Name: Birdhouse Comics
Description:
A comics club where we create and publish original stories by the UMich community.  

Join us for comic art and writing workshops, story publication opportunities, comic competitions, and more!

Contact email: birdhousecomics-requests@umich.edu

Discord server: https://discord.gg/6y6QF6VCUJ
Summary: A comics club where we create and publish original stories by the UMich community.

Name: Black and Pink at the School of Public Health
Description: Black and Pink at SPH recognizes the harms of the prison industrial complex (PIC), particularly for people who identify across the LGBTQ+ spectrum and/or living with HIV/AIDS. While we are inspired by the rich history of queer and trans abolitionist organizing, we also acknowledge the ways in which public health and other health professions have participated in the ways in which the PIC targets marginalized groups. Black and Pink at SPH therefore seeks to establish a project that harnesses the resources and opportunities provided in a university setting to build community with and support LGBTQ+ individuals that are impacted by the PIC.
Summary: We establish a mutual aid project with incarcerated people who identify across the LGBTQ spectrum and their “free world” comrades. We engage in a pen pal program between incarcerated folks in MI and UM, raise awareness and send newsletters and art pieces

Name: Black Business Student Association
Description: The Black Business Students Association is a student organization at the Ross School of Business that serves to foster a supportive community and provide professional, social, and academic resources to graduate business students of color.
Summary: We, the members of the Black Business Students Association at the University Of Michigan Ross School of Business, are resolved to enhance and enrich the experience of graduate black students at the University of Michigan interested in business careers.

Name: Black Business Undergraduate Society
Description:
About the Black Business Undergraduate Society

The Black Business Undergraduate Society is committed to the professional development of its members. While we first emphasize achievement in the classroom, we secondly emphasize development of effective skills to thrive in professional settings. BBUS provides opportunities of professional learning and growth in various areas such as résumé development, interview preparation, networking, and personal branding.

Our Main Events

Diversity Conference (DivCo)

During recruiting season at the University of Michigan, the Black Business Undergraduate Society invites a variety of companies to campus for a series of interactive networking sessions and skill-building events where students are exposed to company cultures and opportunities. The goal of the Diversity Conference (DivCo) Career Fair is to provide the minority community with an intimate setting where they can showcase their skills and abilities while discovering their career path.

Case Competition

In an effort to deliver real-world experience to our members, BBUS hosts a Diversity Case Competition. This annual competition immerses students into strategic learning that will enhance business acumen and enable action-based learning. In addition to receiving coaching on public speaking and strategic planning, teams present their findings to corporate diversity recruiters and professionals, faculty, and audience members. Student teams compete to win a grand prize of $2000. This event is open to all undergraduate students at the University of Michigan.

Corporate Dinner

In an effort to thank our corporate sponsors for their dedication to BBUS and provide our members with more opportunity to network, BBUS hosts an annual formal dinner in Ann Arbor. At the Corporate Dinner, our top sponsors have the chance to connect with our members in an intimate dining setting. Prior to this event, BBUS organizes a professionally-guided etiquette dinner to adequately prepare our members for dining in a formal setting.

Creating value for our members

Corporate Relations

Companies such as Goldman Sachs, Google, PwC, and GM have assisted with the development of our members. Throughout the semester, BBUS hosts several events with our sponsors. Presentations range from personal branding to developing technical skills, in order to give our members an advantage in professional settings. There is also an opportunity for a company to host social events to engage and network with our members on a more personal level, and provide insight into the company culture.

Philanthropy

BBUS understands that social responsibility is a critical pillar in any business leader’s personal and career development. Each semester, we organize a community service or philanthropy event, offering our members the opportunity to give back.

Social Awareness

BBUS understands that we have the responsibility to be aware of, communicate, and advocate for the rights of those underrepresented within the University of Michigan and greater professional world. We focus on the problems of our members and how to solve these within our organizational work.

Professional Development

BBUS holds the responsibility to prepare our members for professional situations in the realm of networking, professional documents, interview prep, and on the job professionalism.
Summary: BBUS equips minority students with the skills they need to maximize their full career potential in all business-related professions by facilitating academic, professional, and social development.

Name: Black Film Society
Description:
Black Film Society’s mission is to foster a collaborative community space for creative Black students and alumni at the University of Michigan. We are committed to sharing knowledge, networking, and providing pathways into the entertainment industry. We are a space for students to share their interest in film, television, and media.

 

PLEASE NOTE: We do not have access to any messages that are sent to use via the "contact" button. If you want to contact Black Film Society, please send an email to bgbates@umich.edu. Thank you!
Summary: Black Film Society is a collaborative community space for creative Black students to connect, share knowledge, and receive pathways into the entertainment industry. We are a space for students to share their interest in film, television, and media.

Name: Black Graduate Student Association at the University of Michigan
Description:
The Black Graduate Student Association at the University of Michigan purpose is to develop the academic and social potentials of its members and to provide an environment of support and cultural enrichment within the University of Michigan community through involvement in:

  1. Academic support and collaboration;

  2. Community Affairs;

  3. Networking opportunities amongst the University of Michigan community and Alumni ;

  4. Culturally relevant Academic and Social discussions

 Mission

The Black Graduate Student Association (BGSA) aims to develop the academic and social potentials of its members and to provide an environment of support and cultural enrichment within the University of Michigan community through involvement in actions that advance equity and promote a supportive environment for Black graduate students at UM to thrive. We work with key stakeholders across campus and engage in meaningful solidarity with community-led movements at UM and beyond.
Summary: The Black Graduate Student Association purpose is to develop the academic and social potentials of its members and to provide an environment of support and cultural enrichment within the University of Michigan community.

Name: Black Law Student Association at the University of Michigan Law School
Description:
It shall be the purposes of BLSA:

a) To articulate and promote the professional needs and goals of Black law students at the University of Michigan Law School;

b) To foster professional competence among Black law students at the University of Michigan Law School;

c) To examine and cultivate a greater awareness of the relationship of Black law students and Black attorneys to the American legal system;

d) To influence the legal community to bring about meaningful change in and through the legal system to meet the needs of the Black community;

e) To facilitate successful matriculation through the law school process;

f) To create and maintain active relationships between BLSA and the larger law school and university communities;

g) To provide an environment which cultivates camaraderie among Black law students.
Summary: It shall be the purposes of BLSA: To articulate and promote the professional needs and goals of Black law students at Michigan Law and to foster professional competence among Black law students at Michigan Law.

Name: Black Maternal Equity Collective
Description:
The United States is experiencing a concerning rise in maternal mortality, with the current mortality rate for Non-Hispanic Black women being four times higher than for Non-Hispanic White women. Despite this issue's prevalence, Black women's plight in this country is often ignored. Additionally, being free of common risk factors, including economic instability, limited healthcare access, and unsafe housing, cannot prevent these disparities. Implementing social justice interventions and supporting community-based practices that contribute to better health outcomes for birthing people and their children, particularly in communities of color, is critical. This issue is a culmination of racism, misogynoir, and systematic policy and healthcare failures that place Black mothers and babies in vulnerable and life-threatening situations. The ethnocentric biomedical model in our healthcare system, homogeneity, and the impact of systemic racism and implicit bias in the healthcare field will continue to fail marginalized communities if we do not take the necessary steps to address this issue. 

 

This organization aims to use an interdisciplinary approach and implement advocacy measures for Black birthing people through outreach, public health, policy work, doula/midwifery labor support, and community-based interventions. We want to raise awareness on this issue, creating a safe space for meaningful critical discussions and formulating ways to make changes within our communities through doula labor support, partnerships with public health organizations, policy outreach, and more. The maternal health disparity among Black women requires a multifaceted intervention incorporating representations of different academic and industry backgrounds from policy to public health. This organization serves as a community of members of diverse backgrounds passionate about protecting the lives of Black birth givers and children and who believe that becoming a mother should not be a life-or-death sentence.
Summary: This organization aims to use an interdisciplinary approach and implement advocacy measures for Black birthing people through outreach, public health, policy work, doula/midwifery labor support, and community-based interventions.

Name: Black Medical Association
Description:
The BMA serves as an academic, social, and professional support network for its members, as well as a service organization for the community. We are committed to addressing the special health needs of the African American community, educating ourselves and the greater medical student community on issues of minority health and the elimination of racial/ethnic health care disparities. We organize and implement programs that target premedical students and prepare them not only for the medical school application process but also expose them to the medical profession and critical health care issues.

 

Furthermore, the BMA is a member of the Student National Medical Association (SNMA), a national organization for medical and premedical students of color, organized around similar issues. Here at the University of Michigan the BMA is more than just a student organization, it is a special unique community in which we support, motivate, inspire, encourage, and uplift one another as we simultaneously work toward achieving our goals.
Summary:
The primary missions of the Black Medical Association (BMA)
are to recruit and retain Black students at the University of Michigan Medical School and to address and bring awareness to health disparities in the surrounding communities.

Name: Black Radical Healing Pathways
Description: Black Radical Healing Pathways (BRHP) strives to create and build spaces centered for Black students to develop and explore radical ideas interested in racial social justice efforts on campus as a coalition. Black Radical Healing Pathways/BRHP works to create and build a network where Black students can affirm, heal and validate each other’s lived experiences. We aspire to organize, educate, mobilize and empower Black Students to work for transformative change on campus, neighborhoods and communities. Our focus is to nourish and cultivate the fighting spirits, critical consciousness and aesthetics of Black Students. We aim to hold programming which centers our Black voices, intelligence, and bodies in efforts to dismantle, disrupt, and challenge white supremacy
Summary: Black Radical Healing Pathways (BRHP) is a collective organization that focuses on providing supports and healing spaces for members of the Black Community. We also provide educational and cultural workshops to promote the need for Afro-centric healing.

Name: Black Scholars in Dance
Description: Black Scholars in Dance is an organization dedicated to creating a community of black dancers at University of Michigan. Although its roots are from within the Department of Dance, it is open to all students, who love dance. We aspire to foster black dance education, create a supportive community, and to dance!
Summary: Black Scholars in Dance is an organization dedicated to creating a community of black dancers at University of Michigan.

Name: Black Student Athlete Alliance
Description: The Black Student Athlete Alliance's goal is to be the community and support incoming student-athletes need. We plan to help students of African descent by hosting meetings and events where they can be themselves and have a safe space.
Summary: The Black Student Athlete Alliance's goal is to be the community and support incoming varsity student-athletes' need. We plan to help students who have African descent host meetings and events where they can be themselves and have a safe space.

Name: Black Student Psychological Association
Description:
The Black Student Psychological Association (BSPA) is an organization of Black students seeking to enhance the development of Black psychologists, create valid methods and techniques in the investigation of Black people, and in general to promote skills in the application and utilization of psychological principles as they relate to Blacks. The University of Michigan chapter was formed in 1969 to deal mainly with the recruitment and support of Black graduate students and faculty.

At its height, membership rose to more than 60 students, and the University of Michigan became a leader in the training of Black Ph.D.'s in Psychology.

During the early 1970's, the Department received more than 100 Black applications annually. The Department of Psychology has always entrusted BSPA with the responsibility of reviewing all applications from Black students prior to going to the area admission committees. Through this endeavor, commitment to the support of its members, both socially and academically, as well as an effort to actively recruit and prepare Black undergraduates for graduate study, BSPA became one of the most respected organizations on campus.

The BSPA maintains the respect of the University of Michigan by continuing to be an active force in recruitment of graduate students of color in psychology. In addition, the organization continues to provide social and academic support for its members, and also strives to be an active force in the community. Most recently, the organization has begun efforts to strengthen its ties with BSPA alumni. In so doing, the organization aims to both create a viable resource for support and professional socialization and acknowledge the accomplishments of a rich legacy. A large portion of BSPA's strength lies in its history. May the legacy continue.
Summary: Black students in psychology organized to develop relationships throughout the university and field; recruit students from diverse backgrounds into psychology; and support current graduate Black psychology students.

Name: Black Student Union
Description: We accomplish our mission by producing entertaining and educational programming, hosting bi-weekly mass meetings, offering funding to other organizations, and providing a safe atmosphere for our community to call home.
Summary: The purpose of the BSU is to promote and sustain an atmosphere that is conducive to the political, cultural, social, spiritual, economic, and educational growth of students of African descent and the University community at-large.

Name: Black Students in Aerospace
Description:
Black Students in Aerospace (BSA) at the University of Michigan is a student organization committed to increasing the visibility of Black people in the aerospace and aviation industry. At BSA, we aim to create an academic and social community amongst those already pursuing a space-related education at UMich, as well as to foster participation in the industry for interested outsiders.

  

From our inception in February 2020, BSA has put on events that speak to the accomplishments of Black engineers and scientists. We have organized multiple panel discussions for members of the College of Engineering featuring the voices and experiences of Black students, professors, and alumni. BSA strives to initiate and facilitate positive dialogue between Black students and the UM Aerospace Department, and we now work in conjunction with the College of Engineering’s Office of Culture, Community and Equity (OCCE) to address issues that Black Aerospace students face at UM.

  

We also promote our members' professional development skills through hosting events with companies that span from resume workshops to crash courses about various aerospace careers. We sponsor members to attend a number of conferences throughout the year including SciTech, an annual conference put on by the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) for engineers to learn about advances in aerospace research, development, and technology. Recently, we sent 14 of our members to the National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) annual convention in March 2024, to help them secure jobs and build relationships with industry experts.

  

BSA works tirelessly to ensure that Black students feel empowered and confident in their pursuit of an education in the aerospace industry. Students of all races, ethnicities, and majors are welcome to help us bring our vision to life!

  

For more information about BSA, visit our Instagram and LinkedIn, or email bsaerospace@umich.edu.
Summary: The focus of BSA is to create an academic and social community amongst students interested in Aerospace and Astronautics at the University of Michigan

Name: Black Undergraduate Dental Association
Description: The purpose of BUDA is to foster a community that supports Black students aspiring to have a career in dentistry. The Black community and businesses have been historically marginalized, leading to disparities in oral health treatment and coverage. To combat these inequities, we provide resources and opportunities to help students thrive academically and professionally in a field that they are underrepresented in. The space we create will allow students to maximize success in their classes, extracurriculars, and studies for professional school assessments. Additionally, we offer students guidance for professional school requirements and applications. We aim to provide meaningful relationships with like-minded undergraduate students, graduate students, and dental professionals. We also offer volunteering and community service opportunities for students to support our local communities.
Summary: The purpose of BUDA is to foster a community that supports Black students aspiring to have a career in dentistry. The space will allow students to maximize success in their classes, extracurriculars, and studies for dental school assessments.

Name: Black Undergraduate Kinesiology Association
Description: Our main purpose is to foster an open and supportive community for Black students in the school of kinesiology through mentorship, academic guidance, and peer empowerment. We value the individual experiences of each of our members as this organization provides a space for us to encourage the various career paths one can embark on post-graduation. As there are many kinesiology related professions, we aim to establish mentor relationships between our members and alum in their desired fields.
Summary: The Black Undergraduate Kinesiology Association (BUKA) aims to foster an open and supportive community for Black students in the school of kinesiology through mentorship, academic guidance, and peer empowerment despite individual majors.

Name: Black Undergraduate Law Association
Description: Our principle aim is to serve as a bridge of information and support at all the various stages of our diverse memberships’ pre - professional development. Some of the services that BULA provides to accomplish these goals are discounts and scholarships on LSAT preparation, LSAT strategy workshops , community service activities, lectures by informed pre - law advisors and helpful advice on how to best navigate our fellowships’ academic careers. We are more than just an organization dedicated to the success of our members, but a caring community of minority scholars sincere in our efforts to make a difference in the lives of all we meet.
Summary: The Black Undergraduate Law Association is a student run, pre-professional organization that seeks to inform and empower motivated UM students to pursue the vast opportunities and rewards of a legal career.

Name: Black Undergraduate Medical Association
Description: The main objective of the Black Undergraduate Medical Association (BUMA) is to develop an open, progressive community for Black students who aspire to become professionals in the fields of health and medicine at the undergraduate level. We promote and supply educational opportunities for students to learn about different aspects of health and medicine from the perspective of the Black community. We also provide students on the medical and health tracks with the necessary tools to prepare for the transition into medical or professional school programs. We highlight scholastic achievements by supporting students through their academic endeavors and personal development. We also aim to build strong, healthy relationships with health and medical professionals, current medical students at the University of Michigan, and local high school students to increase opportunities in mentorship, research, career, etc.
Summary: BUMA is a vibrant community that promotes opportunities to learn about health/medicine from the perspective of the Black community and equips students with the tools to prepare for the transition into medical or professional programs.

Name: Black Undergraduate Psychological Association
Description: The Black Undergraduate Psychological Association aims to provide academic, professional, and social support to Black undergraduate students who are interested in psychology and/or pursuing a degree in psychology. BUPA will also facilitate opportunities for Black undergraduate students to engage in research, internships, and other experiential learning opportunities in the field of psychology. BUPA will promote diversity, equity, inclusion, and well-being in the field of psychology and in the broader community and foster a sense of community and belonging among Black undergraduate students who are interested in psychology. Lastly, BUPA will provide educational programming and events that highlight the experiences and perspectives of Black individuals in the field of psychology.
Summary: The Black Undergraduate Psychological Association aims to provide academic, professional, and social support to Black undergraduate students who are interested in psychology and/or pursuing a degree in psychology.

Name: Black Undergraduate Public Policy Society
Description: The Black Undergraduate Public Policy Society (BUPPS) will cater to black undergraduate students' unique needs and interests, pursuing diverse career paths in governance through positive activism that promotes the innovation of solutions to problems and injustices in our community, state, nation, or world. BUPPS is an organization dedicated to its members and encourages the implementation of policy ideas based on their interests and passions. BUPPS aims to be a resource for the University of Michigan students to address distinct aspirations, work with existing activist communities to explore issues of common interest, and address solutions together.
Summary: The Black Undergraduate Public Policy Society (BUPPS) will cater to black undergraduate students' unique needs and interests, pursuing diverse career paths in governance through positive activism that promotes the innovation of solutions to problems.

Name: Black Welcome Week
Description: Black Welcome Week is a multicultural celebration composed of a weeklong events schedule, which exceeds to create an inviting environment for minority first year students, transfer students, as well as upperclassmen.  It allows various campus organizations to collaborate and develop events that will be conducive in providing minority students with an introduction to life at Michigan and it serves as an opportunity to begin or continue to develop a strong support and network system.
Summary: The purpose of Black Welcome Week is to create a welcoming environment for the incoming minority freshmen as well as for the upperclassmen. It allows various campus organizations to collaborate and develop events that will be conducive to students

Name: Black@SI
Description: The Black@SI is an academic and social support network that serves Black students, faculty, alumni, and allies of the University of Michigan School of Information (UMSI). Through our programming, we help ensure that underrepresented students can successfully contribute to both scientific research and the college’s learning environment, and positively impact our communities.
Summary: The Black@SI is an academic and social support network that serves Black students, faculty, alumni, and allies of the University of Michigan-School of Information (UMSI).

Name: BlackGen Capital Inc.
Description: BlackGen Capital is a premiere minority-owned investment fund led by talented students from chapters across the nation. We close the access gap by creating a pipeline for talented, underrepresented students interested in entering the financial services industry. Each chapter across the nation provides BlackGen Capital members with a standardized 10-week educational series, where students learn the fundamentals of finance. After receiving this thorough training, students across different schools have a unique opportunity to propose stock investment ideas to the national BlackGen Capital investment fund. Along with our education, our students have direct access to corporate sponsors and exclusive career opportunities.
Summary: BlackGen Capital is a premiere minority-owned investment fund led by talented students from chapters across the nation. We close the access gap by creating a pipeline for talented, underrepresented students interested in entering financial industries.

Name: Blank Space Workshop
Description:
Blank Space Workshop aims to promote and support new performance-orientated creative writing; such as stageplay, screenplay and musicals. It's a space for student writers to mature their craft with the work that they bring to us.

Blank Space puts on three new student works a semester, workshop style. We will select the season through a pitching process — two of the three will get two weeks of workshops and rewrites and collaboration with volunteering actors and a director (a 29 hour process, if you will) which will culminate in staged readings for two performances (scripts in hand, very casual) in front of an audience for more critiques. The third show will be a four week process to workshop  with their team and may feature a more realized performance of the work 

The point of Blank Space Workshop is not to produce finished work or full productions. Rather, we hope to provide a space for emerging projects, early drafts and young pieces of original theatre to grow and mature. Through the workshop process the writer and director will collaborate with the actors to make changes to the piece and help it grow into itself. The staged readings will be an extension of this process—inviting more people into the conversation about the piece and its’ potential.
Summary: Blank Space Workshop is a student organization dedicate to the development of new student performance-based creative writing, from stageplays to screenplays to musicals and beyond.

Name: Blood Drives United
Description:
Blood Drives United (BDU), sponsored by the Michigan Medicine Transplant Group and Wolverines For Life, is a student-run volunteer organization dedicated to the promotion, organization, and staffing of campus-wide blood drives. BDU empowers students, staff, faculty, and community members to make a difference in a local and international public health crisis. The purpose of BDU is to organize blood drives on campus and thereby provide the staff, faculty, and students of the university, as well as the surrounding community, the opportunity to donate blood and save lives. BDU seeks to raise blood donation awareness and educate the community and university population about the importance of and benefits of blood donation.

https://www.bloodbattle.org
Summary: Blood Drives United is a student-run volunteer organization dedicated to the promotion, organization, and staffing of campus-wide blood drives. BDU educates about the need for blood and provides opportunities to save lives and contribute to communities.

Name: Blue Bop Jazz Orchestra / UAC
Description: Blue Bop Jazz Orchestra is the newest and grooviest swing band to hit the streets of Ann Arbor! Established in 2018, BBJO is the premier student-run big band on campus. Click here for our full Winter 2023 Concert Click here for our full Spring 2023 Concert
Summary: Blue Bop Jazz Orchestra is the newest and grooviest swing band to hit the streets of Ann Arbor!

Name: Blue Design
Description: We are a team of medical students with professional engineering skills and experience who are passionate about product development and healthcare innovation. We offer engineering design services in two distinct ways: (1) consulting services delivered to individual client teams and (2) hands-on workshops to review important topics and develop skills. As an engineering consulting group, we work with researchers, educators, and innovators at Michigan Medicine who are in need of low-cost and accessible engineering solutions ranging from formal prototyping and product development to 3D modeling and fabrication. In addition to offering design services, we also lead educational workshops that cover topics such as "An Introduction to 3D Printing" and "Brainstorming and Concept Development" so that client teams are empowered to expand their internal design capabilities. At Blue Design, we welcome individuals from all backgrounds and levels of experience to join us in our mission to create a better future for healthcare innovation.
Summary: Blue Design connects innovators at Michigan Medicine to engineering design services, and leads educational workshops to empower clients' internal design capabilities.

Name: Blue Jitsu
Description:
Blue Jitsu is a Student Organization where the members will get a chance to learn Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. We hope to create a community where BJJ can help us become stronger, and more confident, and teach us how to act calmly under pressure. Members of the club train through on-campus open mats as well as at a local Jiu-Jitsu gym under a professor. We are open to all undergrad and grad students, as well as faculty members.

Join our Groupme.

If you have any interest in joining or questions, email Ishan Nyati (inyati@umich.edu).
Summary: Blue Jitsu is an Student Organization where the members will get a chance to learn Brazilian Jiu Jitsu techniques, practice their skills, be a part of a strong and healthy community.

Name: BLUE Missions at the University of Michigan
Description:
BLUE at the University of Michigan educates on cultural immersion, safety, and travel preparation for service trips. We also raise money for a Michigan student immersion trip. As an outreach club, we work closely with the nonprofit, BLUE Missions Group and are committed to their mission.

BLUE Missions is ensuring sustainable access to clean water and sanitation while cultivating a generation of global citizens through reflection, education, and service-driven travel. BLUE stands for Building Love, Uniting Everyone, and is committed to combating the global water and sanitation crisis. BLUE is driven to cultivate a generation of global citizens: An individual who believes they have a civic responsibility to make a change or a difference in their local, national, and global community. They understand that we are all connected and work towards making the world more sustainable, fairer, and peaceful.
Summary: We are an outreach club that informs students on BLUE Missions, a non-profit that builds aqueducts and latrines in the Dominican Republic, and recruits for a Michigan student service immersion trip.

Name: Blue Model United Nations
Description:
BlueMUN is the University of Michigan’s only competitive Model United Nations team. Founded in 2016 by two Michigan undergraduates with the goal of competing on the national collegiate Model UN circuit, BlueMUN gives members a space to engage in their shared interests of debate and international affairs. Our team is proud to be one of the Top 50 ranked collegiate teams in the nation, and with several of the largest conferences and many awards under our belts, our team is continuously growing and improving.

 

Model United Nations, or Model UN, is a simulation of the United Nations, its subsidiary organizations, and other national or international bodies. MUN conferences are 4-day long endeavors where student delegates participate in themed committees by writing and debating problem-solving memos. Typically, delegates participate in one of three basic committee structures: General Assembly committees, where delegates represent nations; Crisis committees, where delegates represent individuals and react to fast-paced news updates; and specialized committees, which are effectively a combination of the former two.
Summary: Blue Model United Nations (BlueMUN) is Michigan's only competitive Model United Nations team.

Name: Blue Records
Description: Blue Records is a record label on campus that dedicates to bridging the gap between singers and music producers and thus helping students who possess music dreams make their first step forward. We aim at fueling music dreams and powering future music stars. Our activities include song recording, audio editing and mixing, songwriting workshops, music distribution, audio technology workshops, instrument practicing sessions, etc. We hope that the professional song production process will stop being a barrier for our artists to show their talents.
Summary: Blue Records dedicates to bridging the gap between singers and music producers and thus helping students who possess music dreams make their first step forward. We aim at fueling music dreams and powering future music stars.

Name: Blue Tide Capital
Description: Student-led organization for those interested in investing without the pressure of high-stakes trading. We discuss market trends, personal finance, and investment strategies in a relaxed, collaborative environment. Whether you're new to investing or experienced, our club invites all to join. At the University of Michigan there are so many competitive clubs which could pose as a barrier for people looking to get into learning more about investing. Our club is an easy way for students to gain more experience and knowledge in the world of investing.
Summary: At the University of Michigan there are so many competitive clubs which could pose as a barrier for people looking to get into learning more about investing. Our club is an easy way for students to gain more experience and knowledge in investing

Name: BLUElab
Description:
Stay in the loop during recruitment season by joining our 2024-2025 Interest Form!

 

Summary: 

BLUElab is an organization currently made up of 5 project teams to foster a collaborative environment and support each other as each undergoes the socially-engaged design process. Each team works with stakeholders to address identified needs in their respective local or international community. We encourage students to seek out opportunities to hone their inter and intrapersonal skills, engage in social responsibility, participate in an interactive design experience, and develop as servant leaders.

 

Mission:

The mission of BLUElab is to build a network of project teams to effectively share knowledge and resources between teams to undergo the socially-engaged design process to implement socially, economically, and environmentally sustainable technology.

 

Vision :

We hope to see BLUElab teams reflect our values throughout their projects utilizing a strong, supportive community. We will strive to be a leader on campus, preparing students to practice socially-engaged design and think through every aspect of an issue. We will develop conscious leaders who impact industry, government, and academia through their commitment to social responsibility and sustainability.

 

Values: Adapt, Engage, Include, Reflect, Grow, Be Thorough

 

The Socially Engaged Design Process:

The socially engaged design process requires project teams to take into account social, cultural, economic, and environmental contexts of their designs and implement this during their projects. This starts with a needs assessment to fully understand a community’s needs. It also involves working with the community at every stage of the design process, to create a self-sustaining project that can last without team presence. As an organization, we place heavy emphasis on building a strong partnership.

 

Our Teams:

 

Sa’Nima’ Collaborative

Sa’ Nima’ is a multidisciplinary team focused on improving the lives of CasaSito scholars and their families in San Crisóbal, Guatemala, through engineering solutions.

Partner: CasaSito, an educational NGO.

Location: San Cristóbal, Guatemala

Project: Hand-powered washing machines and ventilated wood-burning stoves to reduce household labor and health risks. Future plans include an additional rainwater collection project.

Desired skills/majors: Open to all engineering and non-engineering majors!

 

BLUElab Metro

Metro focuses on bringing sustainable solutions to local communities through the socially engaged engineering design process, this year working towards helping Willow Run Acres optimize their processes for sustainability.

Location: Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti
Partner: Willow Run Across (Ypsilanti-based community farm)
Projects: Solar panel installation and smart water irrigation system

Desired skills/majors: Anyone interested in community farming and/or local sustainability; mechanical, electrical, and civil/environmental engineering

 

BLUElab Woven Wind

Woven Wind is focused on building small-scale wind turbines for schools and communities in conjunction with educational outreach designed to teach kids about engineering and renewable energy.

Partner: Will be deciding new partnership this semester
Location: Ann Arbor, possibly elsewhere
Project: Building and testing a wind turbine, creating an interactive application to be powered, and perform outreach with students

Desired skills/majors: Engineering, CS, SI, PitE, Business, Education

 

BLUElab EASE

EASE stands for Enabling Accessibility through Sustainable Engineering- we work towards independence and improved quality of life for people with disabilities, while emphasizing sustainability and accessibility.

Partners: Ann Arbor Public Schools, FNE International.
Locations: Ann Arbor, MI, León, Nicaragua.
Projects: Foldable lunch tray attachment, assistive seating device for children with Cerebral Palsy.

Desired skills/majors: Anyone interested!

 

BLUElab Data

BLUElab Data is a multidisciplinary student-run design team open to all students interested in building their data skills.

Partner: East Quad and other MDining halls.
Location: Ann Arbor, MI.
Project: Food waste reduction by increasing data collection and data utilization.
Desired skills/majors: Data/computer science, information analysis, math, stats, PitE.
Summary: BLUElab is a collaborative organization made of five project teams focused on addressing their local or international community's needs through the socially-engaged design process.

Name: BLUElab Data
Description: We are a multidisciplinary student-run design team, open to students interested in building their data skills. We focus on promoting sustainability, providing our members with real-world skills, and bringing true value to our community partners. BLUElab Data is one of the five BLUElab sub-teams on campus.
Summary: A project-based student organization with the primary focus of using data analysis and visualization to meet our partners' sustainability goals while improving our community's environmental aspects.

Name: BlueLab EASE
Description:
BLUELab EASE is a multidisciplinary, student-run team focused on implementing socially engaged engineering solutions that improve quality of life for people with disabilities, both locally and internationally. Our team has two current projects: one working within a community in Leon, Nicaragua, and another working right here in Ann Arbor. For our Nicaragua project, we are designing an assistive seating device for children in this area who have cerebral palsy. This project is being completed alongside our two partnering nonprofit organizations, FNE International and SPTLN. For our local project in Ann Arbor, we are teaming with Ann Arbor Public Schools to bring accessible design to the classroom. We aim to collaborate with community partners and local non-profits to create sustainable products that improve quality of life for people with disabilities.


If you're interested in our team or have any questions, contact leadership members at bluelab-ease-requests@umich.edu!
Summary: BLUElab EASE designs and implements socially engaged engineering solutions that improve quality of life for people with disabilities, both locally and internationally.

Name: BLUElab Metro
Description:
BLUElab Metro (BLUEM) is a multidisciplinary design student organization dedicated to serving our local community of southeastern Michigan under the tenets of sustainability and socially-engaged design. As an affiliate of the University of Michigan and peers of the other BLUElab project teams, we are made up of dedicated problem-solvers working for the betterment of communities around the globe.

 

BLUEM focuses first on co-design through cooperation with our community partners in all projects. To do this, we follow the fundamentals of socially-engaged design: an iterative process where community members are at the center of the decision-making, problem identification, and development of solutions. To maximize the effectiveness and impact of our work, we incorporate the environmental, human, social, and economic aspects of sustainability. Using these techniques lead to designs with greater contextual awareness and a greater chance of long-term success. 

 

This year we are working with the University and the City of Ann Arbor on both of their Climate Neutrality goals. Our projects enable students to have a measurable impact on real climate initiatives while on campus. Check out our website and Instagram to see our current projects.

 

Instagram: @bluelab_metro

BLUEM Website
Summary: BLUElab Metro is an interdisciplinary student project team dedicated to co-designing sustainable technology in partnership with local communities.

Name: BLUElab Sa' Nima' Collaborative
Description: Sa’ Nima’ Collaborative has partnered with CasaSito, an educational NGO in San Cristóbal, Guatemala, for the past 10 years. Our team’s mission is to use engineering solutions to improve the lives of CasaSito scholars and their families. Over the past few years, our team has prototyped hand-powered washing machines and ventilated wood-burning stoves to save the families time washing clothes and to alleviate health problems caused by inhaling smoke. Members of our team traveled to San Cristóbal in May 2023 and again in May 2024 to implement these washing machines and stoves in the homes of families in the community. This past May, our team also hosted two hands-on engineering workshops with scholars in San Cristóbal and Antigua to expose them to the engineering design process as well as to possible careers in engineering. In the 2024-25 year, our team will undertake a rainwater collection project to ensure that families have reliable access to water.
Summary: We are a project team focused on creating sustainable, socially engaged engineering solutions to household problems in in San Cristóbal, Guatemala.

Name: BLUElab Woven Wind
Description:
Our Mission

To design, build, and implement small-scale wind turbines in order to collaborate with educational communities to engage students and the general public in STEM fields and renewable energy. Through our work, we aim to serve society by developing sustainable, safe, and functional devices that act as educational tools to both our organization and our partners.
Summary: Woven Wind is a project team committed to learning and teaching about wind energy, sustainability, and engineering. We work with students around the US to design, build, and install small scale wind turbines that promote and enhance STEM education.

Name: Blueprints For Pangaea
Description:
Blueprints For Pangaea is a 501(c)(3) student-run nonprofit organization dedicated to reallocating unused medical supplies from areas of excess to areas in need, both locally and internationally.

With the support of our supplier and distributor partners, we reallocate excess, unused medical supplies from U.S. hospitals to those overseas in need. 

Through this sustainable, scalable model, we redistribute precious resources from areas of great surplus to areas of great need, minimizing domestic inefficiency while mobilizing accessible health care in emerging communities.

We accept applicants at the beginning of the Fall and Winter semesters. To learn more about joining, visit us at www.blueprintsforpangaea.org or reach out at contact@b4pglobal.org
Summary: Blueprints For Pangaea is a 501(c)(3) student-run nonprofit organization dedicated to reallocating unused medical supplies from areas of excess to areas in need, both locally and internationally. Learn more at www.blueprintsforpangaea.org

Name: BOND Consulting Group
Description:
BOND is the original business consulting club at the University of Michigan. Over the past 21 years, we have worked with over 150 local businesses, startups, and non-profits based in the Ann Arbor area to help them solve their toughest problems. Through a focus on both professional and personal development, our members have been able to form skillsets applicable to any industry, all while cultivating a family-like community.

We encourage you to explore our website to learn more about our client work, professional development, and most importantly, the family that makes BOND a truly unique organization on campus.
Summary: BOND is the original business consulting group at the University of Michigan. Over the past 21 years, we have worked with over 150 local businesses, startups, and non-profits based in the Ann Arbor area to help them solve their toughest problems.

Name: Books for a Benefit
Description:
Mission: Our mission is twofold: 1) To promote a life-long appreciation for reading and intellectual exploration  amongst students in Southeastern Michigan 2) To address community-identified barriers to accessibility of literacy resources in order to support equitable opportunities in education and empower communities through service.



Purpose: The purpose of our organization has two components:
1. To  work with students and families across Southeastern Michigan to provide literacy resources, including children’s books and school supplies

  1. To build welcoming spaces (libraries) where books can be enjoyed and homework can be completed. Books for a Benefit seeks to establish a safe, comfortable, and accessible space wherein education can be supported.


Join our email list! https://forms.gle/Gq6CW5g4Xm6Fn5cN8
Summary: Our mission is twofold: to promote a life-long appreciation for reading and intellectual exploration amongst students, and to address community-identified barriers to accessibility of literacy resources in order to support opportunities in education.

Name: Bosnian Student Association
Description: As an organization, Bosnian Student Association, aims to serve as a positive example of unity for a region that has faced many years of conflict. We plan to bring together many people from diverse backgrounds within the Bosnian region together to work towards a common goal of strengthening the Bosnian population, raising cultural awareness and, ultimately, giving the Bosnian student body a voice on campus. We welcome the general campus population to all meetings and events.
Summary: The Bosnian Student Association aims to serve as a positive example of unity for the region We plan to bring together many people from diverse backgrounds within the Bosnian region to work toward empowerment & promote cultural awareness on campus.

Name: Bountiful Pantries
Description: Bountiful Pantries is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that seeks to address food insecurity in Washtenaw County. We aim to provide access to sanitary and hygienic products to community members in need through the use of pantry cabinets. Sustained by community organizations and individuals, our 24/7 access pantries are strategically placed throughout Washtenaw County to be within reach of those in need of basic resources.
Summary: Providing sanitary and hygienic products free of charge to community members in need through the use of "blessing box" style pantry boxes.

Name: Boxing at the University of Michigan
Description:
Tryout dates will be released towards the beginning of every semester!

No experience necessary! No equipment needed for tryouts, just bring athletic clothes, running shoes, water, and a good attitude!

Check out our IG for updates! @Michigan_college_boxing

Please refrain from requesting to join the organization until after tryouts.

Once on the team, you will learn the fundamentals of boxing technique work your way up to the A Team where you will be able to compete. 

We are a boxing team which aims at developing competitive fighters to represent the organization within the USIBA and local tournaments.
Summary: Boxing team which aims at developing competitive fighters to represent the organization within the USIBA and local tournaments.

Name: Brain Exercise Initiative at UofM
Description:
We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that uses simple math, writing, and reading aloud exercises as an intervention to improve cognitive function in those with Alzheimer's Disease. BEI is a nationwide international program in which university students connect with seniors to do brain exercises together. We are currently looking for volunteers to be a part of our nonprofit. As a volunteer, you would be going to a retirement home and holding these exercises with the seniors. However, currently, we are interacting with retirement home residents via Zoom. This is an opportunity for students interested in going into the medical field. If you have an interest in neuroscience, Alzheimer’s, and/or enjoy volunteering with elders, please fill out the short application form below. We would love to have committed people on our team. You can visit our website at www.brainexerciseinitiative.com to find out more.

Sign up form:  https://forms.gle/B9FiSDcQyqHN9sTz5
Summary: We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that uses simple math, writing, and reading aloud exercises as an intervention to improve cognitive function in those with Alzheimer's Disease.

Name: BrainsRule!
Description:
BrainsRule! is an annual, day-long event designed to teach middle school students about the brain through fun and interactive exhibits created and run by University of Michigan students.

It is entirely volunteer run and operates solely on funds received from donations and university grants. 

For over 10 years, we have invited 200-300 6th & 7th grade students from Michigan schools to come to the Ann Arbor campus and participate in learning about the biology of the brain and encourage their interest in science. 

 

See more information on our website: https://sites.google.com/view/brainsrule/home
Summary: BrainsRule! promotes interest in science among kids by teaching them about the brain and nervous system via interactive demonstrations.

Name: BRASA - Brazilian Business Student Association
Description: The primary mission of the Brazilian Business Student Association (BRASA) at the Stephen M. Ross School of Business is to enhance and enrich the experiences of students at the University of Michigan who are interested in business careers in Brazil, and Brazilian culture in general. The group also aims to promote and facilitate networking among Ross alumni, Current MBAs, and prospective students.
Summary: The primary mission of BRASA is to enrich the experiences of students who are interested in business careers in Brazil, and Brazilian culture in general. The group also aims to promote and facilitate networking among Ross alumni, current and future MBAs.

Name: Brawl!
Description:
Brawl Stars players at UofM. Casual and competitive players welcome! Not affiliated with UofM Esports. To join, press request to join and join the discord! https://discord.gg/CKAavxRHPM

game, gaming, video games, brawl stars, esports, mobile, supercell, clash royale, clash of clans, twitch, youtube, fortnite
Summary: Brawl Stars players at UofM. Casual and competitive players welcome! Not affiliated with UofM Esports. To join, press request to join and join the discord! https://discord.gg/CKAavxRHPM

Name: Brazilian Student Association
Description:
The Brazilian Student Association is the undergraduate community of Brazilian Students in the University of Michigan, but it's not restricted to Brazilians; we are open to any admirer of the culture and those interested in networking with the people involved.
The community is small and we are very friendly.
We hold many events during the semester, mostly related to our culture, including field trips, dinners, Brazilian barbecues, etc.
We also help with finding summer jobs/internships and volunteering opportunities in Brazil.
Summary: We are a group whose primary objectives are to promote the Brazilian culture through traditional national events and social and academic integration of the Brazilian students and the admirers of the culture.

Name: Breathing Club UMich
Description: We are a club that gets together and does breathing techniques! We also have discussions about breathing techniques, and other meditation related topics. We meet weekly, but feel free to come whenever you are available.
Summary: We are a club that gets together and does breathing techniques! We also have discussions about breathing techniques, and other meditation related topics. We meet weekly, but feel free to come whenever you are available.

Name: Bridge Club at University of Michigan
Description: We play bridge, a partner trick-taking game for four players!
Summary: We play bridge, a partner trick-taking game for four players!

Name: Bridge of Disciplines
Description: Bridge of Disciplines is a student-driven association that was established to promote, support, consolidate, and coordinate dental student interprofessional collaboration in academic, professional, and clinical venues. The objectives of the organization are to advance the goals of interprofessional healthcare education, service, and collaboration through student action, teamwork, and education efforts. Bridge of Disciplines act as a centralized body to help coordinate, optimize, and inspire dental student interprofessional efforts by assisting with communication for dental representation to other professional disciplines, groups, and schools, by providing educational resources about interprofessional collaboration, and by representing dental interests in interprofessional collaboration efforts within the university and in the community.
Summary: Bridge of Disciplines is a student-driven association that was established to promote, support, consolidate, and coordinate dental student interprofessional collaboration in academic, professional, and clinical venues.

Name: Bridges International
Description:
You've found Bridges international--Welcome! We are a Christian student organization that seeks to help international students on campus through service and activities, social networking, and spiritual resources.

We welcome students from all nations as we have a lot of fun together, look at life's big questions, and seek to understand what a relationship with God looks like as we believe God wants a relationship with each of us.
Let us know if Bridges can be there for you as you start the unique journey of being an international student!
Summary: Bridges International is a student organization that engages and connects American students with international students through providing service activities, social networking, spiritual conversations, and student leadership development.

Name: Bridging Education and Disease Prevention
Description:
Bridging Education and Disease Prevention (BED) is a comprehensive, student-led medical organization focused on cultivating an understanding of disease prevention, health education, and public health awareness. Our club is dedicated to equipping aspiring healthcare professionals with the knowledge, skills, and experiences necessary to excel in the field of healthcare. Through a diverse range of activities, including educational workshops, hands-on training sessions, community outreach initiatives, and collaborative research projects, BED aims to foster a deeper appreciation of preventive healthcare practices.

By connecting members with experienced healthcare professionals, public health experts, and researchers, BED provides valuable networking and mentorship opportunities. The organization emphasizes the importance of understanding the social determinants of health, epidemiology, and the role of lifestyle in disease prevention, enabling members to become well-rounded healthcare advocates. We also prioritize engaging with the broader community through volunteer work, health awareness campaigns, and partnerships with local health organizations to promote wellness and disease prevention.

BED is committed to creating a supportive environment that encourages growth, learning, and active participation in healthcare-related initiatives. We aim to empower students to become proactive leaders in the healthcare sector, advocating for healthier communities and a greater emphasis on preventive medicine.
Summary: Bridging Education and Disease Prevention (BED) is a student-led medical club focused on promoting disease prevention and health education. Through workshops, hands-on training, community outreach, and collaboration with healthcare professionals.

Name: Bright Financial Futures
Description:
Bright Financial Futures (BFF) was established with the mission of expanding the access to financial literacy education in the Ann Arbor community. BFF fosters this mission by offering a free program for elementary, middle, and high school-aged economically disadvantaged students that teaches the fundamental principles of financial literacy, such as economics, budgeting, investing, debt management, and entrepreneurship.

 

BFF presents an opportunity for students of all backgrounds to teach and improve their own understanding of financial literacy. We achieve this through utilizing interactive and gamified lesson plans to connect with the students of our partner organizations. Our bi-weekly in-person sessions in partnership with local social impact organizations are led by BFF team members. Education sessions emphasize establishing a collaborative environment through small student-to-instructor ratios and engaging lessons.

 

Club-wide meetings will occur 1 to 2 times a month. In addition, club members will have the opportunity to teach hour-long biweekly in-person sessions at one of our partner sites.

 

Please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at bff.eboard@umich.edu to be added to the interest form or with any questions you may have. 

 

The link to the interest form can be found here
Summary: Bright Financial Futures (BFF) was established with the mission of expanding the access to financial literacy education in the Ann Arbor community.

Name: Buddhism at The University of Michigan
Description:
BŪM intends to unite people who are interested in exploring aspects of the vast traditions of Buddhism such as philosophy, meditation, history, relationship to modern science, etc. We also emphasize the dialogue between Buddhism and contemplative practices that contribute to building better mental health and relationships with ourselves. Especially given the turbulent and unstable state of the world today, BŪM would be the perfect place for individuals to be a part of an open-minded, safe, and diverse community focused on the betterment of its members’ well-being and advancement of their knowledge in the depth and breadth of Buddhism.

Our goal is to provide an authentic and inclusive engagement with a variety of  Buddhist traditions.  We wish members could draw from this interaction what they believe could be practical and beneficial to implement into their own lives in meaningful ways. So we invite everyone, regardless of background and belief, to join us in exploring the various possible ways Buddhism can improve our lives with and without faith.
Summary: In short, BŪM is an organization that seeks to provide a safe space with resources for people who are interested in Buddhism to help them explore and engage in religious, academic, intellectual, or practical contexts.

Name: Building a Better Michigan
Description:
Making Michigan Better, Together

Building a Better Michigan is a student advisory group formed to mobilize students and have their voices heard regarding the future development of the University’s Unions and Recreation Centers.

Interested in doing more? We'd love for you to get involved! Fill out this form and feel free to email our leadership at bettermichiganeboard@umich.edu to find out about our upcoming meetings and events.
Summary: To drive Student Life initiatives in partnership with the University of Michigan in order to improve the University Unions and Recreational Sports & Wellbeing facilities.

Name: Bujinkan Budo Club
Description: The Bujinkan Budo Club (Ninjutsu Club) is a martial arts club dedicated to the factual teaching and practice of the Bujinkan martial arts. Bujinkan Budo Taijutsu is a traditional and ancient Japanese kobudo martial art with a rich and viable history that spans over ten centuries. Developed by the legendary ninja and samurai of feudal Japan, the Bujinkan martial arts continue to flourish worldwide in the 21st Century under the direct guidance of Dr. Masaaki Hatsumi, thirty-fourth grandmaster of the Togakure Ryu Ninpo tradition and eight other distinct budo traditions. The instructors of the UM Bujinkan Dojo are fully licensed by Hatsumi sensei and headed by Michael Asuncion, 15th dan shihan. We invite anyone that is interested in studying the martial arts to attend one of our training sessions to experience what it means to practice Budo, the martial way.
Summary: The Bujinkan Budo Club (Ninjutsu Club) is a martial arts club dedicated to the factual teaching and practice of the Bujinkan martial arts.

Name: Burmese Student Association
Description: The Burmese Student Association (BURSA) aims to promote cultural awareness of Burmese heritage, foster community among students of Burmese descent, and provide a support network at the University of Michigan. BURSA organizes events to celebrate and share Burmese traditions, offering opportunities for cultural exchange and social engagement for all students interested in learning about Burmese culture. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are curious about or connected to Burmese culture.
Summary: The Burmese Student Association (BURSA) fosters community and promotes Burmese culture at the University of Michigan through events and support networks, welcoming all who are interested in learning about Burmese heritage.

Name: Bursley Family
Description: The Bursley Family Multicultural Council works to reach out to residents and promote diversity. Since our creation, we have worked to spread social justice education, promote positive self-image and help residents interact and share their diverse backgrounds and experiences.
Summary: We, Bursley Family Multicultural Council, strive to create a safe, welcoming, enlightening, and educational environment for all the residents of Bursley Hall by increasing awareness of multicultural issues and setting examples of model behavior together.

Name: Bursley Hall Council
Description: This group is comprised of Bursley residents, charged with putting on events that benefit the community and being the voice of the residents to the University and to Resstaff. The group is advised by the Resstaff Coordinators and the Bursley Hall Director(s).
Summary: This group serves as the governing student organization for Bursley Hall. Hall Council represents the voices of Bursley residents to ResStaff, Student Life, and the community at large.

Name: Business at Michigan
Description: Welcome to Business at Michigan, a club designed to prepare all Michigan students to learn more about the business world and careers! B@M is a club that teaches students about networking, internship, and career search, while developing a close-knit community of students via our engaging social events. Members are given the opportunity to go through our New Member Education semester to learn about all facets of the business world, before continuing in one of our three sub-sectors: finance, consulting, or marketing. The finance sub-sector features instructional modules where students gain the technical background needed to be successful in the finance industry, whereas the consulting and marketing sub-sectors give members the chance to work on a project alongside a local business to address their consulting or marketing needs. All students are welcome to apply! If you're interested in getting involved, please email businessatmichigan@gmail.com.
Summary: Welcome to Business at Michigan, a club designed to prepare all Michigan students to learn more about the business world and careers!

Name: Business BootCamp at University of Michigan
Description: ​Business BootCamp @ University of Michigan is an organization that focuses on cultivating a spirit of entrepreneurship in the local community through interactive workshops for 4th-8th graders and consulting for small businesses. This organization is a chapter of an organization started in New Jersey that has grown from the two founders with 5 students to a network of 50+ volunteers and 400+ students.
Summary: ​Business BootCamp @ University of Michigan is an organization that focuses on cultivating a spirit of entrepreneurship in the local community through interactive workshops for 4th-8th graders and consulting for small businesses.

Name: Business Law Association
Description: The Business Law Association (BLA) was organized to help graduate students pursue academic, professional, and social opportunities arising from the nexus of law and business. BLA exposes its members to interdisciplinary issues affecting both law and business, and fosters interaction between the Law and Business Schools at the University of Michigan, as well as between students, faculty, and professionals within the fields. Some of the ways in which BLA accomplishes its goals include networking events for students and alumni, members-only career panels and opportunities, a speaker series on topics in business and law, the facilitation of cross-registration between the Law and Business Schools, and social opportunities that bring together law and business students.
Summary: The Business Law Association (BLA) was organized to help graduate students pursue academic, professional, and social opportunities arising from the nexus of law and business.

Name: Business Leaders for Diverse Abilities at Ross
Description: The BLDA at Ross is established to advance the community, awareness, and advocacy of visibly and invisibly disabled members of the Ross School of Business and the broader professional business world. In addition, we promote allyship for this community by educating fellow faculty, staff, and MBA peers about the differences in cognitive, social-emotional, and physical abilities—both in the classroom and the boardroom.
Summary: The BLDA at Ross aims to foster community, raise awareness, and advocate for people with visible and invisible disabilities in the Ross School of Business community and in the broader professional business world.

Name: Business Research Hub at the University of Michigan
Description:
We strive to bridge the gap between business and academia.
