We devote ourselves to this challenge, to be achieved through hard work, patience, and the collective effort to educate, as is exemplified in our motto, ‘Wisdom Through Education’. 

We commit ourselves to Educating, Elevating, and Empowering all Women:

  • To develop an educational, cultural, political, and social awareness;
  • To open lines of communications in order to service the community;
  • To promote and preserve the Latino culture;
  • To provide women with a choice among Greek letter sororities.
Summary: Our mission is to Educate,Elevate,and Empower all women.We focus on the development of political,educational,cultural,and social awareness.We devote ourselves to the collective effort to educate as is exemplified in our motto, 'Wisdom through education'.

Name: Cosmetic Dentistry Society
Description: The Cosmetic Dentistry Society is an organization established to foster continued learning for dental students in the areas of cosmetic dentistry, leadership, and philanthropy.
Summary: The Cosmetic Dentistry Society is an organization established foster continued learning for dental students in the areas of cosmetic dentistry, leadership, and philanthropy.

Name: Cost Assistance for Resilient Engineers
Description: CARE is a team of engineering students motivated by their own experiences to create options for fellow students in need of financial support. As a College of Engineering Sponsored Student Organization, CARE helps to raise funds for the endowment through initiatives targeting alumni, corporations, current students, and their families. All donations to the University of Michigan for the CARE Scholarship Fund are gift receipted by the University of Michigan and are tax deductible. The College of Engineering recognizes that each year some Engineering students find themselves in need of $5,000 to $10,000 in order to be able to continue with their studies. This may be as a result of emergency financial circumstances, such as a parent’s loss of a job, a severe illness in a student’s family, etc. CARE’s goal is to create a $1.5 million endowment maintained by the College of Engineering that will generate $67,500 in scholarships per year.
Summary: CARE inspires our Michigan Engineering community to practice empathy and generosity toward students with financial crises, and raises money for an endowed scholarship so these students can be among, "those who stay."

Name: Counseling and Psychological Services
Description: Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) is committed to providing multicultural and multidisciplinary expert and caring mental health support at no charge for currently enrolled University of Michigan-Ann Arbor campus undergraduate and graduate/professional students. Services we offer are strictly confidential and include brief, solution-focused therapy for individuals, couples, and groups. We also provide workshops, crisis services and consultation. In addition to our central office in the Michigan Union, CAPS offers services through our Embedded Model in schools and colleges across campus. Common concerns reported by students include: anxiety, depression, academic concerns, and relationship issues. Interested in meeting with one of our therapists? Please schedule an Initial Consultation online at https://caps.umich.edu/article/scheduling-appointment. If you are interested in meeting with an embedded therapist, please contact the embedded therapist directly via email (https://caps.umich.edu/article/caps-embedded-staff). Initial Consultations are typically 45 minutes in duration and during this time you and your therapist will decide on best next steps (e.g., brief therapy at CAPS, a group or workshop, longer-term therapy in the community). For more information please visit caps.umich.edu
Summary: Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) is committed to providing multicultural and multidisciplinary expert and caring mental health support at no charge for currently enrolled University of Michigan-Ann Arbor students.

Name: Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS In Action)
Description: CAPS In Action (CIA) is for University of Michigan students who are dedicated to making the U of M community a more holistically healthy environment. This is an active and hands-on group, focused on creating and implementing mental health outreach efforts that empower students to enhance a culture of care and inclusion. CIA is facilitated by CAPS professionals and supports CAPS outreach initiatives.
Summary: CAPS In Action (CIA) is for University of Michigan students who are dedicated to making the U of M community a more holistically healthy environment.

Name: Couzens Active Multi Ethnic Organization
Description:
CAMEO was founded as a multicultural council within the Couzens Residence Hall in order to promote an environment of cultural and social awareness through activities and events which aim to unify all members of Couzens Residence Hall community regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, religion, creed, or sexual orientation.

Membership of CAMEO will be open and free to all residents and staff of Couzens Hall who actively support the expressed goals and objectives of CAMEO.
Summary: CAMEO was founded as a multicultural council within the Couzens Residence Hall in order to promote an environment of cultural and social awareness through activities and events which aim to unify all of the Couzens community.

Name: Couzens Hall Council
Description:
The mission of the Couzens Hall Council shall be to form an organized and unified living
community under the Residence Halls Association through equal voice and interaction
among all residents within Couzens.
Summary: The official hall council of the Couzens Residence, devoted to building a stronger community within the dormitory.  All residents of Couzens, except housing staff, are eligible for a position.

Name: Crafting Smiles
Description: The goal of the Crafting Smiles is to enhance the artistic abilities crucial for success in dentistry while improving manual dexterity through engaging, hands-on activities and creative crafts. We aim to prepare members for the detailed work required in the dental field and create a supportive environment for skill development.
Summary: Crafting Smiles is an organization designed for individuals interested in dentistry and those pursuing careers in the pre-health field. This club focuses on enhancing the manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination skills needed for dental school.

Name: Crafts for Conservation: VIPs Club
Description:
WEEKLY CRAFTING MEETINGS: SUNDAYS 2-4p & MONDAYS 5-6p

Sunday Meetings: Pond room, first floor Union

Monday Meetings: Sophia B Jones, first floor Union

 

Did you know the fast fashion industry is expected to use 35% more land by 2030? That's 115 MILLION hectares of space that will be taken away from wild animals' habitat, all so that we can have our giant Shein hauls of cheap clothes that we wear once or twice and send to the landfill within a year. Fast fashion is one of the biggest threats to the planet’s biodiversity, but a threat that we do have a fighting chance at stopping.

VIPs (Very Important Primates) is a new club that meets once a week to crochet, knit, bead, sew, embroider, etc., (basically whatever your talent is or whatever talent you wish to learn) so we can create garments that have an eco-friendly life cycle to combat fast fashion. As opposed to cheap fabrics made of plastics that take thousands of years to decompose and rely on abysmal labor standards to produce, we source sustainable materials and since we start from scratch, we get to design all our garments and accessories

At VIPs Club, we sell these clothes, stuffed toys, bags, hats, etc. through VIPs Fund, a nonprofit created by university students for this exact purpose. 100% of funds raised through making these sales go directly towards wildlife conservation projects that we develop ourselves.

Membership is open to anyone who is interested in wildlife conservation, fiber art, fashion design, sewing, jewelry, nonprofit work, website building, marketing, advocacy, or any other skill you think would further the mission of Crochet for Conservation and VIPs Fund. Check out the Sustainability and About Us pages on the VIPs Fund website for more information.

www.vipsfund.org
Summary:
one-of-a-kind pieces for a one-of-a-kind planet
sustainable fashion (crochet, knit, jewelry, etc) and wildlife conservation

Name: Create For Kids
Description: Welcome to Create For Kids, where we use the power of art to bring smiles to hospitalized children. We know that being in a hospital can be tough for kids and their families, which is why we provide a variety of creative activities to make their stay a little brighter. We believe that art is a vital component of the healing process, and we strive to create a nurturing environment that promotes creativity and smiles.
Summary: Create for Kids is an organization that is dedicated to bring joy and creativity to hospitalized children by providing a variety of creative activities for use during their stay.

Name: Creating Adventurous and Mindful Physicians
Description: Creating Adventurous and Mindful Physicians (CAMP) is a backpacking pre-orientation trip that welcomes incoming medical students to the University of Michigan’s Medical School, aiming to build community while exploring the beauty of Michigan and easing the many fears and stressors that may come with change and starting medical school. CAMP offers an optional, student-led, 3 or 5 day overnight backpacking trip to help foster friendships among new classmates in an inclusive, accessible, and non-medical setting.
Summary: CAMP is a student-run organization offering pre-orientation wilderness trips and community events throughout the year for medical students to foster bonds with peers through team-building and meaning in medicine exercises.

Name: Creative Needs Project-University of Michigan Ann Arbor Chapter
Description: The mission of the Creative Needs Project is to provide opportunities for children with disabilities. In efforts to provide an environment that promotes social and engaging opportunities for children with intellectual and cognitive disabilities, we aim to equip children with the skills needed to include them in societal activities. We look to host and provide programs that stimulate creativity in children with disabilities and develop passions that they can explore throughout their lives.
Summary:
The mission of the Creative Needs Project is to provide opportunities for children with
disabilities. We look to host and provide programs that stimulate creativity in children with disabilities and develop passions to explore throughout their lives.

Name: Criminology and Forensics Initiative
Description:
The Criminology and Forensics Initiative (CAFI) hopes to create a casual environment for those interested in forensics and criminology-related topics to socialize with other students, learn early field insights, become competitive applicants, and gain access to a large network of connections and resources!

 

CAFI strives to pursue these objectives by:

- Organizing pre-professional, internship, scholarship, and networking opportunities to help young professionals prepare for their desired careers.

- Providing opportunities to serve the campus and community, as well as aiding organizations with a similar mission.

- Encouraging academic networks and fellowship between students through a variety of social events.

- Furthering community interest in criminology, criminal justice, and forensics by providing relevant and affordable resources.

 

Over the course of the semester, we plan to host events and opportunities surrounding topics ranging from activism, sociology, law, and justice to medical science, criminal investigation, and true crime.

 

Membership is open to any interested students at the University of Michigan, and general members of the public are welcome to attend any events that we host in the community. No matter what major you are, we'd love to see you at a meeting!
Summary: CAFI aims to promote and assist with professional, career-related, and recreational pursuits in the fields of criminal justice, criminology, and forensics

Name: Critical Thinking @ UMich
Description: The Critical Thinking @ UMich is a student-led organization dedicated to fostering analytical reasoning, problem-solving, and open discourse. Our mission is to cultivate intellectual curiosity by exploring diverse perspectives and challenging assumptions through structured debates and interactive projects, such as escape rooms. By participating, members develop valuable skills in critical thinking, effective communication, and decision-making—applicable to academic, professional, and real-world scenarios
Summary: Critical Thinking @ UMich focuses on developing logical reasoning, problem-solving, and analytical skills through open discussions, debates, and activities.

Name: Crochet for Good
Description: Knots of Love is an organization that distributes donated chemo caps and NICU blankets to hospitals all over the US, free of charge to the patients.  This group aims to make the creation and donation process a collaborative effort.  As a larger group, we can send out donations in bulk rather than one by one, saving both time and resources (and making it a little bit more fun).  All are welcome; experienced members are happy to teach beginners basic patterns, and both knit and crochet creations are welcomed!
Summary: We're a group dedicated to making and donating chemo caps and NICU blankets to Knots of Love!  All are welcome, regardless of skill level, and both crochet and knit creations are encouraged!

Name: Crohn's and Colitis Student Initiative
Description: The Crohn's and Colitis Student Initiative (CCSI) at the University of Michigan is a forum for students and other members of the University of Michigan community and surrounding colleges to talk about their disease (IBD) with other similarly affected students. CCSI allows students with IBD to meet one another, voice IBD-related concerns, and build a supportive community with great people! The main focuses of the group are support, discussion, fundraising, education and awareness. The CCSI is a dynamic way for those involved to gain more knowledge about these diseases from people who are affected by them every day.
Summary: The Crohn's and Colitis Student Initiative (CCSI) is a forum for students and other affected individuals at the University of Michigan to talk about their disease (IBD), raise awareness, gain education, and form a supportive community.

Name: Crossroads Undergraduate Journal of Anthropology
Description: As the University of Michigan’s Undergraduate Journal of Anthropology, Crossroads is dedicated to publishing undergraduate work and opinions and thoughts of the department and student body related to the discipline of anthropology. It is our goal to increase the visibility of undergraduate student work and the field of anthropology at the University of Michigan. Crossroads is a multifaceted publication that supports endeavors in all aspects of anthropology and we seek to push the boundaries of our field.
Summary: As the University of Michigan’s Undergraduate Journal of Anthropology, Crossroads is dedicated to publishing work and opinions of the department and fostering collaborative opportunities across academic disciplines.

Name: Cru
Description:
Learn more or fill out our interest form at MichiganCru.com

Cru is an inter-denominational Christian ministry on campus at U of M! We exist so that every Michigan student has the opportunity to have a personal relationship with Jesus. We're here for both the student who is exploring Jesus for the first time and the student who has identified as a Christian for a long time!
 
We seek to help students grow in a personal relationship with Jesus through Bible study, deep friendships, spiritual-mentorship opportunities, prayer, outreach on campus, and mission trips (domestic & international), to name a few.
 
In the United States, Cru is on over 2,000 college campuses. For more information about Cru at U-M, please attend one of our meetings and get involved! You can find out more at www.michigancru.com and follow us on instagram @michigancru.
Summary: We exist to help students explore and experience Jesus Christ!  (Formerly Campus Crusade for Christ)

Name: CS KickStart
Description: • CS KickStart organizes a one week introductory class in computer science designed primarily for incoming freshman women and other underrepresented minorities in tech at University of Michigan. Participants learn how to program, gain exposure to the different areas of computer science, and meet other computer science students and professionals. The program targets those who are interested in math, science, engineering, and/or technology but have little experience with computer science. We aim to give them a hands-on experience that will reveal the creativity and power of computer science.
Summary: The CS KickStart group organizes a one-week summer program intended to introduce 20-30 incoming freshmen underrepresented groups to technology. The students participate in programming labs, faculty talks, tours of companies, social activities, and more.

Name: Cultural Heritage Law Society
Description:
The Cultural Heritage Law Society is a group of University of Michigan law students interested in promoting the preservation and protection of cultural heritage in the United States and internationally through legal education and advocacy in the legislative, judicial, and policy arenas.

The purpose of the Cultural Heritage Law Society is to create an academic, professional, and social forum for individuals interested in this growing area of law. In recent years, activities such as looting, museum theft, and illicit antiquities trading have increasingly garnered domestic and international legal attention. The Cultural Heritage Law Society will foster education and exploration of these and other cultural heritage law issues through a variety of activities including:

  • Guest lectures by experts from the legal, academic, and political arenas.
  • Networking opportunities with fellow students, alumni, and professionals.
  • Social excursions to museums, galleries, and historic sites.

The Cultural Heritage Law Society is open to all of the law school community, and we encourage the membership of any individual interested in furthering their education in this exciting area of law.
Summary: The Cultural Heritage Law Society is a group of University of Michigan Law School students passionate about and advocating for the preservation of cultural heritage, repatriation of cultural property, and the restitution of looted artworks.

Name: Cure Found
Description:
The purpose of this organization is to allow pre-med/health undergraduates to learn more about Cystic Fibrosis (CF), an inherited life threatening disease that affects the lungs. The purpose involves spreading CF awareness, raising funds for the CF foundation, allowing students to learn more about pulmonary medicine and how pulmonologists contribute to prolonging the life of those with CF. 

Cure Found is committed to offering top-tier pre-health opportunities geared towards learning more about pulmonary medicine and Cystic Fibrosis in order to spread awareness and educate people about the disease at a large and diverse university. Cure Found also aims to utilize the University of Michigan's active campus to fundraise for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and to gain pre-health learning opportunities and experiences related to pulmonary medicine.
Summary: Cure Found aims to educate pre-health students about Cystic Fibrosis (CF), spread awareness, and raise funds for the CF Foundation. We offer learning opportunities through hands-on workshops, volunteer experiences, and seminars with field professionals.

Name: CURIS - Public Health Advocacy
Description: CURIS (“cares” in Latin) is a student organization dedicated to raising awareness about public health efforts and enacting change in our own community. We partner with local organizations on a variety of projects that aim to provide people with the resources and support they need to improve their health. To accomplish this, we conduct research, organize community events, fundraise, and more. Some of the topics our projects have been focused on in the past are mental health, child care, health policy, and sexual assault. Additionally, CURIS is committed to providing its members with professional development opportunities, volunteering and social events, as well as a welcoming community where they can educate themselves about public health topics and career options.
Summary: A student organization dedicated to raising awareness about public health concerns and enacting change in our community through discussions, research, and volunteering with local organizations.

Name: Curl Talk @ Umich
Description: Curl Talk @ Umich creates a space to: eliminate negative stereotypes surrounding kinky and coily hair, educate about hair types and proper hair care and influence others to encourage assurance and embrace their hair and all hair types. This is done by facilitating discussions with students about natural hair and to encourage those students to educate their communities on what it means to embrace all hair beginning with providing students with assistance in their own self-care, especially hair care.
Summary: Curl Talk @ Umich creates a space to: eliminate negative stereotypes surrounding kinky and coily hair, educate about hair types and proper hair care and influence others to encourage assurance and embrace their hair and all hair types.

Name: Dance 2XS Michigan
Description:
If you would like more information about company classes, auditions, performances, and events, please visit our Instagram page @dance2xsmichigan, or email us at dance2xsCore@umich.edu!

 

ABOUT US

Dance 2XS Michigan is a collegiate chapter of the international hip-hop company, Dance 2XS International. The company was founded in 1998 by Patrick Chen and Lee Daniel, and our chapter at UofM was founded in 2002. Since then, it has grown from one group of dancers into an expansive family with chapters around the world. 

 

Dance 2XS chapters include: Australia, Brazil, Caliente, Chicago, Estonia, Iceland, Italy, Mexico, New York, Portugal, Prague, Purdue University, United Kingdom, University of Illinois, and University of Michigan. 

 

Members of Dance 2XS International have performed with internationally acclaimed artists such as: Michael Jackson, Janet Jackson, Justin Timberlake, R Kelly, Aaliyah, Britney Spears, Kylie Minogue, Mya, Fat Joe, Snoop Dog, Pharrell Williams, Red Man, Chingy, James Brown, Tyrese, Mariah Carey, Pink, 50 Cent, Alicia Keys, Dido, Mis-Teeq, DJ Bobo, SugarBabes, CoCo Lee, Matrix II & III, Honey Promo, You Got Served, and J.Cole.

 

We are a dedicated and passionate group of dancers who strive to inspire each other, explore the possibilities within the hip hop industry, and provide a space to develop our creative and athletic talents. 

 

 

Check out some of our recent performances below:

Winter Barnite 2023:

https://youtu.be/-U3FGhMWPqE

2XSKRRT Concept Video:

https://youtu.be/VZXHteFnT6c

Urbanite 2023:

https://youtu.be/d0OY5ZryLT8

Fall Barnite 2022:

https://youtu.be/oetu-kQG8sI

Winter Barnite 2022:

https://youtu.be/xG4oEn7OOi0

Urbanite 2022:

https://youtu.be/QJuoEZnOz_M

Fall Barnite 2021:

https://youtu.be/nY3ufjRtDTc
Summary: Dance 2XS Michigan is a chapter of 2XS International, a multicultural hip hop dance company. We strive to incorporate many hip hop styles, such as funk, commercial, crump, & house. During the year, we perform in multiple shows both on and off campus.

Name: Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan
Description:
Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan (DMUM) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit student organization dedicated to supporting children with disabilities and illnesses, and their families, by raising funds and generating awareness for pediatric programs at the University of Michigan Health C.S. Mott Children’s Hospital. Our members are paired with these children and their families, and together participate in activities and build relationships throughout the year. Members also have the unique opportunity to volunteer at several pediatric therapies that DMUM directly funds, allowing them to see the direct impact of their fundraising and empowering them to form a deeper connection and passion for our cause. Our year-long efforts culminate with VictorThon, a 24-hour event where members stand on their feet to show their dedication to our cause. Through these initiatives, we strive to unite the University of Michigan campus and community around supporting children with disabilities by encouraging, inspiring, and strengthening opportunities for physical, social, and emotional development.

 

Interested in joining? Visit dmum.org/register to become a registered member!
Summary: Dance Marathon at the University of Michigan (DMUM) is a student-run nonprofit dedicated to raising funds and generating awareness for pediatric therapies at C.S. Mott Children's Hospital.

Name: Dance Mix
Description: Dance Mix is an organization that unifies a diverse array of student-run performance groups to celebrate the art of dance.  Each year, our Core - composed of EnCore, FunKtion, Impact and RhythM - invites a constantly changing diverse selection of premier dance groups from the University of Michigan that represent our principles of multiculturalism, diversity, an self-expression to join with us in the largest student run dance show on campus!
Summary: Started in 2001, Dance Mix provides an outlet for established dance groups on campus to showcase their talents and skills to the University of Michigan community.

Name: Dance Synergy
Description: Dance Synergy is a student organisation at the Ross School of Business. Members will meet regularly to choreograph and practice dance routines of different dance forms and perform at school events.
Summary: Dance Synergy will bring students together in a comfortable environment to learn a variety of dance styles and have the opportunity to choreograph and teach peers a dance style they are most familiar with.

Name: DB3
Description:
We are DB3, otherwise known as Daebak 3, the official all-male K-Pop/Hip-Hop dance crew at the University of Michigan. We actively perform in major dance and cultural events around campus year-round and occasionally create dance covers.

 

Our group was founded in 2013 by 3 UofM male students who wanted to form a multicultural group that could be a vector for their interests in Korean pop music and dancing. Our mission is to spread awareness about Korean culture through the art of dance and to create a close-knit community for our members.

 

We aim to embrace both new and old K-pop music through our performances and strike a chord with a wide audience. Additionally, we sometimes incorporate modern hip-hop discography into our performances to add variety and nuance to our capabilities. Our goal for all performances is to present the audience with a kaleidoscope of personalities and characters through dance in which they can enjoy.

 

 

Watch our most recent performance at KASA 2024: Seoul Shadows!

Keep up with us through our socials here!
Summary: We are DB3, otherwise known as Daebak 3, the official all-male K-Pop/Hip-Hop dance crew at the University of Michigan. Our mission is to spread awareness about Korean culture through the art of dance and to create a close-knit community for our members.

Name: Deleted Accounts
Summary: This organization is used to house old accounts that groups no longer want or need. This is needed due to the fact that MaizePages does not have the ability to delete accounts.

Name: Delight Ministry
Description:
Join our mailing list! http://eepurl.com/c4wH2P

The heart of Delight Ministries is to provide an environment for women to vulnerably share about how Christ has been at work in their lives. Our curriculum is made of stories from college women sharing about the ups and downs of their faith journeys. We've heard stories of depression, loneliness, heartbreak, identity crisis and pain, but the common theme throughout them all is that even still, God is good. 

These stories are paired with scripture and discussion questions and are used weekly by all Delight communities. Stories of real women opens the door for authentic conversations and deep-rooted relationships. We truly believe in the power of vulnerability and how it impacts our relationship with Christ and others. 

Delight is more than just a bible study! Each community meets weekly to share stories of God at work. They also incorporate worship nights, opportunities to serve and fun get-togethers that help foster relationships. We fully believe in doing life together. Delight provides the opportunity for hundreds of women to Delight in the Lord together throughout their college journey.
Summary: Delight is a college women's community that grows together, serves together, learns together and does life together while chasing the heart of God. Our Mission is to invite college women into a Christ-centered community that fosters vulnerability.

Name: Delta Delta Delta, Iota Chapter
Description:
The PURPOSE OF DELTA DELTA DELTA shall be to establish a perpetual bond of friendship among its members, to develop a stronger and more womanly character, to broaden the 'intellectual' life, and to assist its members in every possible way.'"

IT SHALL ALSO BE THE PURPOSE OF DELTA DELTA DELTA to promote and develop mutually beneficial relationships between the Fraternity and the colleges and universities where the Fraternity has established chapters, to develop qualities of unselfish leadership among its members, and to encourage them to assume, with integrity and devotion to moral and democratic principles, the highest responsibilities of college women.
Summary: Delta Delta Delta is a women's fraternity that is dedicated to building a perpetual bond of friendship among its members, to develop a stronger and more womanly character, to broaden the intellectual life, and to assist its members in every possible way.

Name: Delta Delta Sigma
Description: Delta Delta Sigma (DDS) is an honor society at the University of Michigan designed for pre-dental students. Our focus is on promoting academic achievement, leadership development, professional development, service initiatives, and a strong sense of community among undergraduates pursuing dentistry. DDS aims to provide its members with hands-on clinical exposure, opportunities to build essential interpersonal skills, ways to get involved in pre-dental-related research, and a commitment to making a positive impact.
Summary: Delta Delta Sigma is an honor society forged for pre-dental students. Our focus is on promoting academic achievement, leadership and professional development, service initiatives, and a strong sense of community among undergraduates pursuing dentistry.

Name: Delta Epsilon Mu
Description:
The Members of Delta Epsilon Mu are committed to serving the community by advocating health education and care, and through active participation in service activities, fundraising, and outreach programs. Members are given the opportunity to directly participate in health-oriented workshops and discussions, thereby attaining access to pertinent academic and career information through association with professors, advisors, career professionals, alumni members and fellow active members.

Learn more about us at our website: https://www.demuofm.org/
Summary: Delta Epsilon Mu (DEM) is a pre-health fraternity that seeks to unite students with an interest in healthcare.

Name: Delta Gamma (Xi Chapter)
Description: Our organization is primarily focused on promoting the highest ideals of friendship and support for college women, through providing opportunities to aid scholarship and alternative programming opportunities. The group was founded to promote friendship, bonding and support among women that share the same ideals.
Summary: Delta Gamma, as an institution, is focused on promoting the highest ideals of friendship among college women and establishing our beliefs, values and morals among women that seek out true friendship and support in sisterhood.

Name: Delta Gamma Phi
Description:
Delta Gamma Phi is the only pre-law sorority on campus (and the first pre-law sorority in the United States). We strive to advance future careers in law by promoting academic excellence, increased knowledge of the law, unique opportunities for leadership and service, a network of devoted sisters, friendship, unity, and unlimited guidance and support. Members include women and non-man-identifying individuals who will be applying to law school, are interested in law, or are simply considering law school as an option. We represent a future of law that is diverse, honorable, and one in which women have a presence and a voice.

 

Feel free to visit and follow our Instagram @deltagammaphi_umich for rush information and reach out if you have any questions!
Summary: Delta Gamma Phi is the only pre-law sorority on campus and our mission is to create a dedicated network of women who are applying to law school, interested in law, or considering law school as an option. We recruit in the Fall and Winter semesters.

Name: Delta Phi Epsilon Sorority
Description: The Delta Eta chapter of Delta Phi Epsilon at the University of Michigan values service, sisterhood, and scholarship! Our spirit, enthusiasm, and friendships are what make being a part of our chapter so unique. We participate in the Greek and local communities, as well as support our sorority's philanthropies, which are the National Eating Disorder Association, Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, and the Delta Phi Epsilon Educational Foundation.
Summary: The Delta Eta chapter of the Delta Phi Epsilon sorority is a member of the University of Michigan's Panhellenic Association.

Name: Delta Sigma Phi
Description:
Delta Sigma Phi is a national, not-for-profit Fraternity that's helped young men become better for more than a century. Founded on December 10, 1899 at the College of the City of New York, Delta Sig has grown significantly over the years with 104 active chapters in the United States. In our 115 years of history, over 115,000 men have initiated into Delta Sigma Phi Fraternity. Today, we have 85,000 living alumni and more than 5,000 undergraduates.

Our great Fraternity helps and encourages our members to become better students, better leaders, better citizens, better professionals... better men.
Summary: Delta Sigma Phi is a national, not-for-profit Fraternity that's helped young men become better for more than a century. Our Fraternity helps and encourages our members to become better students, better leaders, better citizens, and better professionals.

Name: Delta Sigma Pi
Description: Delta Sigma Pi is the single Ross exclusive business fraternity on campus. We are committed to fostering professionalism, volunteering in our community, and creating a positive social impact on those in business. Our alumni work in industries including finance, marketing, consulting, technology, government, accounting, entertainment, and more.
Summary: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional business fraternity.

Name: Delta Tau Delta Fraternity
Description: Delta Tau Delta is an international social fraternity. It is a value based organization that is "Committed to Lives of Excellence." We foster leadership, academic achievement, philanthropic service, all through our brotherhood.
Summary: Delta Tau Delta is an international social fraternity. It is a value based organization that is "Committed to Lives of Excellence." We foster leadership, academic achievement, philanthropic service, all through our brotherhood.

Name: Delta Tau Lambda Sorority, Incorporated
Description:
The mission of Delta Tau Lambda Sorority, Incorporated is to build and strengthen Latina's position in society through community service, commitment, and professionalism. Together, we will unite to develop and empower Latinas, women of color, and women in general through personal evolution and teamwork. We will continue to build a strong foundation of resources through networking and community connections. We will work in collaboration with diverse women to create opportunities for growth and change.

 

We were were founded April 2, 1994, at the University of Michigan- Ann Arbor by two dedicated Latinas who saw a need for an organization that was committed to professional development & community service. We are a community service based organization that strives to help our surrounding communities.

 

As a chapter, we host various events, fundraisers, and educational seminars yearly. We also award an annual scholarship to help a woman of color in her journey through college.
Summary: The phenomenal women of DTL promote professionalism, academic excellence, community service, and women empowerment. We welcome all women who are interested in being the trailblazers in their community and an influence on women for generations to come.

Name: Dental Entrepreneurs Network
Description:
The Dental Entrepreneurs Network (DEN) is a dynamic club dedicated to pre-dental and pre-health students passionate about private practice and entrepreneurship. Our mission is to provide members with practical insights into running a successful dental practice, emphasizing both business acumen and ethical considerations in healthcare.

 

Through DEN, members can participate in exclusive networking events with local dental professionals, engage in pitch competitions to showcase their entrepreneurial ideas, and attend workshops on essential topics like ethical practices and equity in dentistry. 

 

Join DEN to develop your entrepreneurial skills, build valuable connections, and make a positive impact in the dental field.
Summary: The Dental Entrepreneurs Network (DEN) explores private practice and entrepreneurship for pre-dental and pre-health students. Engage in pitch competitions, network with local professionals, and delve into ethical dental practices.

Name: Dental Veterans and Military of the School of Dentistry
Description: The purpose of the DVM-SOD is three tiered 1) Establish as a point of contact for incoming/current students regarding transition into the dental profession, Military Scholarship and VA funded Schooling.  2) Support development of currently serving veterans, HPSP/HSCP awardees into sound clinicians and assist in the transition into the military 3) Support local veteran outreach in the community and integrate into the UM Veterans Community.
Summary: Serve as military/veteran ambassadors for the profession of dentistry at the University of Michigan School of Dentistry by supporting, mentoring and developing the next generation of dental veterans and by serving the veteran community.

Name: Department of Sociology
Description: The Undergraduate Program in the Department of Sociology is a vibrant and diverse community of 400-500 majors and minors who are passionate about investigating social issues using empirical evidence and acting as agents of social change. We ask societal questions like how does race affect your treatment in the criminal justice system or how does geographic location affect the health of a population and use various data sources & sociological research methods to investigate these issues. The department offers a variety of course options, from dynamic larger classes that cover a wide exposure to the discipline to interactive smaller classes where students delve deeply into specific topics of interest. Students in our program pursue learning opportunities outside of the classroom, such as volunteer work at community sites (SOC 225), faculty and doctoral student research assistance (SOC 394), study abroad, undergraduate speakers series events, and independent research and writing through our Honors Program in Sociology. We invite you to browse through our website (https://lsa.umich.edu/soc/undergraduates.html) and reach out to us at socadvisor@umich.edu if you have questions about our majors, minors, courses, or department opportunities. Thank you for visiting Sociology at the University of Michigan!
Summary: The Undergraduate Program in the Department of Sociology is a vibrant and diverse community of 400-500 majors and minors who are passionate about investigating social issues using empirical evidence and acting as agents of social change.

Name: Dermatology Interest Group
Description: The Dermatology Interest Group seeks to foster interest in the field of Dermatology and help medical students explore opportunities for mentorship, research, and resources to help match into the field. Through meetings with Dermatology faculty, residents, and other interested medical students, we hope to foster the interest of Dermatology in the medical school classes. For more information, please visit our website.
Summary: This organization's purpose is to allow students to explore their interest in dermatology through mentorship, seminars, workshops, lunch talks, journal clubs, and meetings with dermatology faculty and residents.

Name: Design Movement
Description:
The purpose of the Chapter is to create a space for South Asian American students and those
interested in the South Asian community to understand what it means to have a relationship with
Jesus Christ and to contextualize the teachings of Jesus in the various aspects of the South Asian
culture. The Design Movement serves the South Asian American community by offering
spiritual resources and a place to find community.
Summary: The Design Movement creates a safe space for those interested in South Asian community to explore the person and teachings of Jesus Christ.

Name: Design+Business
Description:
The Design + Business (D+B) Club is a Ross student organization focused on education, practical application, and career development in design thinking fields. This club will enable students to solve problems in a creative and human-centric way. The mission of D+B is to provide a multidisciplinary community for graduate students interested in using design methodologies to generate innovative ideas and lead organizations. 

 

Additionally, we are committed to facilitating career development by aiding students in securing roles within industries that value design thinking. Beyond academic and professional growth, D+B Club also nurtures mutual support by conducting social events.
Summary: The Design + Business (D+B) Club is a Ross student organization focused on education, practical application, and career development in design thinking fields.

Name: Detroit Initiative at Ross
Description:
About the Organization

Discover. Engage. Commit. Launched in 2010 by students at the Ross School of Business, the Detroit Initiative at Ross (DIR) supports Ross students passionate about discovering the city of Detroit, engaging with Detroit communities, and supporting impactful causes within this great American city.  To do so, the organization lends opportunity to engage in consulting projects with Detroit nonprofits, mentor Detroit high school students interested in business, plan a conference involving stakeholders across the city, and partake in cultural events within Detroit.

Impact Projects: DIR pairs groups of students with organizations in Detroit to work alongside nonprofit leaders to drive community impact.  Students have worked across an array of organizations with some focusing on child literacy while others support food and housing insecurity. 

Mentorship: DIR partners with high schools in Detroit to pair Ross students with mentees interested in business careers.  The Detroit students travel to Ann Arbor throughout the school year to learn about foundational business concepts and work on a capstone project, which is presented during the final session.

The inaugural Detroit Impact Conference, 2010 Focus Detroit, began the process of introducing business students to the city of Detroit. Ensuing conferences took the discussion further, shifting the conversation about Detroit at the University of Michigan to one of opportunity and possibility.

The club also focuses on planning events in Detroit and providing exposure to city leaders and historians.
Summary: The Detroit Initiative at Ross (MBA) connects Ross students to the city of Detroit through impact projects, student mentorship, conferences, and historical and cultural events.  The club serves as a bridge between Michigan and the Motor City!

Name: Detroit Initiative at Ross (BBA)
Description:
The purposes of DIR are to:

  1. Connect University of Michigan students with the Michigan region and the City of Detroit through cultural and professional exposure to Detroit.
  2. Provide impactful work for Detroit organizations with impact-oriented goals, such as non-profits and social enterprises. 
  3. Partner with a Detroit-based organization or primary school to mentor youth on leadership, higher education, and entrepreneurship.
  4. Promote Detroit as a viable and exciting place to build a career by holding monthly events. 
  5. Provide a forum for students to foster multidisciplinary thought surrounding economic and social development in urban areas.
Summary: DIR looks to connect Umich students with the Michigan region and the City of Detroit through cultural and professional exposure to Detroit. We provide impactful work for Detroit non-profits, mentor local high school students, and host events.

Name: Developer Student Club at the University of Michigan
Description: Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC) is a program presented by Google Developers. GDSCs are university-based community groups for students. Students from all undergraduate or graduate programs with an interest in growing as a developer are welcome. By joining a GDSC, students grow their knowledge in a peer-to-peer learning environment and build solutions for local businesses and their community.
Summary: Developer Student Clubs (DSC) is program presented by Google Developers. DSCs are university based community groups for students.  Students grow their knowledge in a peer-to-peer learning environment and build solutions for the community.

Name: Developing Future Biologists
Description: Developing Future Biologists (DFB), is a graduate student- and postdoc-led organization dedicated to ensuring that the next generation of biologists, regardless of race, gender, or socioeconomic status, have the opportunity to learn core developmental biology concepts and are made aware of the opportunities that exist to pursue a career in science. To achieve this mission, DFB (1) designs and implements an immersive weeklong short course to provide undergraduates with hands-on lab experience and career development activities, and (2) fosters long-term mentoring and networking opportunities to DFB participants. At the same time, DFB provides its trainee instructors with invaluable experience in course design, teaching, mentoring, and more.
Summary: We are a student-led organization dedicated to ensuring that the next generation of biologists, regardless of race, gender, or socioeconomic status, have the opportunity to learn the core concepts of developmental biology.

Name: Dialogue, Dance, and Decompress
Description: This student organization will function as a versatile platform, welcoming students from diverse backgrounds to share their stories and experiences. It will offer a unique combination of dance and discussion sessions, fostering a vibrant community. In particular, these sessions will explore the impact of colonial and imperial history on current cultures and perspectives. Participating in the organization's activities will offer students a valuable outlet for reducing stress and enhancing their mental health through creative expression and supportive dialogue.
Summary: This student organization will serve as a multi-functional, intercultural space for expression through dance and dialogue.

Name: Digital Asset Law Association at The University of Michigan Law School
Description: DALA aims to create a community of students curious about blockchain technology and digital assets and their legal, policy, and regulatory implications. DALA seeks both to i) provide opportunities for students to learn, research, and discuss the novel benefits and risks associated with digital assets and their applications (both financial and otherwise), and ii) serve as a hub of academic, professional, and social resources relating to blockchain and digital assets at the law school.
Summary: DALA is a student organization for students eager to learn more about the intersection of blockchain technology and the law

Name: Digital Painting
Description:
Digital Painting (DigiPaint) is the first Digital Art club at the University of Michigan and is a new and rising club where students learn digital painting and grow with a community of artists! We have both casual and professional focuses—whether you're looking to learn about digital painting, or get a job in the digital art industry!

Our club nurtures students throughout their digital painting journey by fostering a sense of community where artists of all levels can grow and form meaningful connections with like-minded individuals. We support each other through social and professional events where students can hone their skills and their careers through workshops, art challenges and critique, casual painting jams and professional networking opportunities.


Join our community on discord here! https://discord.gg/eW8fzuV8C6
Summary: Learn digital painting and grow with a community of artists at DigiPaint, the first Digital Art club at the University of Michigan!

Name: Digital Studies Institute
Description: The University of Michigan is a center of innovation in key digital technologies such as self-driving cars and artificial intelligence that will already are or will become part of our everyday lives. There are ethical, cultural, social, and aesthetic implications to these rapidly developing technologies that Michigan faculty and students are uniquely qualified to address. The Digital Studies Institute provides space for scholars of the humanities and qualitative social sciences who are experts on digital studies and supports their research and teaching. We are the nation's first one-stop shop for all things digital, including digital media studies, digital humanities, digital pedagogy, digital art, aesthetic practice and design, and critical thinking about our digital future. Digital Studies is a big tent that has always included practitioners, critics, theorists, and artists. We are also a national leader in the study of digital media and race, gender, and identity.
Summary: The Digital Studies Institute provides space for scholars of the humanities and qualitative social sciences who are experts on digital studies and supports their research and teaching.

Name: Dil Se
Description:
Dil Se's mission is to provide a collaborative brave space for those challenged with or who want to be educated on Mental Health. Dil Se is focused on supporting the South Asian community, but welcomes those of other intersecting identities, including but not limited to differing race, gender, sexuality, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, ability, etc.  We want to design and initiate an environment where those that are challenged with Mental Health can come to in order to build a community of supportive peers that can relate and understand such struggles.

We are not offering professional support ourselves, but rather can guide those that need professional help to appropriate resources. Our team hopes to create differing yet significant programs and projects that can facilitate these dialogues.

Dil Se aims to develop ways in which the stigma of Mental Health, especially in South Asian communities, can be combated with emphasis on advocacy and giving voice to narratives that may not be heard due to it.
Summary: Dil Se's mission is to provide a collaborative brave space for those challenged with or who want to be educated on Mental Health. Dil Se is focused on supporting the South Asian community, but welcomes those of other intersecting identities as well.

Name: Disabilities Research, Education, and Advocacy Movement
Description:
Our goals are two-fold: to empower and educate. We will empower individuals with disabilities by providing resources, spreading awareness, and giving them a platform to share their unique voices. We will educate members in the Arab American community and beyond about the struggles and successes of individuals with disabilities. 

​

We work to accomplish our mission through the power of research and community efforts. By using research as the main method of advocacy, we hope to disseminate evidence-based data to our community and familiarize others with the prevalence of disabilities and how individuals with disabilities are often underserved.

​Alongside our ongoing research, we produce the Discovering Disabilities in Dearborn podcast, with episodes released monthly to highlight the voices of Arab Americans with disabilities and their advocates. This podcast is meant to share the stories, experiences, and lives of those with disabilities to provide another means of raising awareness about disabilities in the Arab American community.

​

Through our work, we hope to build on our community's foundation. We will refine and implement novel systems to aid individuals with disabilities. Our ultimate goal is to work alongside our community and develop sustained efforts aimed at serving the disability community.
Summary: DREAM is an organization centered around pioneering change in the lives of individuals with disabilities in the Arab-American community through innovative means--namely, research and community outreach.

Name: Disability Advocacy Coalition of Health Professions
Description: The Disability Advocacy Coalition of Health Professions (DAC HP) is an interdisciplinary organization dedicated to dismantling ableism in health care. Membership is open to all graduate and professional students and trainees in health care programs, as well as affiliated staff and faculty. We aim to build a taskforce of individuals from diverse health professional disciplines to foster a culture of inclusion for disability through collaboration, education, advocacy, community outreach, and programming. This task force provides a space for students, trainees, staff, and faculty to connect and discuss ways in which the field of medicine can be inclusive and supportive of patients and providers with disabilities and how we can combat ableism in health care practice and education.
Summary: The Disability Advocacy Coalition of Health Professions (DAC HP) is an interdisciplinary organization dedicated to dismantling ableism in health care. Membership is open to all graduate and professional students and trainees in health care programs.

Name: Disability Rights Organization
Description: The Disability Rights Organization (DRO) at Michigan Law School advocates for students with disabilities in the legal community, promotes disability law scholarship, and seeks to further disability rights on campus and beyond.
Summary: This organization at the law school will serve to advocate for students with disabilities in the legal community.

Name: Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan
Description: The goal of the Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan shall be to create an organization that brings students, faculty and staff together through the sport of disc golf. The club will work to travel to disc golf courses and participate in tournaments with other universities outside of our local area. Disc golf is an increasingly popular sport and we believe that the University of Michigan ought to play a leading role in facilitating the growth of the sport both locally and nationally.
Summary: The goal of the Disc Golf Club at the University of Michigan shall be to create an organization that brings students, faculty and staff together through the sport of disc golf.

Name: Disney Interest Group
Description: Hakuna Matata. It means “no worries.” Through movie nights, games, and lively discussions we revel in the magic Walt Disney brought into the world. The purpose of the organization is to unite students with likeminded interests in The Walt Disney Company, whether they love the movies or theme parks, seek employment opportunities, or desire to relive their childhood. As our motto states, we provide a worry-free environment for those seeking to escape from the stresses of the world in order to create magical memories.
Summary: We're bringing magic to the university through movie nights, fun games, and lively discussions, ranging in everything from the worldwide theme parks to favorite memories to Marvel.

Name: Diverse Leaders for Tomorrow
Description: It shall be the purpose of Diverse Leaders for Tomorrow (“DLT”) to develop its members to succeed in professional environments and evolve as individuals. The organization will train its members to successfully network, interview, and understand the different skillsets and careers available within each academic major and professional concentration. The main objective of DLT is to cultivate and compound a community of excellence to be utilized by underrepresented students.
Summary: DLT's purpose is to foster members professional growth and personal development. It trains in networking, interviewing, and diverse skillsets, aiming to build a community of excellence for underrepresented students, facilitating success in various career

Name: Diversity in Medicine
Description: Diversity in Medicine at the University of Michigan aims to unite health professions students and faculty from across the country to share the work they are doing to increase diversity in medicine. Our vision is to generate conversations within the medical community surrounding not only the problems associated with institutions lacking a diverse system of healthcare providers, but also the innovative solutions that many institutions are actively implementing. While many medical pipeline programs across the country have found success within their local communities, our ultimate goal is to create a coordinated effort to address the lack of diversity in medicine at a national level. We strongly believe that the most effective way to do so is to create a space for students and faculty to come together to present their work, exchange ideas, discover opportunities for collaboration, and reinforce why the work we are doing is so important.
Summary: Diversity in Medicine at UM aims to unite health professionals from across the country to highlight efforts to increase diversity in medicine. We hold an annual academic conference that creates national dialogue about increasing diversity in medicine.

Name: Division of Public Safety & Security
Description:
The Division of Public Safety and Security (DPSS) conducts all police and security operations at the University of Michigan and are on call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

Created in October 2012 to unify security functions that previously were embedded within different areas of the University, DPSS offers a truly integrated approach to safety and security, partnering across the University and helping everyone in the U-M community to take charge of their own safety.

DPSS supports the mission of the university as a partner serving to ensure a safe and secure environment while improving the quality of life for all those living, learning, working, healing and visiting within our community.

"The University of Michigan Division of Public Safety and Security is dedicated to providing a safe and secure environment for all U-M students, faculty and staff, with an emphasis on community outreach, prevention and education."
– Eddie Washington, Jr. | DPSS Executive Director

Students interested in learning more about or getting involved with DPSS services are encouraged to connect with the DPSS Student Advisory Board.
Summary: Police and Security functions on the U-M Ann Arbor campus - ensuring a safe community together.

Name: DJs A Cappella
Description: The DJs are a fun-loving, goofy, diverse group of students, and while all members come from different sides of campus, they share the same intense passion for making music! Known for experimenting with all different types of genres and sounds, this incredibly close musical family thrives on pushing boundaries and trying new things. While their priority is dedicated to fostering a fun and inclusive environment for all members, audiences, and friends, they also compete in the annual International Competition of Collegiate A Cappella (ICCA), where they snagged first place in the 2020 Great Lakes Quarterfinals, second place in 2022 and third place in 2024!
Summary: DJs A Cappella is a gender-inclusive a cappella group devoted to making quality music and loving our DJ family. We have regular fall and winter semester concerts, compete in ICCA, and sing at other gigs and events.

Name: Doctors of Tomorrow
Description: The mission of the Doctors of Tomorrow program is to stimulate interest in medicine and inspire underrepresented in medicine students to pursue careers in the health field and to provide them with the skill set that will help them to be successful on this pursuit. The undergraduate branch of DoT will further this mission by offering resources and advice to aid past participants during the college admission process.
Summary: The mission of the Doctors of Tomorrow program is to stimulate interest and inspire underrepresented minority students to pursue careers in the health field and to provide them with the skill set that will help them to be successful on this pursuit.

Name: Doctors Without Borders Friends of MSF at UMich
Description: Doctors Without Borders Friends of MSF is a national level organization affiliated with Doctors Without Borders. Our objective on campus is to advocate and fundraise for Doctors Without Borders and raise awareness to social and humanitarian global issues addressed by Doctors Without Borders.
Summary: Doctors Without Borders Student Chapter is a national level organization affiliated with Doctors without borders. Our objective on campus is to advocate and fundraise for Doctors Without Borders and raise awareness to social and humanitarian global issue

Name: Dream Corps International at the University of Michigan
Description: DC@UM is affiliated with Dream Corps International, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting reading among underprivileged children in rural China. DC@UM supports Dream Corps' mission through event hosting and fundraising during the school year. Over the summer, DC@UM also sends volunteers to rural China to build libraries and conduct hand-on teaching projects.
Summary: DC@UM is affiliated with Dream Corps International, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting reading among underprivileged children in rural China. DC@UM supports Dream Corps' mission through event hosting and fundraising.

Name: Dreams Multicultural Council
Description:
Dreams

BY NIKKI GIOVANNI

in my younger years
before i learned
black people aren’t
suppose to dream
i wanted to be
a raelet
and say “dr o wn d in my youn tears”
or “tal kin bout tal kin bout”
or marjorie hendricks and grind   
all up against the mic
and scream
“baaaaaby nightandday   
baaaaaby nightandday”
then as i grew and matured
i became more sensible   
and decided i would   
settle down
and just become
a sweet inspiration
Summary: Dreams is the Multicultural Council in Mosher Jordan Residence Hall. Its mission is to promote social justice and cultural awareness by building an inclusive, supportive and multicultural community through various events for the residents of MoJo.

Name: Duck Game Club
Description:
Duck Game Club aims to provide a welcoming social ecosystem for anybody who loves Duck Game and most people who don’t. Membership will exclusively include playing Duck Game. No experience necessary! Get in touch here.

 

//

 

“Hi, I’m Alec Meyer, founder and president of Duck Game Club. Duck Game is a player-versus-player arcade-platformer shooter developed by Landon Podbielski and published by Adult Swim Games. It released on Steam just over seven years ago on June 4th, 2015, soon after which my father discovered it and introduced it to my siblings and I. Duck Game was a beloved family pastime for us, and some years later when I received a laptop of my very own, I purchased a digital copy of Duck Game in my own name to carry on the legacy. Since then, I've formed countless valuable memories and friendships around playing Duck Game, and now, I wish to bring that experience to you."

— Alec Meyer, President and Founder of Duck Game Club

*Duck Game Club is not legally affiliated with its published namesake, nor with the University of Michigan.

Home
Summary: Duck Game Club aims to provide a welcoming social ecosystem for anybody who loves Duck Game and most people who don’t. Membership will exclusively include playing Duck Game. No experience necessary!

Name: Ducks Unlimited Wolverine Chapter
Description: Our organization seeks to protect wetlands and waterfowl throughout the state of Michigan. We reach out to students and local volunteers to spread awareness for wetlands protection and conservation.
Summary: We desire to continue the preservation of wetlands and waterfowl through a series of partnerships with private individuals, landowners, agencies, scientific communities and other entities.

Name: DUEMODA
Description: Through DUEMODA, our mission is to increase visibility of people with different walks of life that are otherwise underrepresented in the Fashion industry such as BIPOC individuals, the LGBTQ+ community, Women and people with disabilities. With this, our mission would also be to give resources and for people with lack of resources to become well connected in the world of fashion such as First generation college students, children of immigrants and people who are getting acquainted with US culture. However, this is not only limited to just underrepresented communities but for people who are passionate and interested in breaking into the fashion industry. We want our members to feel that they aren’t just another diversity token, but to feel that they can simply exist within fashion without having to explain their existence whether that be being BIPOC or Queer or both as examples of completing our mission of inclusion. Our organization also aims at social commentary through articles that question the lack of representation of marginalized groups in the fashion market at the University of Michigan. DUEMODA Eboard has the opportunity to attend some of the biggest fashion shows in the globe including NYFW, London Fashion Week, Paris and Milan Fashion Week to name a few. DUEMODA has already made history by going to all of the fashion weeks across the globe and strive to bring back those connections back to campus, something no other fashion organization has historically ever been able to do.
Summary: We, the members of DUEMODA at the University of Michigan, work towards a future of giving real world opportunities paired with a vision of inclusion and acceptance for International Fashion for those aspiring to break into the international fashion world

Name: Dynamic Dolls
Description: The goal of The Dynamic Dolls is to impact the overall community as well as the Black community through service and the expression of dance. We aim to provide a safe environment for African-American women to positively influence, impact, and empower each other and the community. As well as allow women to spread creativity and relaxation through dance.
Summary:
To impact the overall community as well as the Black community through service
and the expression of dance. We aim to provide a safe environment for African-American
women to positively influence, impact, and empower each other and the community.

Name: East African Student Association
Description: The East African diaspora is a vulnerable population that lacks an established support network withholding them from upward mobility. Our prerogative is to connect East African UM students with the larger community in Michigan to establish a network, forging strong relationships to uplift our population to succeed while healing the unaddressed wounds of intergenerational trauma. Lastly we hope to create a space to celebrate our unique heritage and background.
Summary: East African Student Association at the University of Michigan

Name: East Quad Hall Council
Description: EQ Hall Council is dedicated to make life better for all students and faculties in East Quadrangle.
Summary: EQ Hall Council is the governing body for East Quadrangle.

Name: EchoUX
Description:
EchoUX is an annual, student-led conference that creates a lasting ripple effect in the world of User Experience (UX) design, connecting the next generation of innovators with industry experts. Over two dynamic days, participants engage in user experience research presentations, design showcases, interactive tutorials, and collaborative roundtables. This platform empowers students from all UM schools—graduate and undergraduate alike—to share their products, designs, and research while highlighting their creativity and fresh perspectives.

EchoUX fosters deep connections among students, industry leaders, and fellow innovators, promoting collaboration that leads to groundbreaking ideas and solutions. It serves as a launchpad for breakthrough designs and research, encouraging students to take risks and challenge the status quo. Committed to inclusivity, EchoUX brings together diverse backgrounds and disciplines, enriching the UX design process and ensuring that the innovations and ideas generated resonate and inspire the UX community long after the conference concludes.
Summary: EchoUX is a student-driven, 2-day conference at the University of Michigan that ignites groundbreaking ideas in User Experience (UX) design.

Name: Ecological Restoration Club
Description: The Ecological Restoration Club is dedicated to ecological restoration and biological diversity conservation around UM. Workdays consist of seed collecting, prescribed burns, invasive species control, and so much more! No background or skills are required. All are welcome!
Summary: The Ecological Restoration Club is dedicated to ecological restoration and biological diversity conservation around UM.

Name: Economics Investment Committee
Description: Through meetings and events, our mission is to help each member to better understand and be able to explain the ever-changing financial world and economic policy. We hope to prepare students interested in Economics for potential careers in the field, such as finance, consulting, and public policy roles through education and professional development.
Summary: EIC is established for the expressed purpose of developing each member's understanding of capital markets, value investing, portfolio diversification, financials & metrics, and governmental economic policy.

Name: ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter
Description: ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter aims to establish a more connected peer network amongst students – both graduate and undergraduate – to promote science and technology related to electrochemistry. The goal of the chapter is to promote collaborative teaching, learning, and networking opportunities for students at the University of Michigan.
Summary: The members of ECS University of Michigan Student Chapter, in order to establish an interdisciplinary peer network focused on advancing solid state, electrochemical science, and technology

Name: Education Law and Policy Society
Description: Prior to coming to law school, many Michigan Law students served as teachers in the traditional sense or by serving with, Teach For America, Teaching Fellows, City Year, or the Peace Corps.  There are also students who do not come from the aforementioned programs but who nevertheless have a strong desire to discuss, debate, and address education-related issues.  The Society strives to provide awareness to the Michigan Law School community about the tremendous educational inequities that still exist over 50 years after the monumental Brown decision of 1954. The Society seeks to host speakers and events throughout the school year to generate discussions surrounding issues relating to education. The Society also strives to serve as a resource for law students who are interested in pursuing careers in education law and/or policy and other student-centered areas of the law.
Summary: Education Law and Policy Society (ELPS) is a student-led organization designed to create awareness by providing Michigan Law students with a forum to discuss all issues relating to education.

Name: Egyptian Student Association
Description: The Egyptian Student Association at the University of Michigan serves Egyptian students and Egyptian enthusiasts alike. ESA contributes to the richness and diversity of the campus environment by organizing activities and events that revolve around Egypt and Egyptian culture. We are an apolitical and non-religious organization open to all Egyptians and Egypt enthusiasts. The ESA organizes various social and community service events as well as educational panels pertaining to events in Egypt and the Middle East.
Summary: We are an apolitical, non-religious organization open to all Egyptians and Egyptian enthusiasts alike. The ESA organizes various social and community service events as well as educational panels pertaining to Egypt and the Middle East.

Name: Eisenberg Family Depression Center
Description: Campus Mind Works (www.campusmindworks.org) is a website and outreach program developed by the Eisenberg Family Depression Center to support student mental health. The website was designed to simplify access to resources and provide information about managing mental health in college. Free, bi-monthly education and support groups are offered for undergraduate and graduate students.
Summary: Campus Mind Works (www.campusmindworks.org) is a website and outreach program developed by the Eisenberg Family Depression Center to support student mental health.

Name: Element 1
Description: Element-1 is the University of Michigan's only breakdancing club. We are committed to fostering friendship and leadership through hip-hop and in particular its dance form, bboying (breakdancing). In order to uphold our objective, we meet at least twice a week to practice and learn from each other. We also hold workshops and once a year we host a large breakdancing competition as well as smaller one which brings many renowned figures in the hip-hop community together, giving University of Michigan students the chance to meet them and learn about the impact hip hop has on modern culture.
Summary: Element 1 is the University of Michigan's only breakdancing club. We are committed to fostering friendship and leadership through hip-hop, and in particular, its dance form, bboying (breakdancing).

Name: Elementary Engineering Partnerships
Description: We aim to provide elementary students with exposure to engineering careers through student-led, human-centered, interactive design experiences and sustained mentorship with undergraduate engineering students. Our mission is accomplished by adhering to our values of learning and education, relationships, creativity, and innovation. Our program can be easily incorporated into classrooms by supplementing the Next Generation Science Standards for engineering design and Essential Elements of Project Based Learning.
Summary: We aim to provide elementary students with exposure to engineering disciplines through student-led, human-centered, interactive design experiences and sustained mentorship with undergraduate engineering students.

Name: Emergency Medicine Interest Group
Description: The Emergency Medicine Interest Group (EMIG) is a medical student interest group at UMMS dedicated to providing medical students with early exposure to the exciting field of Emergency Medicine. Our activities include workshops throughout the year covering topics such as suturing, airway, shock/code management, casting/splinting, IV placement, Survival Flight, and EMS. We also aim to provide networking venues such as an annual picnic, resident and faculty Q&A sessions, and end-of-year awards ceremony where students can identify and build relationships with faculty mentors. This interest group is intended for medical students only.
Summary: The Emergency Medicine Interest Group (EMIG) is a medical student interest group at UMMS dedicated to providing medical students with early exposure to the exciting field of Emergency Medicine.

Name: Empowering Women in Law UMICH
Description:
Empowering Women in Law UMich is the second established chapter of the national Empowering Women in Law organization. We are an organization that serves to bring together dedicated, like-minded students to discuss issues involving women in the world of law, while working together to achieve our professional and academic goals.
We host bi-weekly meetings in which we invite prominent speakers - including women lawyers, judges, and politicians - to come in and share their experiences as a woman in the legal field, answer your questions, and provide invaluable advice and networking opportunities. Most of these meetings take place on Zoom, as we are able to have a larger, more impressive variety of speakers join us on this platform. In addition to speaker meetings, we also host bonding events like group dinners or study sessions so members can connect with peers and develop resourceful friendships.
EWIL also hosts law school tours, provides members with LSAT prep class discounts, and participates in philanthropy aimed at improving educational opportunities for women and girls.
EWIL began as an organization at Michigan State University in 2018, and enjoyed great success and membership participation there. As a result, EWIL has expanded to and will continue to expand as a national organization.
Summary: We are an organization that serves to bring together dedicated, like-minded students to discuss issues involving women in the world of law, while working together to achieve our professional and academic goals.

Name: Empty Mug Records
Description: Empty Mug Records is a student-run record label based in Ann Arbor, Michigan, devoted to helping artists that we’re passionate about and creating a local community of music lovers. Whether that’s through booking concerts, producing music and videos, promoting, or design — we’re excited to help musicians get their sound out there!
Summary: Empty Mug Records is an independent, student-run record label that aims to create a support network for local musicians and give means to distribute creative works on the University of Michigan’s campus through live shows, production, and design.

Name: Enactus
Description: Enactus was founded to enable progress through entrepreneurial action. Our consulting projects are selected looking both at our own community here in Ann Arbor as well as other communities around the world. We work with our clients to address their needs foremost, with projects drawing from finance to strategy to even computer science. We love to take on big problems and want to create solutions that better the communities we care about.
