Summary: The Michigan Aeronautical Science Association (MASA) is an engineering project team committed to increasing student interest in the design, analysis, manufacturing, testing, and launching of rockets at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan AI Safety Initiative
Description:
MAISI’s mission is to:

  • Build the AI safety community at the University of Michigan

  • Launch students into high-impact AI safety careers

  • Conduct research that reduces the risk of AI-related catastrophes

MAISI runs in-person cohorts of programs like AI Safety Fundamentals and Intro to ML Safety, as well as discussion meetings and social events. Club organizers help members make career plans for AI safety and find relevant research + internship opportunities. Both graduate and undergraduate students are welcome.

To get involved or learn more, check out linktr.ee/maisi_club.
Summary: The Michigan AI Safety Initiative (MAISI) is a student group dedicated to positively shaping the development of advanced AI, with a focus on preventing catastrophes.

Name: Michigan All-Girl Competitive Cheer
Description:
The Michigan All-Girl Competitive Cheer team exists to allow female athletes to cheer on a collegiate-level cheer team. Michigan All-Girl Competitive Cheer strives to achieve an enthusiastic atmosphere for team members, fans, and all others involved. The team encourages personal and group-based development to allow each member to become well-rounded individuals, both athletically and socially, with the goal of equipping women with a greater experience to prepare members for life beyond the University.

Michigan All-Girl Competitive Cheer is a registered student organization at the University of Michigan that participates in the National Cheerleading Association (NCA) and NCAA STUNT with competitions held throughout the Midwest. Near the end of the Winter semester, the Michigan All-Girl Cheer Team participates in NCA Collegiate Cheerleading Nationals in Daytona, Florida. In addition to competitive cheer, the Michigan All-Girl Cheer Team participates in local and state-wide events.

Michigan All-Girl Cheer practices 2-3 times a week. If you are interested in joining, fill out the form below or contact us by email: 

fill out this form if interested! MAGC Interest Form

mcheerofficers@umich.edu

Check us out on instagram: @michiganallgirlcheer
Summary: The only all-girl competitive cheerleading team on campus. We compete in the National Cheerleading Association (NCA) collegiate cheer nationals in Daytona Beach Florida, along with NCAA STUNT competitions in Michigan during the winter semester.

Name: Michigan Anthropology Graduate Students
Description:
Michigan Anthropology Graduate Students (MAGS) is a student organization composed of and dedicated to serving graduate students at all stages of their progress through the Department of Anthropology. Specifically, our goals are:

 

  • To foster community and a network of peer support for anthropology graduate students through a combination of social events, activism, and professional development initiatives.

 

  • To provide a space for connection across the four subfields where graduate students can stay informed about departmental news, learn about the work and experiences of their colleagues, and uphold a broad and inclusive understanding of anthropology as a field.

 

  • To advocate for graduate students in departmental affairs and maintain avenues for student representation in departmental governance.

 

  • To support and collaborate with other student organizations within Anthropology.
Summary: Michigan Anthropology Graduate Students (MAGS) is a student organization composed of and dedicated to serving graduate students at all stages of their progress through the Department of Anthropology.

Name: Michigan Aquaponics
Description:
Michigan Aquaponics aims to serve as a source of aquaponics technology and business expertise for both local communities, such as the University of Michigan, as well as interested global communities. As technology experts, Michigan Aquaponics will serve its communities by 1) educating people on issues of food security and sustainable food systems related to aquaponics, 2) implementing functional aquaponics systems with interested community-level partners, and 3) providing business development support for partners wishing to implement aquaponics as a solution to their expressed needs. Michigan Aquaponics is also committed to creating a vibrant and diverse community of students from across Michigan.

Michigan Aquaponics is made up of students from across discipline areas including, but not limited to, business, engineering, natural sciences, policy, and mathematics. We welcome any and all students interested in aquaponics and social change!
Summary: The Aquaponics Team at UMich designs sustainable aquaponics systems, promoting eco-friendly agriculture and hands-on learning. We focus on innovation, research, and community engagement to prepare leaders in sustainable development.

Name: Michigan Argentine Tango Club
Description: Michigan Argentine Tango Club (MATC) is a volunteer-based student organization dedicated to sharing the art of Argentine Tango. We strongly believe in cultivating a sense of community and shared-learning among members and fostering an environment that promotes equity and expression.
Summary: We are a student organization dedicated to the philosophy and proposition that tango is not a commodity but rather an art form to be shared freely.  We offer regular Argentine tango lessons and dance events to U-M students of all levels.

Name: Michigan Artistic Swimming
Description:
Founded in 1946, the University of Michigan Artistic Swimming Team (formerly the University of Michigan Synchronized Swimming Team) is a nationally competitive team focused on encouraging swimmers to grow as athletes and individuals. We promote teamwork, love of sport, and create an environment of sportsmanlike conduct for all levels of competition and ability.

The Michigan Artistic Swimming team trains during fall semester and competes at 5 meets during winter semester with a water show in April.

Practices this semester are at most three times a week at Canham Natatorium from 9-11pm Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday. Prior synchro experience is not necessary to be on the team. If you're interested in joining, please contact scpete@umich.edu for more information.
Summary: The Michigan Artistic Swimming Team is a nationally competitive team under USA Artistic Swimming. We accommodate for all skill levels and no prior artistic swimming experience is needed!

Name: Michigan Autonomous Aerial Vehicles
Description:
MAAV strives to be the premier autonomous aerial vehicle organization at the University of Michigan and offer students a unique way to expand their knowledge outside of the classroom. By competing in the International Aerial Robotics Competition, MAAV has found a venue in which to challenge its members to push the limits of their abilities and demonstrate their success on a global stage.

MAAV members engage in designing, manufacturing, programming, and testing every aspect of an autonomous aerial vehicle. Members will gain experience in technical areas such as structural design and manufacturing, embedded programming, control theory, navigation and mapping, and computer vision. Due to the many different aspects of designing, building, and flying an experimental unmanned aerial vehicle, MAAV members will also gain valuable experience in independent research, group leadership, and communication. Engaged MAAV members are prepared for internships, private sector work, and research.

 

Please see http://www.maavumich.org/
Summary: To advance the state of the art in aerial robotics at the University of Michigan by providing students with hands-on, collaborative experience in embedded programming, control theory, navigation and mapping, imaging, and composite manufacturing.

Name: Michigan Autonomous Security Team
Summary: An Engineering project team dedicated to giving students the opportunity to explore, implement, and fly autonomous systems for purposes of security and performance in drone games.

Name: Michigan Aviators
Description:
Michigan Aviators is a student organization with the goal of promoting aviation-related activities at the University of Michigan. Our primary purpose is to foster a community of both pilots and aviation enthusiasts within Michigan and to help expose more students to the world of aviation. Our goal is to facilitate a space for students who are interested in aviation to interact with the industry through events, showcases, and tours. Membership with Michigan Aviators does not require any time commitments and we are simply looking to offer events and experiences to help introduce students to the world of aviation.

Our goals as a student organization are summarized as follows:

  • Help promote aviation within the University of Michigan and the Aerospace Engineering department.
  • Educate students in topics relevant to aviation through seminars and “ground school” courses.
  • Host events for students to interact with aviation-related industry members.
  • Provide outreach about pursuing a career in aviation.
  • Foster a community of pilots at Michigan.
Summary: The Michigan Aviators work to promote aviation-related activities at the University of Michigan. Our primary purpose is to foster a community of students interested in aviation and to expose more students to the opportunities in the world of aviation

Name: Michigan Backpacking Club
Description:
Visit our website for all info relevant to MBC!

https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/michiganbackpackingclub/home

 

If you’re already sold and looking to get involved…

 

-Join our email list here

-Add yourself to the Groupme

 

2024-2025 Contact: mbc-execs@umich.edu
Summary: An organization that promotes hiking and backpacking activities in the great outdoors. Monthly activities and two annual opportunities for backpacking trips dueing Fall and Spring break.

Name: Michigan Badminton Club
Description:
The Michigan Badminton Club is a non-exclusive club that aims to provide and build a stronger badminton community for badminton enthusiasts at the university. We are open to all students and faculties on campus regardless of race, color, national origin, age, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, religion, height, weight, or veteran status in employment, educational programs and activities, and admissions. Members will have the opportunity to learn badminton as well as improve their badminton skills with others who are also passionate about the sport.

The club has practice once a week on Sundays. 

If you want to play more badminton outside of practice, refer to the rec sports website for drop-in hours:

In addition, rackets can be checked out at the Recreational Sports Equipment Room, and shuttlecocks can be purchased there as well. For the spring and summer terms, you need to be enrolled in a course or have a student membership to enter either the CCRB/NCRB.

If you have any questions or need more information, please don’t hesitate to contact us.
Summary: The Michigan Badminton Club is an inclusive club that aims to provide a community for badminton enthusiasts of all levels at the university by allowing members to share their passion for the sport and improve their badminton skills with other players.

Name: Michigan Baseball and Sabermetrics Club
Description: First and foremost, welcome to Michigan Baseball and Sabermetrics Club, better known as M-SABR. Founded in 2016, our club’s purpose is to gather students interested in baseball sabermetrics and give them a platform to discuss, research, and write about baseball. We are specifically focused on using advanced analytics to develop arguments and write/publish articles to our website as a way for students to create a personal portfolio of baseball-specific content. We have a passion for baseball and our club mission is to prepare those who are interested for a future career in baseball. We have members who have worked in the Commissioner's Office, the Detroit Tigers, New York Mets, Toronto Blue Jays, Chicago Cubs, Milwaukee Brewers, and Texas Rangers. For more information on our club, please email us at michigansabermetrics@gmail.com.
Summary: Michigan Baseball and Sabermetrics Club (M-SABR), founded in 2016, is the university’s first-ever organization dedicated to sabermetrics—the advanced study of baseball statistics. As a club, M-SABR focuses on baseball writing, research, and discussion.

Name: Michigan Basketball Analytics Association
Description: Founded in 2019, our club’s purpose is to embrace the game of basketball and to reach basketball lovers not only at the University of Michigan but around the world. We are specifically focused on using advanced analytics to develop arguments and write/publish articles to our website, thus enhancing basketball knowledge in the basketball community as a whole. In addition to writing thought-provoking pieces on basketball, we intend to spread the “fun” of basketball through casual articles, social events, and various creative endeavors. We have a passion for basketball and our club mission is to embrace that passion, through writing, through research, and through bonding, and to prepare those who are interested for a future career in basketball.
Summary: The Michigan Basketball Analytics Association is a group for passionate basketball fans interested in basketball writing/research/discussion. We welcome all levels of basketball fans and are interested in both the collegiate and professional levels.

Name: Michigan Bhangra Team
Description: The Michigan Bhangra Team was started in the Fall of 2000 with a very distinct vision: we strive to promote awareness of Punjabi culture and the importance of diversity and multiculturalism. We accomplish these goals by performing at numerous charity and cultural events for both our campus community and the community at large. Our team is known for our energy both on and off stage; we are driven to inspire others with our passion, dedication, and unique style. Our performance is based upon a foundation of camaraderie, creativity, and spirit, all elements we hope will work to transcend social boundaries to build a sense of community and awareness.
Summary: The Michigan Bhangra Team strives to promote awareness of Punjabi culture and the importance of diversity and multiculturalism. We accomplish these goals by performing at numerous charity events for both our campus community and community at large.

Name: Michigan Bird Club
Description:
We seek to engage and educate students and other U of M affiliates in recreational birding and bird conservation by leading bird-watching trips, participating in local ornithological events, and hosting on campus educational opportunities.

We meet every few weeks to bird the local hotspots and have less common trips to further destinations. No experience required to join! All are welcome to tag along on any of our bird-related adventures.

Stay in touch by joining our GroupMe (https://groupme.com/join_group/71440121/EPxZJ0ZE)!
Summary: The purpose of the Michigan Bird Club is to inspire U of M students and other U of M community members to enjoy and protect birds.

Name: Michigan Blockchain
Description:
Our mission is to prepare students to excel in the Blockchain space by providing professional development opportunities alongside industry partners, building educational resources with multidisciplinary facets, and aiding students in meaningful research and project development in DeFi (Decentralized Finance).
 
Join our Discord to keep up with all events and sessions.
 
Join our mailing list by going here and clicking "Join Group" on the top left!
Summary: Our mission is to prepare students to excel in the Blockchain space by providing professional development opportunities alongside industry partners, building educational resources, and aiding students in meaningful research and project development.

Name: Michigan Bowling Club
Description: The mission of the Michigan Bowling Club is to offer recreational and competitive opportunities at an affordable rate for students. All members are welcome to attend any amount of practices they wish as well as have the option to join the competitive team. We look to make this club an inviting space for all, as there's no skill level requirement for membership! Our practices are held on Tuesday's from 7pm-9pm and rides are provided.
Summary: The Michigan Bowling Club makes an effort to connect students interested in both recreational and competitive bowling at the university level. We strive to make an inclusive environment regardless of skill level or previous experience.

Name: Michigan Branch of Telluride Association
Description:
Telluride House is founded on three philosophical ‘pillars’ that form the basis of house life. They are intellectual inquiry, community service, and self-governance.

Intellectual inquiry is the first pillar of Telluride House. While all three pillars are appreciated equally, House members have consistently prided themselves on being the leaders and best in academics at the University of Michigan. This spirit appears in house life as well, where the intellectual inquiry manifests itself in the form of:

  • Pubspeaks (student presentations on any topic you are knowledgable on and wish)
  • Faculty Forums (similar to PubSpeaks, but for resident faculty)
  • Documentary screenings
  • Guest speakers and lecture series

Community service is our second pillar. Through House projects, members of the Telluride House come together to make a difference in their community while also furthering the goals of the house and the association. Projects change from year to year, but have in the past included high school tutoring with Peace Neighborhood Center, working with political refugees in Detroit, or meal preparation at Food Gatherers.

Self-governance is our third pillar at Telluride House. Our autonomy and practice of self-governance is a unique aspect of the house in comparison to other organizations at the University of Michigan. At Telluride House, self-governance means…

  • House meetings, following Robert's Rules of Order, where students make administrative and budgetary decisions about the house processes
  • Committee work (Entertainment Committee, Logistics Committee, Advisory Committee, and Recruitment Committee.
  • Democratic development and selection of our community service project
  • Democratic selection of new house members and faculty guests, through application review for two, yearly cycles

Whether sitting in House meetings, working in a committee, or amending the by-laws, there are countless opportunities for and experiences with leadership and self-governance inherent in house life.

Other benefits of the fellowship include (but are not limited to): Miscellaneous funds allocated for house improvements, events and outings, snacks and beverage preferences, streaming service and magazine subscriptions; exposure and mentorship from other members across diverse fields (Medicine, Law, Social Work, Engineering, Philosophy, History, etc.); freshly cooked meals from a personal chef, each day; fully furnished rooms; lifetime membership to the Telluride Association; opportunities for grants and funding associated with community service, thesis writing; a home gym, free parking/parking passes, and more.
Summary: The Telluride House offers great opportunities for personal, intellectual, and relationship growth within a diverse and stimulating community. This full (room-and-board) residential fellowship is open for undergraduates and graduates of all disciplines.

Name: Michigan Business & Entrepreneurial Law Review
Description:
The Journal's mission is to serve as a vessel for practitioner and scholarly work, including regulatory, securities, corporate, tax, intellectual property, and other legal issues involved with private equity and venture capital. 

In order to enrich its members' educational experience, the Journal seeks to comprehensively prepare its members to perform the editorial and administrative tasks required to publish a professional legal journal while simultaneously assisting each of its members in preparing an original work of scholarship adequate for publication.
Summary: The Journal's mission is to serve as a vessel for practitioner and scholarly work, including regulatory, securities, corporate, tax, intellectual property, and other legal issues involved with private equity and venture capital.

Name: Michigan Business Group
Description: Michigan Business Group, also known as MBG, is a student organization dedicated to facilitate the study of business academics, hands-on experience of the real business world, exploration of new business opportunities, and networking among students and professionals through a variety of activities and events. Those include but are not limited to guest speaker events, class mentorship programs, company starting projects, business exploring trips to local companies and abroad, as well as club wise and inter-club social events. Hands-on experience is offered across the three main areas of business: finance, marketing, and consulting.
Summary: To introduce the world of business to members of the University of Michigan community and to inspire individual career decisions.

Name: Michigan Business Law
Description: Michigan Business Law is the premier business law club at the University of Michigan, dedicated to fostering education, research, and a strong community for students interested in the intersection of business and law. Through mentorship, professional development, speakers, and targeted programs, we aim to increase accessibility and awareness of business law while equipping students with the knowledge and skills to navigate the field. Our commitment to research and collaborative environments helps members prepare for possible business law careers and internships.
Summary: Michigan Business Law (MBL) is an organization aiming to help students pursue academic, professional, and social opportunities within the intersection of business and law.

Name: Michigan Business Social Association
Description: The Michigan Business Social Association’s (MBSA) mission is to ensure that all members of the Ross School of Business MBA community have a quality experience outside of the classroom during their time in Ann Arbor. As the largest MBA student organization on campus, MBSA hosts countless social events throughout the academic year to create a fun-filled environment separate from academics and corporate recruiting. With so many students coming to Ross because of its strong social culture, MBSA strives to ensure students get just the experience they wanted here!
Summary: The Michigan Business Social Association’s (MBSA) mission is to ensure that all members of the Ross School of Business MBA community have a quality experience outside of the classroom during their time in Ann Arbor.

Name: Michigan Business Women (BBA)
Description:
Interested in joining! Please fill out this interest form to stay updated and get information on our first mass meeting:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRlVeXpbWxlihWYHHheYYV9yPsPtOqSyVg2kywQUADAeJCHA/viewform?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAaZ1DKIGK7DXK9DmekfqjdWBf9OKzWRl8LGQQHIr4DMuCNvzSkfp4HmvkAc_aem_nkT-hJgL8ajbZivjERqenw&pli=1

Michigan Business Women (BBA) is student organization dedicated to providing women in business the resources to be successful. Our members have access to a number of private professional events, including corporate recruiting and in-organization professional development. We strengthen the ties between our members through social events focused on building relationships. We support our community at both the University of Michigan and within Ann Arbor through philanthropy. Through these resources, our members have the ability to grow in their business capabilities and become well-rounded women as they leave Michigan and enter the workforce.
Summary: Michigan Business Women supports and empowers women in business through professional, social, and philanthropic events.

Name: Michigan Business Women - MBA
Description: Michigan Business Women (MBW) is a graduate student club that promotes students' personal and professional development by providing education, networking and social interaction opportunities with Ross undergraduate and graduate students, faculty, administrators, and alumni, as well as professional women in the business community. MBW is committed to creating a supportive community by addressing topics significant to women in business and providing a forum where diverse experiences, perspectives, and resources can be shared.
Summary:
Mission:
1) Promote a sense of community among women at Ross
2) Provide opportunities to network with alumnae and other professional women
3) Promote learning and discussion of issues of significance to women in business

Name: Michigan Camping Club
Description:
The premiere Camping and Outdoors club on campus. Our mission is to reconnect with nature through a series of outdoor/recreational events. Helping foster genuine connections amongst our members.

 

If you would like to join, please reach out via email so that you can pay dues and we can add you to our email list!
Summary: The premiere Camping and Outdoors club on campus. Our mission is to reconnect with nature through a series of outdoor/recreational events. Helping foster genuine connections amongst our members

Name: Michigan Capital Investment
Description:
Michigan Capital Investment (MCI)

MCI is dedicated to providing its members with a robust education in financial markets through interactive discussions, hands-on practice, and collaborative learning. As part of the Michigan community, we focus on enhancing investing acumen while connecting students with top financial institutions, regulatory agencies, and esteemed investors. Our mission is to equip aspiring professionals with practical skills, market insights, and valuable networking opportunities, preparing them for successful careers in global financial markets.
Summary: The purpose of MCI is to provide members with education on Chinese financial markets along with a discussion and practice platform to improve their investing acumen.

Name: Michigan Capital Management
Description:
At MCM, we are firm believers that a student’s passion for business should not be hindered by what college they are enrolled in. 

LSA, School of Engineering, Stamps, Ross, doesn’t matter. Any student who can demonstrate their interest in business investment and aptitude for learning is qualified for our club.

Through a multitude of measures including case interview training, stock pitches, resumé workshops, professional guest speakers, and real-world investing, members will gain the business acumen needed to thrive in any and all industries.
Summary: MCM is a business investment club not affiliated with Ross. We currently focus on stock investing. We are open to all colleges on campus.

Name: Michigan Carbon Capture
Description:
Our mission is to build a diverse network of students with tangible interest and involvement in the carbon removal community. Each facet of our organization grapples with the task of getting carbon sequestration and utilization recognized and implemented as a mainstream climate solution, and shifting the sources of carbon for everyday living from fossil to non-fossil sources. We seek to incorporate students from all different majors, including engineering, business, climate and sustainability, art and design, and public policy, and have the flexibility to expand into different departments based on the interest and expertise of our members.

We strive to create leaders on campus who will impact industry, government, and academia through their accomplishments during and after their college experience. Above all, we hope they can enhance the global perception of carbon removal as a promising climate solution through their advocacy and responsibility to sustainable action.
Summary: We are a multidisciplinary organization involving undergraduate and graduate students in educational opportunities within the field of carbon removal, such as seminars, technical projects, professional development, and community outreach.

Name: Michigan Caregivers and Student Parents
Description: MCaSP aims to build a support system that welcomes and celebrates the presence of student parents and caregivers on the University of Michigan campus.
Summary: MCaSP aims to build a support system that welcomes and celebrates the presence of student parents and caregivers on the University of Michigan campus.

Name: Michigan Casual Run Club
Description: Our run club is all about enjoying the journey at a relaxed pace. We welcome runners of all levels—whether you're a seasoned runner looking for a recovery jog or a beginner taking your first steps. No pressure, no pace requirements—just easy miles, good conversation, and post-run social time. Whether it’s grabbing coffee, brunch, or a refreshing smoothie, we believe running should be fun, inclusive, and a way to connect with others. Join us for a laid-back run and good company!
Summary: A welcoming run club for all levels—no pace expectations, just relaxed miles, good conversation, and post-run meetups over coffee, brunch, or smoothies. We believe running should be fun and social—join us for an easy jog and great company!

Name: Michigan Catholics
Description:
Michigan Catholics offers a space and community for undergraduates and grad students alike to grow in their faith and in fellowship with one another. We offer opportunities for faith formation through our Sunday Student Mass at 8pm, small group bible studies, weekly adoration, regular confession times, daily mass, and service opportunities. Michigan Catholics also provides ways to grow in community through Men's and Women's Connect Groups, Thursday Ig.nite Dinners, IM Sport teams, and a study lounge open to students. 

Michigan Catholics seeks to reflect the values of the Catholic Church, but membership is open to any current student at the University of Michigan, regardless of religious affiliation. All are welcome to join us!
Summary: Michigan Catholics is the official student organization associated with St. Mary Student Parish. We offer opportunities for students to grow in faith and fellowship, and seek to provide a rich parish community where students can feel at home.

Name: Michigan Chai Club
Description: Michigan Chai Club is an organization devoted to educating students on varieties of chai from south asia and beyond. We hope to foster a community around south asian culture and provide a taste of home for all south asians involved.
Summary: Michigan Chai Club is an organization devoted to educating students on varieties of chai from south asia and beyond. We hope to foster a community around south asian culture and provide a taste of home for all south asians involved.

Name: Michigan Chinese Business Club
Description:
Michigan Chinese Business Club (MCBC) is a premier business club that focuses on bridging the gap between the Chinese and the U.S. markets. As a business club, MCBC hosts an abundance of resources to help our members build a strong foundation in business acumen, innovative leadership, and strong teamwork skills.

We pride ourselves in our engaging discussions in our meetings about headlines in Chinese and U.S. markets. Additionally, between our finance and strategy initiatives, we strive to foster professional development through hands-on work and deliverables.

Above all, Michigan Chinese Business Club where you will find a flourishing community of like-minded peers!

 

Website: www.umcbc.org

Instagram: @mcbc_um

Email: mcbc-board@umich.edu
Summary:
MCBC’s mission is to foster a community centered around exploring opportunities and exchanging ideas with a focus on US and Chinese business.

We adhere to our three pillars of community, knowledge, and opportunity.

Name: Michigan Christian Study Center Student Ambassadors Council
Summary: The MCSC Student Council is the student group associated with the Michigan Christian Study Center (MCSC). The MCSC Council plans and executes events which assist the MCSC in providing authentic community that connects Christian faith and academic.

Name: Michigan Climbing Club
Description:
A recreational climbing club for all University of Michigan students, faculty, staff, and alumni.

Members may utilize MCC resources to network with other climbers, find gym partners, organize events and climbing trips, and grow their climbing skill base.

Member benefits include discounts at Moosejaw, access to climber networking and carpools to Planet Rock, gear rental and sharing, and reduced-price trips to outdoor climbing destinations.
Summary: The MCC was founded to provide training and travel opportunities to rock climbers and build a climbing community among the students, faculty, and staff of the University.

Name: Michigan Climbing Team
Description: The University of Michigan Climbing Team is committed to fostering the development of a nationally competitive climbing team, supporting new and experienced athletes alike. The team serves to grow climbing as a competitive sport by fostering teamwork, dedication, inclusivity and fun.
Summary: The University of Michigan Climbing Team is committed to supporting competitive climbers and developing the sport at the University.

Name: Michigan Club Baseball
Description: The Michigan Club Baseball Team provides students at the University of Michigan with the opportunity to continue playing baseball at a competitive level. We compete in the Great Lakes North Conference of the National Club Baseball Association, playing teams from across the Midwest. We play around 25 games each year with the goal of earning a spot in the National Club Baseball World Series in Alton, Illinois. Michigan Club Baseball prioritizes the development of each player's skills, working in the community, fostering a competitive atmosphere, and most importantly, winning.
Summary: University of Michigan Club Baseball Team

Name: Michigan Club Basketball
Description:
We play other university club basketball teams in tournaments and games; we are currently registered in the NCBBA, the largest university club basketball organization in the nation. In addition to games, we will also practice 2-3 times a week. We hold tryouts in September each year. We practice year-round, but the season runs from November through April.

Please do not reach out about joining the team. Tryouts will be held in the first two weeks of fall semester. Keep an eye out at Festifall for more information on tryouts.

 

Co-Presidents: Jordan Fansler and Noah Arsulowicz

Vice President: Andrew Zimmerman

Social Chair: Matthew Nervi

Outreach Chair: Mauro Vallejo
Summary: We are a student-led club basketball organization officially recognized by the National Club Basketball Association (NCBBA).

Name: Michigan Club Field Hockey
Description:
We are looking for highly skilled and competitive players who will be committed to the team.

Your commitment will be 2-3 days a week ~2 hours each day as well as some full-day Saturday/Sunday tournaments. 

*FH is never scheduled on Football Saturdays :)
Summary: Our club team is part of the National Field Hockey League competing and traveling to other colleges across the country to be eligible for the Fall Championship. We are a team of highly skilled, competitive, and committed players.

Name: Michigan Club Softball
Description: Michigan Club Softball is part of the Club Sports Program and National Club Softball Association (NCSA). We play other university club softball teams around the Midwest. Our schedule consists of approximately 5 conference triple headers per season (Fall and Spring) along with tournament play. We practice twice a week throughout the school year in order to stay competitive, and we volunteer and fundraise to stay engaged in our community.
Summary: The Michigan Club Softball team was formed to create a competitive outlet for those interested in playing fastpitch softball. Our objective is to establish a level of competition as high as can be attained at the club level.

Name: Michigan Club Squash
Description:
Michigan Club Squash was founded in 2018 to provide a team atmosphere for squash players on campus. Since then, the team has seen immediate success at all levels of competition. Over the 2021-2022 regular season, we went 10-0, which included taking down Denison University in our first win against a Varsity team and beating Ohio State twice. We finished the season 4th in the country and the 2022-2023 season 13th in the country. We continue to pursue a Club Team National Championship while strengthening squash at our University and in the state of Michigan.

 

Please visit our official website for more info: Michigan Club Squash Website
Summary: The Michigan Club Squash Team provides a competitive and fun club team for student squash players on campus. Our agenda consists of practices and collegiate tournaments, including the Club Squash National Championships.

Name: Michigan Club Swimming
Description:
Michigan Club Swimming offers weekly practices, competitive meets, and social events to those who wish to continue pursuing swimming after high school and/or age-group swimming. We accept swimmers of all abilities, speeds, and ages (both undergrad and grad students). There really is a place for everyone!

 

We have four coached practices per week, swimming at Mack Pool Monday through Wednesday 9:00-10:30 PM, and at Mack Pool on Sundays 7:30-9:00 PM. Carpools are coordinated with team members for the Mack Pool practices. We also carpool to compete in approximately 3-5 meets per semester against other universities including Nationals in late March/early April (location TBD each year)! Regional meets can be as close as ~1 hour (e.g. MSU and GVSU) and as far as 4-5 hours (e.g. Northwestern, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati, Purdue, etc.).

 

In addition to practices and meets, we hold numerous social events including a kickoff BBQ/tailgate, team pasta parties, an intra-squad Olympiad, a semi-formal, a formal, holiday events such as a Halloween party, an end-of-fall-semester Christmas party, and many more smaller social events!

 

Practices, meets and social events are all optional – you can participate as much as you'd like, but of course we would love for you to be active! Our program spans both the Fall and Winter semesters, and we welcome new members at the beginning of each semester.

 

Please visit our website at https://www.michiganclubswim.org/ to learn more about the team, and feel free to email us at michiganclubswim@gmail.com if you have any questions! To join the team, fill out THIS FORM to be added to the email list for Fall 2024.
Summary: MCS is the perfect way to stay in shape, find lifelong friends, and take a break from school stressors. We accept swimmers of all levels, holding practices 4 times per week and competing in meets once a month in addition to a variety of social events!

Name: Michigan Coffee Club
Description: The Michigan Coffee Club is an initiative focused on bringing together coffee lovers across campus. Our events focus on educating members of the Michigan community on specialty coffee, developing community and interest around coffee, and promoting access to local coffee purveyors in Ann Arbor. Our goal is to promote informed and sustainable consumption of this drink that is so widely enjoyed.  If you are looking to explore your coffee passion through tastings, visits to local roasteries, educational workshops on coffee brewing, and more, then this is the place for you!
Summary: Michigan Coffee Club is proud to be a community for all things coffee! Our mission includes coffee education, community engagement, and promotion of access, which we accomplish through coffee tastings and visits to local roasters, amongst other events.

Name: Michigan Collegiate Investment Group
Description: Michigan Collegiate Investment Group focuses on education of stock markets, equity research, and market analysis through analyst pitches, educational sessions, and weekly meetings & updates.
Summary: Michigan Collegiate Investment Group is a state-wide investment group comprised of dedicated college students from across the state of Michigan. MCIG focuses on equity-research creation to craft a diversified portfolio.

Name: Michigan Communication and Media Professionals
Description:
As the Michigan Communication and Media Professionals (Formerly Michigan Association of Communication Studies or MACS), our mission is: 

  • To explore career and internship opportunities in public relations, advertising, broadcasting, marketing, journalism, and other media professions while forging relationships with other students who share similar interests.
  • To offer numerous recruitment events and industry speakers that give students the chance to meet and learn from successful individuals in the field of communications. 
  • To schedule workshops and advising resources to allow concentrators to gain student assistance and advice on a diverse array of topics including (but not limited to) Communications courses, professors, and requirements.
Summary: Michigan Communication and Media Professionals, a student-run organization sponsored by the Communication department, educates students on media-related industries, teaches networking skills, and connects them with successful individuals in the field.

Name: Michigan Competitive Dance
Description: Michigan Competitive Dance Team, a newly founded student-run organization, brings together talented dancers from the University of Michigan under the guidance of skilled outside choreographers. Our goal is to make our mark at NDA or DTU Regional and National competitions, showcasing our passion, and precision in both the jazz and hip-hop categories. Check us out on our website and following us on Instagram for more information!
Summary: Michigan Competitive Dance Team, a newly founded student-run organization, brings together talented dancers from the University of Michigan under the guidance of skilled outside choreographers. Our goal is to compete at NDA or DTU Regional and Nationals.

Name: Michigan Computer Architecture Club
Description: The Michigan Computer Architecture Club at the University of Michigan is dedicated to the exciting goal of designing, manufacturing, and assembling a fully functional computer from scratch. This club offers a fantastic opportunity for students to dive into the world of computer architecture. Members will get hands-on experience with all aspects of creating a computer from scratch, including design, assembly, and testing. The club encourages teamwork, creativity, and practical problem-solving, making it an ideal place for aspiring engineers to learn, grow, and work on innovative projects together. While the club is focused on providing opportunities for Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering majors, it welcomes interest from all students.
Summary: The Michigan Computer Architecture Club is dedicated to the exciting goal of designing, manufacturing, and assembling a fully functional computer from scratch.

Name: Michigan Computer Graphics
Description:
In today's rapidly evolving digital landscape, computer graphics has emerged as a powerful medium that’s reshaping the way we communicate, entertain, and interact with the world around us. From breathtaking visual effects in games and films to immersive virtual reality experiences complemented by advancements in generative AI, computer graphics is becoming a crucial element in many industries.

 

At Michigan Computer Graphics, our goal is to offer a unique platform to explore, discuss, learn, and engage with the various disciplines of computer graphics. Whether you’re completely new to the area and curious to learn more, or an experienced enthusiast looking to enhance your skills and join a welcoming community, we have something for anyone who shares an interest in impressive and innovative technology.

 

MCG hosts informative discussions, guest lectures, and unique hands-on projects where you can gain practical experience and connect with fellow CG enthusiasts. You'll also have the opportunity to collaborate on exciting projects, develop your creative skills, and expand your network within the industry and beyond. Some of the topics you'll be seeing include Rendering, Blender, CG programming, CG hardware, Generative AI, and more.

 

Come join us as we explore the endless possibilities of computer graphics at Michigan Computer Graphics!

 

If you're interested, please fill out this interest form and join our Discord community!
Summary: Community dedicated to the field of Computer Graphics, a subject residing along the intersection of computer science, physics, math, and the arts. Join to learn, practice, build, discuss, and explore the world of Computer Graphics!

Name: Michigan Concrete Canoe Team
Description: The Michigan Concrete Canoe team works together to design, fabricate, and race a canoe made from concrete as part of the annual ASCE National Concrete Canoe Competition. As a multidisciplinary design team operating out of the Wilson Student Team Project Center, the team offers hands-on experience in concrete design and mixing, canoe hull design, theme aesthetics, construction techniques, technical communications, and more. MCCT strives to provide an inclusive, collaborative, and safe environment for students to learn and create and encourages all engineering and non-engineering majors to join.
Summary: The Michigan Concrete Canoe team works together to design, fabricate, and race a canoe made from concrete as part of the annual ASCE National Concrete Canoe Competition.

Name: Michigan Council of Nurse Practitioners at University of Michigan - Ann Arbor School of Nursing Student Affiliate Chapter
Description:
Michigan Council of Nurse Practitioners, University of Michigan - Ann Arbor School of Nursing Student Affiliate Chapter (MICNP UMSN) seeks to provide Student Nurse Practitioners a venue to understand the professional issues that impact Advanced Practice Registered Nurse practice in the state of Michigan and advocate for the Nurse Practitioner role. MICNP UMSN seeks to aid in the development of the whole student, his/her professional role, and his/her responsibility for the health care of people from all walks of life. MICNP UMSN aims to increase understanding of the role of a professional organization in improving health care outcomes.

To join MICNP, please visit our website! You will be contacted by our membership chair after submitting the interest form.
Summary: MICNP UMSN is an organization composed of student nurse practitioners (NPs). MICNP UMSN strives to provide its members opportunities to understand, promote, and grow in their role as future Advanced Practice Registered Nurses.

Name: Michigan Cricket Club
Description: Michigan Cricket Club comprises a group of students who maintain a keen interest in all things cricket. We play outdoor cricket in the summer and indoors in the winter.
Summary: We are all students at the University of Michigan who have a keen interest in cricket. We meet every weekend at the Coliseum for indoor cricket with a tape ball.

Name: Michigan Cycling
Description: The Cycling Team at the University of Michigan exists to promote and provide competitive opportunities for cycling to those associated with the University of Michigan. The club provides the necessary logistical, social, and motivational support necessary for beginners to get into the sport and improve, for semi-professionals to have a chance at national titles, and for everyone in between. Want to ride or race for Michigan? Please send an email to our officers.
Summary: Michigan Cycling exists to promote and provide competitive opportunities for cycling to those associated with the University of Michigan. Want to ride or race for Michigan? Join us.

Name: Michigan Data Consulting
Description:
MDC's mission is to provide innovative data-driven consulting services that deliver high-impact solutions to our clients. We aim to equip students with the analytical skills needed to solve complex business problems and drive meaningful impact across industries—fostering a community of diverse, strategic analysts across campus. Through real-world consulting projects and hackathons, MDC is dedicated to empowering the next generation of tech consultants at UM.

 

Please visit our website michigandataconsulting.org to learn more and join our mailing list!
Summary: Michigan Data Consulting empowers students with data science skills to tackle real-world business challenges. Through consulting projects and datathons, we foster a community of analytical thinkers driving meaningful impact across industries and campus.

Name: Michigan Data Science Team
Description:
Michigan Data Science Team (MDST) is a student organization dedicated to cultivating data science talent at the University of Michigan by educating our members in practical data science and machine learning and promoting their professional growth.

Interested in joining? Fill out this form or see our website at mdst.club for more information!
Summary: The Michigan Data Science Team (MDST) is a student organization dedicated to cultivating data science talent at the University of Michigan by educating members in practical data science and machine learning, and by promoting their professional growth.

Name: Michigan Debate and Public Speaking
Description:
Michigan Debate and Public Speaking is a vibrant community dedicated to fostering thoughtful discussion, open-mindedness, and the art of persuasive communication. We believe that every individual has the potential to express their ideas confidently and effectively, regardless of experience or background. Through engaging debates, collaborative discussions, and skill-building activities, we provide a platform for students to refine their public speaking abilities and develop self-assurance.

Our mission is to empower aspiring leaders by equipping them with the tools to articulate their perspectives, engage in meaningful discourse, and embrace diverse viewpoints. We emphasize respectful dialogue, the importance of compromise, and the pursuit of knowledge through debate. Whether you are looking to sharpen your rhetorical skills, challenge yourself in a supportive environment, or become a more confident speaker, Michigan Debate and Public Speaking welcomes you to join a community committed to personal and intellectual growth.
Summary: MDPS is devoted to creating an inclusive and supportive environment where members are encouraged to show creativity as they work to enhance their public speaking, debate, and professional abilities.

Name: Michigan Dining
Description: Michigan Dining Marketing
Summary: Michigan Dining Marketing

Name: Michigan DNA Day
Description:
Michigan DNA Day, or MI DNA Day for short, is an annual event where scientists visit local high schools to present interactive, hands-on lessons about genetics, genomics, and biotechnology. MI DNA Day provides a unique opportunity for high school students to meet and interact with young scientists, which often clarifies misconceptions of what a scientist looks like and breaks down barriers for students to follow scientific career paths. Scientist ambassadors also discuss their own ongoing research with students and share exciting career opportunities in science and biotechnology. Moreover, MI DNA Day allows early-career scientists to share their passion for science with students, fostering a spirit of public engagement leading to continued participation in science outreach throughout their careers.

MI DNA Day takes its name from National DNA Day, which was created to commemorate the completion of the Human Genome Project in 2003 and the discovery of DNA’s double helix in 1953. There are currently six other states with their own DNA Day programs, and we are ecstatic that Michigan is now on that growing list!
Summary: Michigan DNA Day is established to engage with high schools throughout the state of Michigan to educate students about cutting-edge facets of genetics and genomics that are relevant to their lives and to society.

Name: Michigan Dressage Team
Description: Dressage is defined as the art of riding and training a horse in a way that develops flexibility, obedience, and balance. As a dressage team, we will ride in Intercollegiate Dressage Association (IDA) shows and compete against other schools. The team is beginner-friendly as we want to make it accessible to everyone. We hope to create a welcoming environment for all regardless of past experience with horses.
Summary: We are an Intercollegiate Dressage Association (IDA) registered team that competes in IDA shows throughout the school year. We are coached by Cara Barker Yellott and have opportunities for riders of all levels of experience to ride and show.

Name: Michigan Drone Technology
Description: This club is responsible for building an artificial intelligence powered drone from scratch. This is done through vision learning(camera detection), GPS tracking, and voice recognition. We are also researching battery and flight efficiency for a long lasting drone flight. The main goal of this club is to build a cool project to present by the end of this school year. We need people from all kinds of majors, and are open to anyone joining.
Summary: Interested in building a drone controlled by artificial intelligence. We are an organization open to all disciplines including business, art, and engineering. This is a club, similar to a project team, however we are building a new design from ground up.

Name: Michigan EcoData
Description: Michigan Eco Data exists to foster a community of individuals at the University of Michigan who solve environmental and biological problems with the innovative use of technology and data analysis. The organization hosts environmental-tech talks, facilitates group ecological projects, provides support to individual student’s projects, hosts group environmental trips, and plans social gatherings. Our end goal is to build and form supported network of talented students with interests in the intersection and utilization.
Summary: Michigan Eco Data exists to foster a multidisciplinary community of passionate and innovative individuals at the University of Michigan, collaborating to apply technology, coding, and data science methods to solve local and global environmental problems.

Name: Michigan Ecology and Evolutionary Biology Society
Description: Our goal is to facilitate connections for EEB-interested students to create a vibrant community of individuals with shared interests.  We plan to provide opportunities for discussion of undergraduate research, conservation volunteering, field trips, talks from faculty and graduate students, documentary screenings, and more. All those generally interested in biology and/or research are welcome!
Summary: Our goal is to facilitate connections for EEB-interested students to create a vibrant community of individuals with shared interests.

Name: Michigan Economics Society
Description:
Founded in 1973 and rebranded in 2020, Michigan Economics Society seeks to offer programming that is not addressed in the economics curriculum alone and bring together students from all disciplines with a common interest in economics. With our sponsorship from the Economics department, we strive to further establish a strong and vibrant community of economics scholars dedicated towards furthering their knowledge and education outside of the classroom. The purpose of MES is to enhance our members' academic experience through a variety of events. We put particular emphasis on career and exclusive recruiting events, bringing prominent alumni back to campus as well as providing academic support through tutoring and mentors for core Economics classes. Ultimately, we hope to create closer bonds between students interested in economics and provide a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment to further the knowledge and education of engaged members of the organization.
 
Interested in Economics but not an Economics major? Don’t hesitate to join. Our members come from a variety of majors including business, engineering, CS, math, and many others. Our organization is open to all!
Summary: We are an Economics Department-sponsored organization created to help students further their economic interests, bridging the gap between academic economics and applying economics in professional settings.

Name: Michigan Electronic Music Collective
Description:
MEMCO is a group of DJs, producers, and event-goers that provides a platform for electronic music on campus. Every month, MEMCO hosts “Impulse” parties at an Ann Arbor venue that feature student DJs and professional guests. These events are always 18+ with a modest $5 cover, a policy set to accommodate students who are too young for or simply can’t afford excursions to 21+ events in Detroit. Impulse parties provide a safe, inclusive space for attendees to enjoy electronic music and often take on a philanthropic theme.

MEMCO also runs ongoing DJ and music production workshops, empowering members to use club-standard equipment and industry-standard software. In these ways, MEMCO maintains its tradition of teaching and learning, building a warm community of DJs, producers, dancers, and friends in the Ann Arbor area.
Summary: MEMCO is a group of DJs, producers, and event-goers that provides a platform for electronic music on campus and in the wider Ann Arbor area.

Name: Michigan Emergency Medical Services Club
Description:
The Michigan Emergency Medical Services Club (MEMSC) provides educational, volunteer, research, and career opportunities to University of Michigan students curious in pursuing a career in healthcare or the prehospital field. The two main objectives of MEMSC is to educate the general public by hosting events and teaching courses on campus, and to spark interest in medicine as a whole. MEMSC currently has over 100 active members, 40+ of whom are licensed EMTs.  

MEMSC takes pride in providing quality education for our members and the greater U of M community. We believe that education is one of the most important aspects in developing responder skills, and one of the best ways to connect with our community on a more personal level. The Michigan EMS Club offers a range of educational classes such as Stop the Bleed, CPR/AED/BLS certification (through the AHA), and first aid courses to not only club members, but the greater Michigan community. 

Our club maintains a close relationship with Huron Valley Ambulance, a local private EMS agency, to facilitate the training, certification, and service of emergency medical technicians at Huron Valley Ambulance. Through HVA, we have certified approximately 15 EMTs through a dedicated course for U of M students. In addition, many EMS Club members have graduated from HVA's EMT program. We have also recently partnered with HVA to assist in a volunteer program in which non-certified members can assist EMTs at local U of M events and ride along in an ambulance to spark further interest in becoming a first responder. 

During the academic year, the club hosts monthly mass meetings where members get together to announce updates, collaborate on projects, and learn various prehospital skills. In these meetings, members can learn about research and further career opportunities. Many members now work on the M-RISE project, which aims to improve neurological outcomes following cardiac arrest, and the Toyota Drone Study, which seeks ways to improve the accessibility of EMS supplies in the field via the use of a drone. MEMSC also aims to increase career interest in meetings by bringing in a variety of guest speakers. Over the past 2 years, MEMSC has been pleased to host guest speakers with many agencies and individuals including: Ann Arbor Fire Department, HVA Dispatch, HVA Public Relations, HVA MICU paramedics, the Washtenaw/Livingston Medical Control Authority, Washtenaw County Hazmat, and multiple medical students completing residency in emergency medicine. Guest Speakers give presentations, offer advice, and bring in interactive medical equipment to spark greater interest in emergency medicine/EMS. Through the various opportunities we provide at MEMSC, we hope to build and foster interest in the prehospital field of medicine.
Summary: The Michigan EMS Club is an organization that provides an educational and informative experience for those interested and/or curious about a career in the medical or prehospital field through volunteerism, speaker events, research, and education classes.

Name: Michigan Engineering Consulting Group
Description: MECG is a pro-bono consulting group for engineering majors at the University of Michigan. Through education sessions, client projects, speaker events, social events, and trips, engineering majors will be a part of a fun work environment while provided with hands-on projects and learning opportunities to expose members to what a consulting career could look like.
Summary: MECG is a student-led pro-bono consulting group for engineering majors at the University of Michigan. At MECG we strive to make an impact on our members and the community around us through weekly meetings, consulting projects, speaker events, and more.

Name: Michigan Engineering Zone
Description: Located in the heart of Midtown Detroit, the Michigan Engineering Zone is a place for middle and high school students of Southeast Michigan to learn, grow, and lead. As part of the University of Michigan College of Engineering, the MEZ strives to provide world-class STEM resources, instruction, and counseling to students who very well may be the next generation of Victors. Would you like to work with engaged high school students while helping them to network, and experience STEM learning through robotics? Become a MEZ Mentor! All MEZ mentors receive either a stipend or class credit for participating. Come inspire future scholars!
Summary: Located in the heart of Midtown Detroit, the Michigan Engineering Zone is a place for middle and high school students of Southeast Michigan to learn, grow, and lead.

Name: Michigan Equity Research Club
Description: Michigan Equity Research Club, also known as MERC, is a highly selective undergraduate student organization at the University of Michigan focused on building the technical and behavioral competence of our members to succeed in the world of finance. Membership entails the mandatory attendance of bi-weekly meetings for new members (analysts). Throughout these analyst meetings, new members will learn the essential knowledge to succeed in finance such as accounting basics and steps of equity valuations. In the second weekly meeting, all members of the club build upon what was taught in the analyst session and go in depth into accounding and valuation techniques. After one semester in the club, analysts are promoted to associates or can apply for a role on the executive board.  MERC offers a comprehensive opportunity for any student interested in equity research positions in the world of finance.
Summary: Michigan Equity Research Club (MERC) is an undergraduate org at the University of Michigan focused on building the technical and behavioral competence of our members through a proprietary financial educational program and real-world work opportunities.

Name: Michigan Ethical Investments
Description:
This organization works to give students fundamental investing knowledge and experience using a portfolio comprised of capital from small annual membership dues and fundraising events while giving a percentage of the portfolio at the end of the year to charity. The rest of the portfolio is rolled over for the next year. Meetings will include investing strategy and presentations from members of different investment ideas.

Ethical Investments recruits at the start of the Fall and Winter semesters. Please follow our Instagram or email us at eicexecboard@umich.edu with any questions. For more information, visit eicumich.com.
Summary: The organization will give students investment knowledge with an emphasis on ethics. The organization will donate up to 20% of its proceeds to a charitable organization following each academic year and contribute to society by making good investments.

Name: Michigan Ethics Bowl
Description: The Michigan Ethics Bowl Team meets weekly to discuss various ethical issues in the public sphere. We spend much of Fall semester preparing for a regional intercollegiate ethics bowl competition, discussing cases (various ethical scenarios) assigned by the Association of Practical and Professeional Ethics. Through this, we aim to create an awareness for the place of ethics in everyday life and equip students with critical thinking and moral reasoning skills that are essential to their future academic and professional careers.
Summary: The Michigan Ethics Bowl Team aims to create a space for discourse on practical and applied ethics in the public sphere. We also compete every fall in the regional ethics bowl organized by the Association for Practical and Professional Ethics.

Name: Michigan Fabrication
Description: M-Fab is a community for students who like to make stuff. We provide access to machine tooling, space, and mentorship so you can bring your creative visions to life.
Summary: M-Fab is a community for students who like to make stuff. We provide access to machine tooling and space so you can bring your creative visions to life.

Name: Michigan Fashion Media Summit
Description:
The Michigan Fashion Media Summit is the premier platform for college students and industry professionals to collaborate and shape the future fabric of fashion.

The Michigan Fashion Media Summit is a day long event focused on fashion, retail and media at the Stephen M. Ross School of Business annually. Our summit is filled with industry defining keynote conversations from the top names in retail, exclusive networking opportunities with the world’s largest brands and a student brand showcase from elite up-and-coming talent. The Michigan Fashion Media Summit also hosts smaller events throughout the year the connect students to professional opportunities.
Summary: The Michigan Fashion Media Summit is the premier platform for college students and industry professionals to collaborate and shape the future fabric of fashion.

Name: Michigan Finance and Mathematics Society
Description: The Michigan Finance and Mathematics Society (MFAMS) is organized to support those who are pursuing a career that uses financial mathematics both professionally and academically. More specifically, MFAMS seeks to establish and maintain meaningful relationships with recruiters and companies to support members' professional goals, as well as providing members' insight into the industry to further interests. Moreover, the group will host information sessions, coffee chats, workshops, academic talks, and other events that align with the goals of the organization. Please feel free to contact us at mfams-board@umich.edu or direct yourself to our website https://mfams-umich.com. This is where you will find more updated and pertinent information regarding the club.
Summary: The Michigan Finance and Mathematics Society (MFAMS) is organized to support those who are pursuing a career that uses financial mathematics both professionally and academically.

Name: Michigan Fishing
Description: Michigan Fishing is dedicated to giving University of Michigan anglers the opportunity to come together and experience a variety of fishing and related outdoor adventures ranging from leisure to competition. Through the organization, members benefit from camaraderie, competition, and community.
Summary: Michigan Fishing was founded to provide The University of Michigan students with a club for anglers and a community for those who love fish.

Name: Michigan Fishkeeping
Description: DO YOU LIKE FISH? Then join our organization for fishkeepers and aquarists to get together and grow their art! Meeting activities include aquascaping contests, sharing fish facts, trips, and listening to presentations! You can join us by checking out our Linktree.
Summary: An organization for fishkeepers and aquarists to get together and grow their art!

Name: Michigan Football Analytics Society
Description: Founded in 2018, our club’s purpose is to spread and deepen the understanding and knowledge of football. We are specifically focused on using analytics to create novel research and write/publish articles to our website, thus enhancing football knowledge in the community as a whole. In addition to writing analytical pieces on football, we intend to spread the “fun” of football through casual articles, social events, and various creative endeavors. We have a passion for football and our club mission is to embrace that passion, through writing, research, and bonding to prepare those who are interested for a future career in football. If you have any questions about our club that are not answered by our Members Guide, please contact us at mfootballanalytics@gmail.com.
Summary: The Michigan Football Analytics Society is a group for passionate football fans interested in the analytical side of Football. We welcome all levels of football fans interested in both the collegiate and professional levels.

Name: Michigan Foreign Policy Council
Description: Our organization is composed of innovative and dedicated students who strive to promote foreign policy solutions through non-partisan research. Since its inception, MFPC's primary goals are to teach our members the empirical social science research process and to offer opportunities for professional development in the realm of diplomacy. Each semester, members produce written research papers on a variety of evolving issues in world politics today. Weekly club meetings are focused on developing writing skills, as well as discussing and productively debating relevant topics in international affairs. Each semester we work with real foreign policy think-tank mentors and professionals in the political space to provide guidance for our membership. At the end of each semester, our members present their findings at the Michigan Foreign Policy Symposium, where seasoned panelists speak on a particular topic as well, and members' pieces are published in the newest volume/issue of the Michigan Foreign Policy Review.
Summary: We are an undergraduate student organization that conducts research, discussion, and debate on foreign policy issues, including national security, trade and economy, climate and energy, global health, technology, and human rights.

Name: Michigan Games and Cards
Description:
Michigan Games and Cards is a casual club that meets to play board games, card games, bluffing games, and more at weekly game nights. We also host occasional events like murder mysteries and tournaments. We strive to be a welcoming, casual, and safe community for all University of Michigan students to play games.


When and where do you meet?

We meet for game nights every Tuesday and Friday on the third floor of Mason Hall starting at 6pm and going until whenever. We usually get 30+ people at game nights, and have gotten more than 100 at mass meetings. We also have occasional events during game nights or on weekends.

Sign up for the email list to get a weekly email with specific room numbers, events notifications, and links to join GroupMe and Discord:

https://forms.gle/vWCxxGR2C2Pz4Wc79


How do I join the club?

Show up to a meeting! There’s no formal membership or attendance policy, and all UofM students are welcome. You’re also free to invite non-students.

We use GroupMe (primary) and Discord (secondary) as club discussion and meme pages and for announcements. You’ll get a link to those from any of our emails when you've joined the email list. (and also room locations, event details, etc.)

https://forms.gle/vWCxxGR2C2Pz4Wc79 (a link so good we wrote it twice)

 

Who owns the games?

You do! The club owns very few games games; everyone brings games and forms groups. Just show up, grab a game and a group, and play! And if you don't know what to do, ask anyone who's there. We're a very welcoming club; so long as you're up to try something new, you'll be able to fit in.


So what kinds of games do you play?

All Kinds! Here’s a few:

•   Social Deduction - Secret Hitler, Blood on the Clocktower, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, The Resistance/Avalon, Werewords
•   Bluffing - Skull, Coup, B.S., Sheriff of Nottingham, Masquerade
•   Misc. Card Games - Shards of Infinity, Skull King, Whist, Love Letter, Uno, Mao, Tournament at Avalon, President
•   Cooperative - Hanabi, Spirit Island, The Mind, Pandemic, Spaceteam, The Crew
•   Team-based - Codenames, Euchre, Decrypto, Fog of Love
•   Dexterity - Jenga, Klask, Egyptian Rat Screw, Pit, Big Jenga, Fuse
•   Party Games - Monikers, Wavelength, We Didn’t Playtest This at All, Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza
•   Strategy/Other - Catan, Ticket to Ride, Crytpid, Isle of Skye, Splendor, Clank, Bohnanza, Wingspan


What do you not play?

We don’t consistently play trading card games like Magic or Yu-Gi-Oh, but it is not unheard of. You will likely find success if you try to get a group together in our main chat before game night. For a consistent Magic playgroup, checkout Magic: The Gathering Club.

We also do not play any casual video-gaming like Jackbox, MarioKart or Super Smash Bros, although again these aren’t off the table, they’re just not our focus. You’re more likely to find playgroups for these sorts of games games at the Casual Gaming Club.

We also also don’t play D&D, Pathfinder, or role-playing campaign games. If that is something you are into, we recommend you check out the Tabletop Gaming Club!

There are also dedicated clubs for chess and euchre, although we play both occasionally.


What’s your commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion?

We have a dedicated DEI Committee whose goal is to help ensure all members and attendees feel safe and welcome at the club, and that will monitor an anonymous form for attendees to bring up any issues or concerns. In general the club is committed to keeping our community free of discrimination, harrassment, and bullying of any kind, in any form.


It’s free right?

Mostly Yes! Showing up to weekly game nights and playing games is entirely free. We do ask that you pay a semester dues fee for certain events, usually anything where members bring food or use gas to drive somewhere, but also for participating in the biweekly tournaments. Dues are only $1-5 per semester, your choice. We also often accept bringing food or snacks for members as paying dues.


What types of events?

Most common is our once every three weekly tournaments, where we have small, optional, tournaments during regular game nights of different games with the winner earning pride and bragging rights. Other events we do during game nights include pot lucks, movie nights, de-stress days (coloring sheets & nail painting), and holiday events like gift exchanges or costume contests. We also do stuff outside normal game nights like murder mystery nights put together by our members, or trips to places like cider mills or ice-skating rinks.

The events committee is also very open, so you should speak up if you have any ideas or want to help run something!


Where do I ask other questions?

You should send an email to gamesboard@umich.edu if you have specific questions. It’ll reach everyone on the executive board.

You could also read our constitution; it's linked below. It details the club's purpose and commitments and also the executive board structure and election procedure.
Summary: A club for playing board games, card games, and bluffing games at weekly game nights, Michigan Games and Cards strives to create a welcoming, casual, and safe community at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Graduate Consulting Club
Description: Serve Michigan graduate students community (PhD, JD, MD and Masters students) who share the same passion about pursuing management consulting as their career path; create a community of future consultants and business leaders with advanced degrees and provide a platform for information exchange and experience sharing; develop partnerships and share resources with other consulting organizations and groups.
Summary: We serve the Michigan graduate student community who share the same passion for pursuing management consulting as their career path.

Name: Michigan Hackers
Description:
Michigan Hackers is the largest tech-oriented student organization on campus with 200+ active members and an outreach of 4000+ people.

We are a community where passionate students can build and grow relevant skills in a technological and fast-paced world. 

Our end goal is to provide high quality resources for any and all students to become more competent members of society (technically, socially, and professionally) with a computer science twist. While connecting students to projects, skills, faculty, companies, and more, we hope to make a large university feel smaller and forge lifelong bonds in an inclusive environment while also bridging passionate people together.

Our primary form of member engagement is through Thursday hack nights where members split into our different teams (such as Android, iOS, Security, Machine Learning, Open Source, Quant, etc) and work on semester long projects.

Join our slack or visit our website today! (bit.ly/slackmhackers and michhackers.com)
Summary: Michigan Hackers empowers students to solve problems through the innovative use of technology.

Name: Michigan Health Aid
Description: Michigan Health Aid is a multidisciplinary organization that has various projects and activities that are simultaneously occurring. We are dedicated to improving the health of local communities through preventative medicine, health education, and leadership development. We host free health screenings in Ann Arbor. We also have two health education programs, one for elementary school-aged children at an after-school program and another for high school students. Michigan Health Aid is an organization where every student can find their niche and contribute to making a positive difference in the community.
Summary: Michigan Health Aid is a student-driven coalition of the university and Ann Arbor community committed to the principle of “Help All, Serve All”. We are committed to improving the health and wellness of our community via medical care and health education.

Name: Michigan Health Law Organization
Description: The Michigan Health Law Organization explores current legal issues that relate to and intersect with our country's healthcare landscape and policies through events and programming.
Summary: The Michigan Health Law Organization explores current legal issues that relate to health through events and programming.

Name: Michigan Healthcare Business Club
Description: Michigan Healthcare Business Club is a club focused on intersecting fields of healthcare and business together. The way we do this is threefold: consulting, finance, and innovation. As a club, we work with healthcare organizations and clinics to provide consulting services for them.
