Additionally, we operate a fund to invest in biotech, pharma, med tech, and healthcare coverage companies. Lastly, we brainstorm and develop ideas that have the potential to be introduced into the healthcare industry.
Summary: The Michigan Healthcare Business Club is a student-led organization that focuses on exploring the intersection between healthcare and business. Our club provides opportunities for networking and engagement with the healthcare industry.

Name: Michigan Healthcare Executive Student Association
Description:
The primary purpose of MHESA is to advance the standards of education and professional development in healthcare management, through programs and activities designed to supplement the academic curriculum of the Department of Health Management and Policy.

A secondary purpose of the organization is to enhance students' experiences through the provision of extracurricular programs and events of the members' choosing, including social and charitable activities.

Consistent with the goals of the American College of Healthcare Executives (hereinafter referred to as ACHE), MHESA will afford its members the opportunity to enhance their leadership and managerial skills while broadening their network of professional contacts through active participation in the affairs of MHESA and ACHE. 

MHESA will provide a forum for exploring issues of importance to healthcare professionals and others interested in the improvement of the healthcare system.
Summary: The Michigan Healthcare Executives Student Association (MHESA) strives to cultivate skills and provide programming that will allow our members to be the Leaders and Best in their future endeavors.

Name: Michigan Hedge Fund Club
Description: The Michigan Hedge Fund Club is a student-led organization focused on exploring the dynamic world of hedge fund investing. Our mission is to provide members with hands-on experience in investment analysis, portfolio management, and alternative asset strategies, preparing them for careers in hedge funds and other areas of high finance. Through collaborative projects, educational workshops, and guest lectures from industry professionals, the club offers an immersive learning environment where students can develop technical skills, learn about hedge fund operations, and gain insights into various investment strategies, including long/short equity, macro, and event-driven approaches.
Summary: The Michigan Hedge Fund Club provides students hands-on experience in hedge fund like analysis, preparing them for finance careers through collaborative projects, workshops, and guest lectures on diverse hedge fund strategies

Name: Michigan Hillel
Description:
Michigan Hillel is unparalleled in terms of its size, diversity and quality of programming. Our Hillel supports 60 independent student groups, spanning the full breadth of Jewish life.  Each group provides opportunities for students to become involved as leaders, driving the programming and decision-making forward for their group and community.  Students build leadership, engagement, and community-organizing skills through our Hillel that benefit them in their roles on campus, in finding employment, and in life long after they graduate.

Each group also provides the opportunity for students to access a community that meets their individual needs. With 60 student groups, students can find opportunities to explore their identities and interests in a safe, supportive, fun and nurturing environment.  Our programming covers social, political, religious, cultural and educational areas, all intended to help students access Jewish life and community on their own terms. We offer concerts, lectures, films, classes, community service, yoga, religious services, discussion groups, dialogue, free Shabbat dinners, and a full kosher meal program. We also take more students to Israel on Taglit-Birthright Israel than any other Hillel in the country.

You can come to Hillel to hang out, catch a movie, eat delicious meals, study, hold a group meeting or do yoga. But Hillel is not just confined to our building.  You can experience Hillel in coffee shops, in residence halls, on the diag, in your own home, in Israel or in Detroit.  Drop in or contact us to learn more about how to get connected. Or come to us with a new idea we can help you grow for your community.  Hillel is what you make it.
Summary: Hillel is the center of Jewish life at the University of Michigan, supporting a vibrant and diverse community. Hillel is home to more than 60 student groups that create hundreds of ways to get involved in Jewish life on campus.

Name: Michigan Immigration and Labor Law Association
Description: The Michigan Immigration and Labor Law Association (MILLA) engages in community-based advocacy and organizing on labor and immigration issues. We collaborate with local stakeholders and legal advocates, organize pro bono and community service opportunities at the law school, and provide career support and mentoring for students interested in practicing immigration or labor law. We also host a variety of talks at the law school to discuss topical immigration and labor law issues.
Summary: The Michigan Immigration and Labor Law Association (MILLA) is a student organization at the University of Michigan Law School. We engage in advocacy, scholarship, and service projects on labor, immigration, and low-wage and immigrant worker issues.

Name: Michigan Innocence Club
Description:
The Michigan Innocence Club is a student-led organization dedicated to educating and engaging undergraduates in innocence work and the criminal justice system and fundraising for the Michigan Innocence Clinic's fund for exonerees. Founded on principles of accountability and justice, the Michigan Innocence Club serves as a platform for students passionate about law, criminal justice reform, and the protection of civil liberties. 

 

The club fosters a supportive, inclusive environment where students from diverse backgrounds and levels of understanding come together to learn and contribute their perspectives. By organizing speaker events, book clubs and movie screenings, and educational workshops, Michigan Innocence Club both raises awareness and empowers its member to become effective advocates for change within the legal system. The club also serves as a space for students interested in learning more about law and criminal justice to explore their interests.
Summary: The Michigan Innocence Club is a student-led organization dedicated to educating and engaging undergraduates in innocence work and the criminal justice system.

Name: Michigan Innovative Marketing
Description:
MIM is a major-inclusive club with a community of students passionate about the different facets of marketing. We provide students with marketing knowledge and skills in order to establish foundations for their future careers. We work as consultants for other clubs, local startups on campus, and businesses and hear from top marketing speakers, and engage in workshops to further our understanding of this growing industry. 

 

Take a look at our website: Link
Summary: MIM is a major-inclusive club with a community of students passionate about the different facets of marketing. We provide students with marketing knowledge and skills in order to establish foundations for their future careers.

Name: Michigan Interactive Investments
Description:
Founded in 1998, Michigan Interactive Investments (MII) is a highly selective, leading undergraduate investment club at the Stephen M. Ross School of Business. Each year, MII builds an investment portfolio with the goal of educating members about investing through interactive portfolio management. By maintaining a small, dedicated member base of approximately 60 undergraduate students, MII is able to effectively teach members about investing in a variety of equity, fixed income, and derivative securities. MII is unique in that we manage a $25,000 student-run portfolio. We have complete freedom over our investment strategies and asset classes, which include long/short equity, fixed income, and currencies.

MII utilizes a multifaceted investment strategy involving both fundamental and quantitative analysis to invest in equities, options, and fixed income instruments. We take a disciplined approach to investing, focused on a medium-term outlook for attractive returns while preserving capital. Furthermore, we primarily use a bottom-up approach to source investment ideas, while also implementing top-down and quantitative screening strategies to identify opportunities that will outperform our S&P 500 index benchmark. Additionally, we supplement this fundamental approach to investment selection with technical analysis to identify appropriate entry and exit points for our positions.

MII also provides many resources to help members secure internship and full-time job placements, and hosts the Undergraduate Investment Conference (UIC) each fall. The UIC invites participants from over 20 of the top universities in the country for a featured stock pitch competition. The winner is awarded an approximately $3,000 grand prize, and the Conference includes a keynote speaker and the opportunity for students and corporate partners to meet and network.

We pride ourselves on MII’s three core pillars: Education, Investing, and Professional Development.

Education

An important goal of MII is to educate members about investing and strengthen their knowledge of financial markets. This goal is comprised of three parts: First, new members have the opportunity to attend “Breakfast Club” sessions to learn the basics of investing, including how to source investments, value firms, and use financial data tools. Second, senior members make presentations during club meetings on more advanced topics, such as distressed debt investing, options valuation, and monetary policy. Third, every meeting features a market update that provides members with a better understanding of current economic conditions.

Investing

MII builds a student run portfolio through a process in which members evaluate market sectors and pitch their best investment ideas. After the pitch, members vote on whether the security should be added to MII’s portfolio. Profits are reinvested into the club, either towards growing the size of the portfolio or funding special events throughout the year.

Professional Development

Our members are high performing. Graduating seniors have gone off into a variety of firms on both the sell side and buy side. The following list omits many firms, but on the sell side, members have gone on to work for Deutsche Bank, Evercore, Guggenheim Partners, Goldman Sachs, M. Klein & Copmany, Moelis & Company, Morgan Stanley, PJT Partners, The Raine Group, Royal Bank of Canada, and Rothschild Global Financial Advisory. On the buy side, members have worked for Ares, Apollo, Bridgewater, Insight Venture Partners, KKR, and Prudential Capital. As such, members can expect an extensive network that can open many doors during recruiting season.
Summary: Founded in 1998, Michigan Interactive Investments (MII) is a highly selective, leading undergraduate investment club at the Stephen M. Ross School of Business.

Name: Michigan Intercollegiate Polo Club
Description: The Michigan Intercollegiate Polo Club is a non-profit University of Michigan student run organization open to all students to experience the exciting sport of polo. The club currently has 20 members and 10 lovable ponies. Riding experience is not necessary; our members teach both riding and polo. Practice is held five days a week and is very flexible; members choose which days to attend based on their schedule. ​With the new USPA-sponsored Regional Preliminary Tournament that began in 2012, the Women's Varsity competes primarily with schools in the Southeast region including Michigan State, University of Kentucky, University of Louisville, and University of Wisconsin.
Summary: The Michigan Intercollegiate Polo Club is a student organization that teaches and promotes the sport of Polo to students at the University of Michigan. The Club owns 11 horses and competes with other college polo clubs throughout the United States.

Name: Michigan Interfaith in Action
Description: We are the first and only student-led organization at The University of Michigan dedicated to fostering interfaith knowledge, awareness, and appreciation.
Summary: We are the first and only student-led organization at The University of Michigan dedicated to fostering interfaith knowledge, awareness, and appreciation

Name: Michigan International Consulting Club
Description: Designed for students studying abroad, MICC provides a platform to refine consulting skills, gain valuable insights into international markets, and prepare for professional success. Members engage in activities such as industry comparisons, market trend analysis, and collaborative case-solving, all while building expertise in research, public speaking, and problem-solving. With a focus on global exposure, MICC helps members understand the nuances of international industries, compare them to U.S. markets, and prepare for competitive consulting careers. By fostering a culture of skill development, professional growth, and networking, MICC equips its members with the tools to excel in internships, case interviews, and future consulting roles.
Summary: MICC helps students studying abroad refine consulting skills through analyzing global markets. Members create industry comparisons and market trends, in order to improve job skills such as research, public speaking, slide creation, and data summarization

Name: Michigan International Law Moot Court Association
Description: Michigan International Law Moot Court Association is a group of law students who participate in various international law moot court competitions. The focus is on developing knowledge and skills that will empower students at competition. As competitors, the team members research international legal problems, draft briefs, and participate in oral arguments. Tryouts for related competitions are held annually.
Summary: Michigan International Law Moot Court Association is a group of law students who participate in various international law moot court competitions. The focus is on developing knowledge and skills that will empower students at competition.

Name: Michigan International Student Anthropology Association
Description: The primary goal of this group will be to provide an inclusive and welcoming community for all our international students by representing international student needs and concerns to the Department and relevant University administration.
Summary: The Michigan International Student Anthropology Association (MISAA) is an organization solely dedicated to current and incoming international students in the Department of Anthropology at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan International Student Ministry
Description:
Michigan International Student Ministry is a Christian club focused on helping international students adjust to life in the US. Our hope is to not only help students learn about Christianity and the Bible, but to really be a "Home Away From Home" for our students.

Throughout the year we do a lot of different things including English conversation groups, mentorship, outings to unique locations in the Midwest, eat REALLY good food together, build new friendships with people from different background and study the Bible. We know that many people may not have had a chance to learn about Christianity so we like to approach it with a lot of explanation and opportunities to ask a lot of questions.

So come check us out!
Summary: Michigan International Student Ministry is a Christian club that is a "Home Away From Home" for our students from all around the world. Our activities include: English Conversation Groups, Outings, Learning About the Bible, & Service Opportunities.

Name: Michigan International Students Society
Description:
The Michigan International Students Society is a student-lead group at the University of Michigan seeking: 

  1. To celebrate the different cultures and traditions of the world amongst its members.
  2. To build a well-connected international society at the University of Michigan.
  3. To represent the collective interests of the international students at the University of  Michigan.
  4. To promote international awareness through the Society’s events and activities.
  5. To support international students in their transition  into life and education at the University of Michigan.
  6. To build lasting relationships and connections for a global experience.
Summary: Michigan International Students Society is Michigan's first international organization aiming to improve life of internationals on campus and spread awareness of the global community at University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Investment Banking Club
Description:
The Michigan Investment Banking Club's mission is to assist members in obtaining internships and full-time positions in the investment banking through its unique programs and industry partnerships. 

The rigorous education program is the backbone of the club and provides members with the theoretical knowledge investment banks seek in incoming analysts. The career services program exposes members to industry professionals and hosts development workshops. High-performing individuals are selected and placed onto teams that work directly with a Wall Street-based boutique investment bank.

Please visit us at http://www.themibc.org/ to learn more
Summary: The Michigan Investment Banking Club is the premier undergraduate student organization at the University of Michigan. Our goal is to prepare our members for securing and succeeding in competitive internships and full-time analyst positions.

Name: Michigan Investment Group
Description: Michigan Investment Group is Michigan’s first investment group focused on the intersection of Finance & Technology. MIG has two groups: a fundamental investing team that analyzes and pitches equities across a diverse range of sectors, and an algorithmic trading team that develops software to buy and sell stocks in real-time using hundreds of thousands of data points. MIG members jointly manage an equity fund, while also leading education and networking sessions with the top finance and technology firms.
Summary: Michigan Investment Group is Michigan’s only investment group focused on the intersection of Finance & Technology. We help members develop financial and technicals skills and provide job recruiting resources.

Name: Michigan Israel Public Affairs Committee
Description: The Michigan Israel Public Affairs Committee is a collection of politically minded and pro-Israel students who seek to strengthen the U.S.-Israel relationship through political means. MIPAC will, several times over the course of the year, lobby elected officials from the legislative branch on pro-Israel policy. Additionally, during election cycles, MIPAC members will each commit to campaigning and advocating for pro Israel members of congress.
Summary: The Michigan Israel Public Affairs Committee is an organization dedicated to maintaining and strengthening the U.S. Israel relationship. We do this through policy and politics.

Name: Michigan Izzat
Description: Michigan Izzat is the co-ed Bollywood Fusion dance team at the University of Michigan! Izzat seeks to combine U-M talent to put on creative and expressive performances on stage.
Summary: Michigan Izzat is the co-ed Bollywood Fusion dance team at the University of Michigan! Izzat seeks to combine U-M talent to put on creative and expressive performances on stage.

Name: Michigan Jet Engine Team
Description: MJET is a student design team at the University of Michigan. Our goal is to design, build and test various forms of aerospace propulsion and propulsion related components. We aim to provide members with practical, hands-on experience related to aerospace propulsion. The team aims to cultivate a culture of innovation wherein every team member feels integral, fostering an environment where all ideas are valued regardless of perceived feasibility. Fear of failure is actively dismantled to encourage bold thinking and experimentation. We do not require any sort of prior experience, and all majors are welcome and encouraged to join.
Summary: MJET's goal is to design, build, and test and a working supersonic afterburning turbojet engine capable of running on sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs).

Name: Michigan Journal of Arts and Science
Description: Michigan Journal of Arts and Science aims to promote the discussion in literature and science. It promotes student innovation and academic discourse through digital and physical publications. With our publications, we aim to provide students with experience in delivering their interpretations and ideas in a journalistic setting.
Summary: Michigan Journal of Arts and Science aims to promote the discussion in literature and science. It promotes student innovation and academic discourse through digital and physical publications.

Name: Michigan Journal of Asian Studies
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Asian Studies (MJAS) was founded in 2011 for the purpose of offering undergraduate and graduate students the opportunity to publish their research or analytical papers relevant to the field of Asian studies in a peer-reviewed journal.

In addition to providing students an opportunity for academic publication, MJAS wishes to mentor students interested in Asian studies through the establishment of a forum for academic discourse on campus. MJAS is committed to contributing to the larger community of scholarship through our open-access website. MJAS accepts submissions from around the globe in the social sciences and humanities concerning Asian studies. Where opportunities exist, other journals confine their dialogues so narrowly as to include only one region, which consequently limits discussions that transcend regional boundaries. MJAS supports a broader scope of Asian culture, which consequently allows MJAS to accept more submissions and publish more frequently. Furthermore, it is the intention of MJAS to deepen appreciation and encourage interest into the rich and diverse cultures found in greater Asia, which is facilitated by affording students the venues in which to participate in the discussion.

Besides appealing to those students who wish to publish, MJAS is useful for students at large in the field because MJAS archives its publications online, free to the public. With respect to MJAS’s component on campus, MJAS wishes to manifest its presence through hosting various meetings: recruitment for both editors and would-be authors; mini-presentations from students preparing research projects; and appearances by professors to lecture or discuss their current research in the field of Asian studies.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Asian Studies (MJAS) was founded for the purpose of offering undergraduate and graduate students the opportunity to publish their research or analytical papers relevant to the field of Asian Studies.

Name: Michigan Journal of Economics
Description: The Michigan Journal of Economics evaluates current economic events and markets to provide well written and succinct analyses. Writers can cover any topic ranging from stock market analyses and buyer preferences to public policy recommendations. Articles are published bi-weekly by students interested in economics, business, journalism, or public policy. Articles can be read on our website https://sites.lsa.umich.edu/mje/
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Economics evaluates current economic events and markets to provide well written and succinct analyses and research. Writers cover any topic ranging from stock market analyses and buyer preferences to public policy recommendations.

Name: Michigan Journal of Environmental and Administrative Law
Description: The Michigan Journal of Environmental & Administrative Law (MJEAL) is a law school journal that publishes articles about environmental and administrative law issues. Law students may apply to join as a Junior Editor in the Fall of their 1L year and/or as an Associate Editor in their 2L year through write-on in April/May.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Environmental & Administrative Law (MJEAL) is a law school journal that publishes articles about environmental and administrative law issues.

Name: Michigan Journal of Gender and Law
Description: The central mission of the Michigan Journal of Gender & Law is to create a feminist legal publication that will help expand and develop legal discourse beyond traditional boundaries. The Journal, which was founded in 1992, is dedicated to providing a forum for exploring how gender issues (and related issues of race, class, sexual orientation, gender identity, and culture) impact law and society. The Journal seeks to compare, contrast, and combine theoretical and practical perspectives on gender issues in order to provide a bridge between theory and practice. To achieve these purposes, the Journal publishes the views of legal scholars, social scientists, practitioners, students and others. The Journal is committed to representing a broad range of perspectives, however unconventional or unpopular they may be. We welcome the submissions and responses of our readers.
Summary: Michigan Journal of Gender & Law.

Name: Michigan Journal of International Affairs
Description:
The Michigan Journal of International Affairs was created to fill the need for a forum in which undergraduate students can express their opinions on international relations in a manner in which unversed readers can better comprehend world systems and situations. Its articles are in the style of Foreign Affairs or the Economist, rather than the style of more obtuse publications catering to people in the upper levels of the academic field. The Journal strives to create a dialogue about serious issues in international affairs, one which is not based on rhetoric or bellicose grandstanding. Greater goals include the formulation of ideas that future leaders can draw on to lead to superior foreign policy.

In addition to publication, the Journal hosts social and academic events addressing current topics in world affairs, often with special guests that work in relevant career fields.

For students interested in applying to write for the journal, please visit mjia.org/apply to get more information and access our application!
Summary: The Michigan Journal of International Affairs is a student-run, written, and edited publication. We publish op-ed pieces about geopolitics, culture, economics and more in an edition released at the end of each semester.

Name: Michigan Journal of International Law
Description:
The Michigan Journal of International Law (MJIL) is the student-run international publication at the Law School. MJIL presents cutting-edge articles from scholars and practitioners in international law, as well as research notes written by the student editors.

In verifying and editing authors' work, and researching their own pieces, student members of MJIL draw on the Law School's world-renowned faculty, curriculum, and library in international legal studies. The interactive learning process involved in editing sophisticated scholarship in international law can be a rewarding complement to class work at Michigan. Editorial board positions can further this experience as senior students work closely with leading authors in the field, and simultaneously gain valuable leadership experience.

First published as the Michigan Yearbook of International Legal Studies, MJIL has evolved into one of the most highly-regarded quarterly journals in international law. Recent issues have featured pieces by many of the leading international legal scholars in the United States and abroad. MJIL additionally publishes Book Reviews that provide a different forum for critical review and commentary.

The editorial board selects new associate editors from the first-year class each year on the basis of writing ability, international interest and experience, and diversity of perspectives. Student editors gain substantial writing and editing experience. Working on MJIL provides opportunities to work with foreign law and languages and interact with authors from around the world. Associate editors also participate in the many social events sponsored by the Journal, including staff dinners, lunches with international law professors, and social gatherings with LL.M. students.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of International Law (MJIL) is the student-run international publication at the Law School. MJIL presents cutting-edge articles from scholars and practitioners in international law as well as notes written by student editors.

Name: Michigan Journal of Law & Society
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Law & Society (MJLS) is the nation’s first law-school journal to focus on the intersections of law, history, and the social sciences. MJLS is also the nation’s first law-school journal to incorporate law students, PhD students, and a faculty editorial board into its review and editorial processes. 

MJLS’ central goal is to imbue legal and legal-adjacent scholarship with the tools of the social sciences and humanities to enrich our understanding of the law and the lawmaking process. 

MJLS combines the best elements of peer-reviewed journals and student-run journals to speed up the process by which cutting-edge scholarship can enter scholarly debates and inform the public consciousness. 

MJLS publishes scholarly articles, comments, essays, and online blog posts. MJLS is soliciting content for our fourth issue. If you are interested in learning more or submitting a piece, please contact mjls.execs@umich.edu
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Law & Society (MJLS) is the nation’s first law-school journal to focus on the intersections of law, history, and the social sciences and to incorporate law students, PhD students, and a faculty editorial board.

Name: Michigan Journal of Medicine
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Medicine (MJM) is a peer-reviewed, student-led organization designed to highlight the professional student body at the University of Michigan and publish high-quality biomedical, translational, and clinical research to the scientific community at large. This journal is focused on helping future physician-scientists develop a leadership portfolio within the publishing community and become familiar with the review process. Submissions are solicited from members of several graduate programs including, but not limited to, students within the school of medicine, dentistry, nursing, public policy, and social work. All submissions are required to have one health professions student as a co-author.

Every step of the review process is addressed by a current student at the University of Michigan Medical School. Once an article is submitted to the MJM, it is given to a team of three to four reviewers and an editor. Reviewers independently assess the manuscript within a given deadline and come together with their editor to discuss the necessary changes that need to be made prior to publication. The executive editor and editor-in-chief review the manuscript and make a final decision on publication.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Medicine (MJM) is a student-run, peer-reviewed journal that welcomes submissions from graduate students in health sciences programs at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Journal of Political Science
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Political Science is a journal, established in 1981 with the goal of discussing current issues and topics in the field of Political Science through highlighting undergraduate work, in a non-partisan and academic fashion. Through both staff writers and submissions, we hope to collect the best work by undergraduates and publish it.

For more information, contact our Co-Editors-In-Chief at mjps-eics@umich.edu, or visit our website: https://mjps.polisci.lsa.umich.edu/
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Political Science is a journal, established in 1981 with the goal of discussing current issues and topics in the field of Political Science through highlighting undergraduate work, in a non-partisan and academic fashion.

Name: Michigan Journal of Public Affairs
Description:
The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is dedicated to publishing innovative public policy-related articles drawn from a wide range of policy professionals, academic, and graduate students.

MJPA is the student-run journal of the Gerald R. Ford School of Public Policy at the University of Michigan. The journal was founded by Ford School graduate students in 2003. Membership on MJPA's editorial board is open to current Ford School graduate students and the journal is supervised by the faculty of the Ford School.

Articles for MJPA are solicited from graduate and professional students from all over the United States and internationally, as well as policy practitioners and academics. MJPA welcomes submissions focused on topical issues relevant to public policy in the United States and throughout the world. Submissions are related to numerous policy areas such as economics, social policy, public administration, international development, political science, and the law. The articles are evaluated in light of their relevance as a contribution to an important policy debate and originality, as well as writing quality and style.

A formal call for articles with submission criteria is issued each fall with a deadline for submissions in late December. The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is then published online the following spring.

Any questions about MJPA can be directed to fsppmjpa@umich.edu.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Public Affairs is dedicated to publishing innovative public policy-related articles drawn from a wide range of policy professionals, academic, and graduate students.

Name: Michigan Journal of Race & Law
Description: The Michigan Journal of Race & Law is a legal journal that serves as a forum for the exploration of issues relating to race and law. To that end, MJR&L publishes articles, notes, and essays on the cutting edge of civil rights scholarship from a wide variety of scholarly perspectives. MJR&L’s diversity is reflected by the authors with whom we collaborate, ranging from scholars and students to practitioners and social scientists. In addition to having been recognized as one of the leading civil rights journals in the country, MJR&L has also been consistently ranked among the top 25 specialty journals overall.
Summary: The Michigan Journal of Race & Law is a University of Michigan Law School academic journal dedicated to civil rights scholarship and exploring issues related to race and law.

Name: Michigan Jump Rope
Description: Michigan Jump Rope is a club for beginners and experienced participants in the sport of jump rope to learn new skills, exercise, and make friends!
Summary: Michigan Jump Rope is a club for beginners and experienced participants in the sport of jump rope to learn new skills, exercise, and make friends!

Name: Michigan Kendama Club
Description: Through weekly meetings each semester, MKC gathers around Ann Arbor to play kendama. Both competitive and casual kendama playing is welcome, all experience levels are welcome!
Summary: Student Organization intended to provide students with a community to bond through playing kendama.

Name: Michigan Knitting
Description:
Where: Michigan Union; Room switches each week. Please see email that goes out every week for room. 

When: 6-8pm every Wednesday

What: We teach students how to knit and/or crochet. All projects made with club supplies are donated to those in need. During weekly meetings, students knit, crochet, and converse for two hours. Meetings are not mandatory. The club provides all knitting/crocheting supplies (yarn, needles, crochet hooks, etc). To take a project home, a deposit of $5 for yarn and $5 for the needles/crochet hook ($10 total) is required. The money is returned after the completion of the project. This way, students who want to learn to knit/crochet can without needing to invest money in supplies. We accept students of all skill levels, from I-have-never-picked-up-yarn-before beginners to I-am-on-my-fifteenth-sweater experts. Although most projects are for charity donations, the club also welcomes folks who want to work on their own personal projects in a group setting.

Why: Create goods to warm the local community and learn/expand crafty skills

If you would like to set up a time to sign out materials, or if you want to donate items you have knit or crocheted (or items like food products or toiletries) to homeless shelters without joining Mknit, or for any other questions/comments/concerns, please feel free to contact Jillian Dore at jdore@umich.edu
Summary: We teach students how to knit/crochet scarves and donate them to homeless shelters and other places of need within the area.

Name: Michigan Korean Business Society
Description: Michigan Korean Business Society is Michigan's premier business organization dedicated to fostering a global network of Korean professionals. Our mission is to provide professional development opportunities for ambitious Korean talents. We are committed to building an interactive and lasting community where members support each other's professional success and contribute to the global acknowledgment of Korean business prowess. Through our initiatives, we aim to raise awareness of the Korean business environment, culture, and talents on an international scale.
Summary: Michigan Korean Business Society is Michigan's premier business organization dedicated to fostering a global network of Korean professionals. Our mission is to provide professional development opportunities for ambitious Korean talents.

Name: Michigan Law & Political Economy
Description: Michigan Law and Political Economy at the University of Michigan Law School is dedicated to engaging with and advancing the study of Law and Political Economy, a legal movement that aims to transform legal scholarship and pedagogy by centering issues of economic power, racial and gender subordination, and meaningful democratic inclusion. To that end, this student group creates opportunities for the law school community to think collectively about how to develop new policy solutions, intellectual approaches, and political strategies adequate to the crises of our time.
Summary: Michigan Law and Political Economy at the University of Michigan Law School is dedicated to transforming legal scholarship and pedagogy by centering issues of economic power, racial and gender subordination, and meaningful democratic inclusion.

Name: Michigan Law Basketball Team
Description: The goal of the Michigan Law Basketball Team is to help provide the opportunity for University of Michigan Law Students to compete in organized and semi organized basketball competitions. This will be a group where law students of all skill levels can come to play organized basketball against peers and other members of the Michigan community.
Summary: The goal of the Michigan Law Basketball Team is to help provide the opportunity for University of Michigan Law Students to compete in organized and semi-organized basketball competitions.

Name: Michigan Law Ski & Snowboard Club
Description: The Michigan Law Ski & Snowboard Club is a student run organization at the University of Michigan Law School to bring folks together in their shared love of snow sports. We aim to build friendships, plan group trips, discuss and swap gear, and help people interested in skiing and snowboarding take their first step to hitting the slopes.
Summary: Michigan Law student club for all those interested in snowsports! Open to all skill levels. We facilitate group trips and help connect folks to others on and off the slopes.

Name: Michigan Law Veterans Society
Description: The University of Michigan Law School Veterans Society (MILVETS) is a community of veterans and those interested in supporting veterans or serving in the Armed Forces. The Veterans Society's purpose is to connect and supports its members and contribute a unique perspective to the law school community.
Summary: The University of Michigan Law School Veterans Society (MILVETS) is a community of veterans, family of veterans, and those interested in supporting veterans or serving in the Armed Forces.

Name: Michigan Magic
Description:
A space for fellow cardists and magicians to work on their tricks and cardistry. Discuss sleights and illusions, new cardistry moves, and have fun! We perform together at events around campus, which is always fun. All skill levels welcome.

For the latest updates on our weekly meetings, logistics and events, please join our discord channel: https://discord.gg/hMpAWs3pG2.

For Fall 2024, our weekly meetings will take place on Mondays, 6-7:30PM at Palmer Commons, 6th floor, Boardroom 2.
Summary:
A space for fellow cardists and magicians to jam and learn cardistry/magic! All skill levels welcome.

For event booking, please contact MichiganMagicMembers-requests@umich.edu.

Name: Michigan Malaysian Students Association
Description:
Michigan Malaysian Students Association (MiMSA) brings Malaysians together and is proud to have a close-knit community in Ann Arbor. We strive to promote Malaysian culture to the rest of the campus community and anyone who is interested in learning more about Malaysia. Other Malaysians living near the campus area are welcomed to join MiMSA.

For more info check out our website at https://umich-mimsa.com/
Summary: Michigan Malaysian Students Association at the University of Michigan (MiMSA) is a student organization for Malaysians studying at the University of Michigan. One of our goals is to provide a home away from home for our members.

Name: Michigan Marine Energy
Description: MME’s purpose is to educate students regarding the opportunities, innovations, and potential of the marine energy industry and to contribute to the advancement of the industry through innovative applications. The team’s mission is to ultimately create a competitive submission for the Marine Energy Collegiate Competition sponsored by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) by creating an innovative business plan, technical design, and scaled prototype for marine energy harnessing.
Summary: A design team focused on educating students and the community on the current state of marine energy technologies and opportunities within the industry while creating a competitive submission for NREL's Marine Energy Collegiate Competition.

Name: Michigan Marketing Club
Description:
NOTE: THIS IS A CLUB FOR MBA STUDENTS. 

Philosophy:

To further the Ross School of Business’s reputation as an outstanding marketing school and to develop MBA students’ skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in marketing.

Goals:

To further develop students’ understanding of the marketing function and its different career opportunities.

To encourage corporations to recruit and hire Ross School of Business graduates for marketing careers.

To make the Michigan Marketing Club a conduit for successful communication among students, the faculty and administration, Ross alumni and recruiting companies.

To provide a social framework in which students interested in marketing can interact and share common experiences.

To provide an opportunity for students to exhibit their leadership skills.

Planned Activities:

Marketing Symposium

Corporate presentations, mock interviews, and workshops

Field trips to various corporations

Recruiting events

Social events

MBA2 connections

Case competitions

Weekly student newsletters
Summary:
NOTE: THIS IS A CLUB FOR MBAs.

The Michigan Marketing Club exists to further the Ross School of Business’s reputation as an outstanding marketing school and to develop MBA students’ skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in marketing.

Name: Michigan Mars Rover Team
Description: MRover is a student-run, multidisciplinary team whose mission is to cultivate an inclusive environment for students to pursue and develop an interest in robotics for space exploration. Students gain and apply engineering and teamwork skills by designing, building, and testing a rover to compete and place in the Rover Challenge Series. Additionally, we use our platform to inspire a love for space and promote STEM education for K-12 students through various outreach events.
Summary: The Michigan Mars Rover Team (MRover) is a student-run, multidisciplinary organization whose mission is to design, build, and test a rover for the exploration of Mars-like environments and to assist astronauts on a mission to Mars.

Name: Michigan Masala
Description:
We are excited to introduce a new non-competitive Bollywood dance organization at the University of Michigan, aimed at providing an inclusive and diverse space for students to explore and celebrate Indian culture through dance. Our group welcomes members of all backgrounds and dance experiences to join us in learning choreography to popular Bollywood songs while fostering a sense of community and cultural appreciation on campus. We hope to create memorable performances that showcase the vibrant and dynamic energy of Bollywood dance while spreading joy and happiness within our University community. We will begin late in F23 / beginning of W24!

Please DM us on Instagram at @michiganmasalaa to get involved!
Summary: We are a noncompetitive Indian dance group dedicated to preserving and promoting the beauty of Indian culture through performance. Fostering community, artistic expression, and personal growth, we unite passionate individuals through dance.

Name: Michigan Materials Society
Description:
The Michigan Materials Society (MMS) serves as the student society for those studying Materials Science and Engineering. MMS operates as the umbrella society for many of the professional societies in the field of materials science. This organization is also known as the “University of Michigan Materials Advantage Student Chapter of the American Ceramic Society (ACerS), ASM International, the Association for Iron and Steel Technology (AIST), and The Minerals, Metals & Materials Society (TMS)".

In order to accomplish our mission, MMS offers students opportunities to network with professionals and compete in contests and scholarships in various places like professional societies. MMS also holds a close knit relationship with the university's MSE department in order to unite the student body. Many events, such as our luncheon seminars and student/faculty mixers, are held throughout the year to foster the development of students.
Summary: Michigan Materials Society (MMS) is a student organization for Materials Science and Engineering undergraduates. We provide professional, social, and academic opportunities to our students and seek to better their overall experience at Michigan.

Name: Michigan Math Meet
Description:
Michigan Math Meet organizes an annual on-campus mathematics tournament for high school students from Michigan and the Midwest. Our goal is to help students prepare for major mathematics competitions, improve their problem solving skills, and cultivate a love of mathematics. In addition, we aim to provide outreach opportunities for undergraduate students to pursue their passion for mathematics outside the classroom through writing problems, designing activities, and working with high school students. Past competition experience is preferred, but anyone knowledgeable and enthusiastic about mathematics is welcome to join!

Fill out this form to join our email list: forms.gle/zwqxsCq7Qux1XHVX7
Summary: Michigan Math Meet is an undergraduate-run annual math competition for local high school students.

Name: Michigan Med-Law
Description: Michigan Med-Law focuses on progressive issues that arise at the intersection of medicine and law. These topics are reviewed in depth (medical malpractice, health policy, etc.). Furthermore, networking opportunities, speaker panels, volunteering opportunities, and professional development related to law, medicine, and the intersection of the two fields will be provided to all active members. Social events for the members are a fun way to engage with your peers who have similar interests!
Summary: Michigan Med-Law is focused on the delving into the intersection between medicine and legal frameworks.

Name: Michigan Medicine First in Family
Summary: The Michigan Medicine First in Family Student Organization provides first-generation and low-income (FGLI) medical students with the academic, professional, financial, and community resources necessary to succeed during medical school.

Name: Michigan Medicine Football Club
Description: The Michigan Medicine Football Club (MMFC) unites Michigan Medicine fellows interested in playing soccer competitively and for fun. It organizes competitions between the other professional schools and organizes practices and pick-up soccer.
Summary: MMFC brings together individuals from Michigan Medicine to play the beautiful sport of soccer

Name: Michigan Men
Description:
What is Michigan Men?

Michigan Men programming focuses on socialization around gender, specifically masculinity, and its impacts on individuals, relationships, and communities. Our programming, facilitated by our peer facilitator student organization members, equips participants with skill sets promoting wellness, healthy relationships, and values-driven communities. We envision an inclusive and empathetic campus community where all members can be their authentic selves, develop individualized wellness plans, acquire toolkits for interpersonal violence prevention, and cultivate healthy relationships. Michigan Men is a SAPAC Program that collaborates with various departments across campus.

Michigan Men Peer Facilitators

Michigan Men Peer Facilitators co-facilitate dialogues, organize events and support participants of other Michigan Men programs in gaining new skills and strategy tools. Members meet for 90-minute weekly meetings for ongoing education, programming preparation, and action planning.

 

Michigan Men Workshops

Our 90-minute dialogue workshops orient participants to conversations around masculinity and social dynamics. They are not designed for 1:1 sessions nor to be a part of any sanctioned or required referral process. Participants can request a workshop for their organization or sign up individually and be placed in a pool of other individuals interested in a similar workshop. If you intend to request a workshop for your organization, please do so at least three weeks before the potential workshop date. Our workshops are as follows:

 

Michigan Man-Box Workshop: The Michigan Man-Box is focused on orienting participants to conversations around masculinity. It provides fundamental tools that assist in having conversations around masculinity, healthy relationships, and personal well-being.

Masculinity and Well-Being Workshop: The Masculinity and Well-Being workshop focuses on identifying personalized healthy ways of navigating stress, promoting holistic well-being, and embracing an authentic and positive narrative of masculinity or personal identity. We challenge participants to think critically and discuss ways in which they may incorporate well-being in their personal lives and within their communities.

Masculinity and Wellness-Focused Relationships: The Masculinity and Wellness-Focused Relationships workshop focuses on building healthy relationships, identifying elements of unhealthy relationships, and promoting positive and supportive connection in all forms of relationships.

Power, Privilege, Oppression, and Hegemonic Masculinity: The Power, Privilege, Oppression, and Hegemonic Masculinity workshop is an introductory dialogue about navigating systems of oppression, promoting social justice and liberation, and identifying hegemonic masculine narratives or norms within our shared experiences and communities.

 

Eligibility: Michigan Men's programming explores societal expectations around masculinity and their effects on individuals, relationships, and communities. All currently enrolled University of Michigan students, including those who do not identify as masculine, are welcome to participate and be peer facilitators.
Summary: Michigan Men introduces individuals to engaging dialogue and activities regarding masculinity. Our peer facilitators support participants' skills development in wellness, healthy relationships, harm prevention, & cultivating values-driven communities.

Name: Michigan Men's & Women's Club Wrestling
Description:
The Michigan Club Wrestling team was founded 13 years ago to create an opportunity for students of all skill levels to wrestle for fun at practices or competitively in the NCWA league. When not wrestling, we organize charity, fundraising, and social events. The organization is student-run and provides great leadership opportunities.

Check out our website for more info:

https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/michiganclubwrestling/
Summary:
The Michigan Men's & Women's Club Wrestling team provides an opportunity for non-varsity athletes to practice and compete at a collegiate level of wrestling. Check out our Website for info:

https://sites.google.com/umich.edu/michiganclubwrestling

Name: Michigan Men's Volleyball
Description:
The University of Michigan Men's Club Volleyball team competes in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association (MIVA) and in the Big Ten Conference. We build a fun and competitive atmosphere for those who love the game of volleyball.

 

Please fill out this form to receive information regarding open gyms & tryouts for the 2023-2024 season! We look forward to meeting you soon. 

 

Go Blue!
Summary: The University of Michigan Men's Club Volleyball team competes in the Midwestern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association (MIVA) and in the Big Ten Conference. We build a fun and competitive atmosphere for those who love the game of volleyball.

Name: Michigan Mental Health Initiative
Description: MMHI works to reach out to various communities in a local setting as well as outside of the immediate community to work on improving the impact of mental health programs at various schools. The organization and its members will provide assistance to increase awareness and participation in mental health programs at various education levels in these communities. The organization will also volunteer to help improve and institute mental health programs under the guidance of officials within the schools, faculty advisors, and medical professionals to further their impact. The goal is to foster new engagement initiatives with students in order to improve mental well-being.
Summary: We aim to utilize collaborative efforts with mental health programs in various communities to enrich their students’ lives and make meaningful progress toward broadening the impact of existing and new mental health programs.

Name: Michigan Mentors
Description: We offer free career preparation courses for high school students in order to remove the financial barrier associated with entering competitive fields such as medicine or computer science.
Summary: We offer free career preparation courses for high school students in order to remove the financial barrier associated with entering competitive fields such as medicine or computer science.

Name: Michigan Millionaires Trading Club
Description: To encourage, empower, and enrich Students at the University of Michigan to seek and attain financial freedom, generational wealth, and self-fulfillment by providing a risk-free environment to be introduced to the world of investing and various financial markets by learning the high income and recession proof skill of trading.
Summary: We teach Students at the University of Michigan how to trade the financial markets and become professionally minded traders and consistently profitable traders. For free. No application. No interview. Come one. Come all.

Name: Michigan Mobile Modular Assistant
Summary: A team tasked to develop a personal assistant modular drone.

Name: Michigan Motor Club
Description: The Michigan Motor Club is a group of car enthusiasts that all love to talk and learn about cars. We will have trips to visit the Detroit Auto Show and other motoring icons that are centered in the great state of Michigan. We will also have meetings to discuss the cars that are spiking our interests and any other news that is worth discussing. We are open to other activities our members might be interested in as well!
Summary: A community that revolves around everything cars. From the latest and greatest hypercars all the way back to the start of motoring. We will discuss our viewpoints and also take advantage of Detroit's rich motoring history.

Name: Michigan Motorcycle Club
Description:
MMC is established to provide a community for riders with diverse backgrounds, giving them access to information about rider safety, awareness, and maintenance, while providing the opportunity for riders to simply share their enjoyment of motorcycling with each other.  

Through campus involvement, our mission is to create meaningful experiences, a vibrant community, and lifelong memories for University of Michigan students. In this process, the members will become more skilled, knowledgeable, and safer motorcyclists.

And yes-- many of us do ride through the Michigan winters!
Summary: This club is meant to promote riding in the Ann Arbor and University of Michigan community. It is a place where fellow students and alumni can come together to meet and ride in a social environment.

Name: Michigan Movement
Description:
Our mission: MIM believes every individual, regardless of race, gender, socioeconomic status, or personal beliefs, deserves the same quality of life. Rooted in sustainability, innovation, and collaboration, students provide aid to individuals and families experiencing homelessness and poverty in the local community. 

MIM believes in three P’s to making progress: 

  1. Provision of basic daily necessities
  2. Promotion of individual autonomy through education, health and wellness
  3. Passion for community engagement and social advocacy.

We are the only student organization at U of M whose main goal is to provide aid to those experiencing homelessness or poverty in our local community. 

Although there are other service organizations on campus, there are none that primarily focus on empowering the homeless population by directly working with them. 

MIM listens to those experiencing homelessness and works together with the community to effectively discover innovative ways to help. We cater programs and services that target specific needs of this population through actively listening and recognizing every individual's fundamental needs.
Summary: An Ann Arbor-based grass roots organization that believes everyone deserves a fair and just opportunity to maximize their health, and ultimately their quality of life.

Name: Michigan Muscle Club
Description:
For those interested in joining Winter 2025: follow our Instagram @michiganmuscleclub and be on the lookout for our Mass Meeting. Please reach out to our Instagram or the contact below with any questions. Additionally, join our GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/102433024/vCL4qU5D

The Michigan Muscle Club (MMC) is the fastest-growing UofM fitness organization dedicated to fostering community among students who share fitness/building muscle as an interest. We welcome all levels of experience, genders, orientations, ethnicities, etc.

MMC provides students with opportunities to connect with both experienced gym-goers and those who are looking to get started. We regularly host social events (ex: tailgate, speed dating, field day) for you to come out, meet people, and have FUN. We also value information. We host "workshops" where you can come interact with other members while discussing/learning more about our selected topic for that event (ex: Basics, Splits, Nutrition, Bodybuilding, Calisthenics, etc.). So, whether you are a seasoned gym-goer or never stepped foot in a gym, we promise you will get something out of our workshops! We regularly invite fitness celebrities to host seminars as well.

Aside from events, MMC has internal programs for the invested members. We run a Big/Little program for Littles looking to connect and learn from a Big with similar fitness goals and more experience. We also host fitness CHALLENGES throughout the year. Our most popular one is the 7 AM challenge, where morning birds can get in teams and see which team can clock in the most workouts.

Join our community by coming out to our Mass Meeting and keeping up with our Instagram!
Summary: Michigan Muscle Club (MMC) is a student-run organization composed of beginners and avid gym-goers alike! Our focus is to bring together students interested in fitness and provide the latest information for you to make your best GAINS!

Name: Michigan Music Business Club
Description:
The Michigan Music Business Club is a club at the University of Michigan that strives to give our members an exclusive, educational experience through hands on speaking events, social events, and internship recruitment events.

The Ross community believes in change starting at the root of powerful ideas. Our club strives to enable our members to explore their creative abilities in the music industry while gaining inspiration from the personal conversations they have with industry leaders throughout each school year.

At the Ross School of Business, we believe that change requires purpose-driven leaders. Given the fact that the music industry is one of the most rapidly accelerating industries in the world, the current generation of college students in just a few years will be the new leaders of the business world, in all fields.

At the Michigan Music Business Club, we strive to create the next generation of executives, tastemakers, and power-players in the Music Industry.
Summary: A revolutionary organization striving to create the next generation of executives, tastemakers, and power-players in the music industry. MMBC features a speaker series, celebrity events, field trips, music industry education, and much more.

Name: Michigan Muslim Pre-Health
Description: Michigan Muslim Pre-Health is a student-run organization to help Muslim and other pre-health students at the University of Michigan. We hope to create a community of pre-health students through leadership panels, mentorship, and shared resources. Any student is welcome to join our organization. We hope to help students on their pre-health journeys and create an inclusive and learning-rich environment within our club. We will have a variety of different events and will make sure that we are tending to the needs of our members.
Summary: Michigan Muslim Pre-Health is a student-run organization to help Muslim and other pre-health students at the University of Michigan. We hope to create a community of pre-health students through leadership panels, mentorship, and shared resources.

Name: Michigan Neuroprosthetics
Description:
Michigan Neuroprosthetics is a student organization that designs cost affordable, accessible, and scalable muscle-controlled prostheses for children, while simultaneously offering students an opportunity to learn through real world project experience. We focus primarily on working with families to build devices customized to their needs, with a secondary aim of increasing global accessibility.

Check out some of what we have created!
Summary:
Michigan Neuroprosthetics is a student organization that utilizes 3D design and fabrication to design and build pediatric prostheses. 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvLzKrklzJanMN5GXKT65bOAarrSz2ukT

Name: Michigan Open UX
Description:
Michigan Open UX is the first student organization dedicated to providing students with opportunities to learn and practice UX.

 

Our Fellowship Program is a weekly in-person educational seminar series that covers the fundamentals of UX (design, research, professional development) through interactive lessons designed to bring you up to speed on your UX knowledge. 

 

Our Associate Program is a semester-long project-based initiative designed to give students the chance to work on real-world UX-related projects. Students can either apply to work on a Personal Project team and address a specific design/research challenge or apply to work on a Client Project team that works for business or an organization.
Summary: Michigan Open UX is the first student organization dedicated to user experience (UX) education and practice. Attend weekly seminars on design, research, and professional development or gain practical experience through real-world project work.

Name: Michigan Orthopaedic Surgery Interest Society
Description: The mission and purpose of the Michigan Orthopaedic Surgery Interest Society is to provide members with educational, volunteer, and networking opportunities that may allow them to learn more about the field of orthopedics while engaging with other members who share a similar interest. It is our goal to provide members with vital experiences. This includes hearing from people in all stages of medicine such as medical students and their medical school application process and attending physicians in orthopedics speaking about their journey, giving back to the community in ways that coincide with orthopedics, and providing the means for members to learn more about what clinical research entails. Through these involvements, we hope our members will be able to create, cultivate, and develop a potential interest in the field of orthopedic surgery.
Summary: The Michigan Orthopaedic Surgery Interest Society sets out to develop an interest in orthopedics by hosting physician speaker panels, providing volunteer and philanthropic opportunities, and offering research exposure.

Name: Michigan Parity Project
Description:
Michigan Parity Project is a chapter of People’s Parity Project, a national advocacy organization.

As law students, we believe it’s our responsibility to demystify and dismantle coercive legal tools that allow corporations to get away with violating workers’ rights, ripping off consumers, and shielding themselves from accountability. We do this work through legislative advocacy, administrative advocacy, targeted campaigns against companies, and public education.

We also run a student zine titled Radical Commons, which publishes articles and art with progressive perspectives on the law online and in print throughout the year. Check it out at www.radicalcommons.com
Summary: Future lawyers fighting for fairness.

Name: Michigan Parkour
Description:
Anyone and everyone is welcome! No prior experience is required. We hold regular practices Tuesday, Thursdays at 5pm and Sundays at 4pm starting at the rails outside of Couzens on Palmer Field. After warming up, we pick a spot around campus and work on various challenges and/or techniques. Our practices are self-directed and involve a relaxed, motivational community atmosphere. We also regularly hold social events and carpool to local parkour gyms and trampoline parks. 

To learn more about the club, feel free to join the GroupMe or reach out to one of the leaders of the organization at mipk.execs@umich.edu!

 

[ 𝔾𝕣𝕠𝕦𝕡𝕄𝕖 ]  for discussing real time updates, gym trips, and when people move to new spots
Summary: Michigan Parkour is a club dedicated to training the discipline of parkour and freerunning. We strive to provide a community where practitioners can learn and train together all while having a ton of fun!

Name: Michigan Parole Preparation Project
Description: Parole Preparation Project, in collaboration with Humanity for Prisoners, will work with incarcerated folk who are eligible for parole to prepare them for their hearings and develop thorough plans for when they are released.
Summary: Parole Preparation Project, in collaboration with Humanity for Prisoners, works with incarcerated folk who are eligible for parole to prepare them for their hearings and develop thorough plans for when they are released.

Name: Michigan Performance Outreach Workshop
Description:
Through biannual workshops on the University of Michigan Campus led by UM students, MPOW aims to helps the youth of Southeast Michigan foster a life-long relationship with the performing arts. MPOW's constantly evolving, educational field trips work to promote creative expression, build self-esteem, and introduce elementary school kids to a wide variety of performing arts disciplines they may come to fall in love with.

At MPOW, we believe in the importance of presenting kids with the opportunity to discover their own artistic expression from a young age through interaction and collaboration with various performing arts disciplines and college-aged artists! An organization run primarily by students studying liberal and fine arts, we work to share our passion and introduce the performing arts as a means of self expression, and maybe even a future career path. Together, through creative experiences and expression, we can use our arts education to positively impacting our surrounding communities and ultimately strengthen the performing arts community on our own campus.
Summary: The Michigan Performance Outreach Workshop strives to share the educational power of the performing arts in order to inspire the youth of the Southeast Michigan community to pursue their own unique and life-long relationships with the arts.

Name: Michigan Philosophy Club
Description: Michigan Philosophy Club is a space for students to explore ideas, engage in discussions, and build a community around shared intellectual curiosity. We host meetings with free food, faculty talks and more. Whether you're a philosophy major or just curious about life's big questions, the club welcomes everyone eager to think deeply and connect.
Summary: Michigan Philosophy Club is a space for students to explore ideas, engage in discussions, and build a community around curiosity. We host meetings with free food, faculty talks and more. Open to all eager to think deeply and connect!

Name: Michigan Photography Club
Description:
Michigan Photography Club’s mission is to build a creative and diverse community of photographers; offering networking, social, and development opportunities. MPC offers gallery exhibitions, trainings, alumni talks, contests, and networking/social events. We also can connect students or organizations with our photographers for personalized photography needs from large events to small group portraitures to graduation photos. 

 

We welcome photographers of all levels and backgrounds.

 

To join and be added to our emailing list, please email the club head. For more information or to hire one of our photographers for an event, please email us at michiganphotographyclub@umich.edu.
Summary: Michigan Photography Club’s mission is to build a creative and diverse community of photographers; offering networking, social, and development opportunities.

Name: Michigan Pickleball Club
Description: The Michigan Pickleball Club aims to provide a safe, inclusive space for players of all skill levels to come together and enjoy the sport of pickleball, improve our skills, and encourage the unfamiliar to give the amazing sport a try.
Summary: The Michigan Pickleball Club aims to provide a safe, inclusive space for players of all skill levels to come together and enjoy the sport of pickleball, improve our skills, and encourage the unfamiliar to give the amazing sport a try.

Name: Michigan Poetry Club
Description:
Michigan Poetry Club is very excited to launch in fall 2024. This club is super chill, fun, and relaxing and will provide you with a space and community of people who love poetry.  There are three aspects to this club that we are hoping to include:

 

Meetings

We will meet 4 times a semester.  During meetings, we will have the opportunity to share poetry, learn about poetry, and practice writing poetry. There will be snacks and music. This is a time to relax and decompress through the use of poetry.

Our first meeting is 11/3/2024 at 2pm in Mason Hall, room 3411

 

Events

We will host one event per semester where we can raise funds (if wanted). Read more about our ideas on our website!

 

Community Outreach

We also organize poetry readings and workshops in local Ann Arbor elementary schools. Our goal is to promote the art of poetry and inspire the next generation of poets.  An elementary Open Mic day is one of our potential ideas.  

 

Overall, we want to have a club where we can enjoy poetry together. Our website and insta is linked below with more information! We hope to see you at our next meeting!
Summary: Welcome to the Michigan Poetry Club! We meet up for poetry writing, sharing, and outreach. Our mission is to provide a supportive and fun environment for poets of all levels to express themselves and grow their craft.

Name: Michigan Poker Club
Description:
Michigan Poker Club provides students the opportunity to learn, enjoy and play poker. There will be social and networking opportunities through playing poker that will teach students theories that will help in many professions. The Michigan Poker Club will be a club strictly focused on recreational play. Therefore, the club will never interfere with any Michigan gambling laws.

Please contact dubler@umich.edu in regards to the club. A link to the club Groupme and Discord will be sent out after approval.
Summary: Michigan Poker Club provides students the opportunity to learn, enjoy and play poker.  There will be social and networking opportunities through playing poker that will teach students theories that will help in many professions.

Name: Michigan Pole Dance Society
Description: We are a student-run club that practices the art of pole dancing. Pole dancing is an alternative form of fitness where we focus on improving your strength and core. You’ll learn how to do handstands, inversions, spins, splits and tricks with our club as well as boost your self-confidence within our warm and welcoming group. All skill levels are welcome, but you must be 18 or older to attend the bi-weekly classes.
Summary: We are an inclusive pole-fitness student organization and are working towards de-stigmatizing the art of pole.

Name: Michigan Political Consulting
Description: By offering a youthful, student perspective, and a strong understanding of campaign strategy and public relations, we aim to offer bold solutions to our client's problems. At the University of Michigan, we foster student growth by providing our members with opportunities to gain real, professional skills in the world of politics. Through this relationship between organization and client, we seek to offer hands-on experience for our members.
Summary: Michigan Political Consulting is a student-run political consulting group at U of M, dedicated to bringing pro-bono political analysis and strategic consulting to campaigns, activist organizations, and non-profits.

Name: Michigan Pops Orchestra/UAC
Description: Pops brings classical music to life with performances featuring current amazing pieces of music: Star Wars, Harry Potter, Superman, etc, are all past features that engage students on campus with the sounds of their favorite films. With plenty of opportunities for both performance and leadership, Pops remains a unique music group at the University of Michigan.
Summary: Michigan Pops is the only student-run, student-directed symphony orchestra on campus. We perform a major concert each fall and winter semester. Our small ensembles also perform several small concerts each semester.

Name: Michigan Pre-Law Society
Description:
Not sure if the law is the path for you? Well, the Michigan Pre-Law Society strives to promote a deeper understanding of law to interested undergraduate students! Meetings are bi-weekly and consist of LSAT info sessions, collaborations with the UofM Law School, student panels, speaker events, socials, and more. Applications open at the beginning of both the fall and winter semesters. 

 

Please follow our Instagram @mprelawsociety and feel free to reach out with any questions!
Summary: The Michigan Pre-Law Society strives to promote a greater understanding of the field of law to all interested undergraduate students.

Name: Michigan Product Management Club
Description: MProduct is a community that believes strongly in the value of product management. We run workshops, speaker events, and panels throughout the school year to help students gain product sense and understand how to develop a product. We also offer 1:1 help with recruitment and personal projects for our members. Learn more at mproduct-umich.org.
Summary: MProduct is a community that believes in the value of product management. We run workshops, speaker panels, recruitment events, and help students build products on their own. Visit mproduct-umich.org for more information.

Name: Michigan Public Health Brigades
Description: The Michigan Public Health Brigades is an organization that aims to tackle water, disease, and pollution issues through projects and education. We will be offering seminars on Global Health and Public Health, as well as volunteering opportunities throughout the semester. Our duties will include fundraising for a week-long service trip to Panama, Honduras, Guatemala, or Ghana.
Summary: The Michigan Public Health Brigades is an organization that aims to tackle water, disease, and pollution issues through projects and education. Our duties will include fundraising for a week-long service trip to Panama, Honduras, Guatemala, or Ghana.

Name: Michigan Puzzle Club
Description:
Who are we? Michigan Puzzle Club is a brand new club that started in the Fall 2023. We aim to create a casual and inclusive space for those interested in doing jigsaw puzzles, whether you’ve done them for years or it’s your first time. 

What do we do? Puzzle puzzles puzzles! The size of puzzles we do ranges from 500-2000 pieces. Puzzle mats are available so work can be saved in between meetings, and do not worry, puzzles, snacks, and music are provided. Feel free to bring your own puzzle if you would like to work on that too! Unfortunately, we don't do other kinds of puzzles like logic puzzles, crosswords, etc. 

When/where do we meet? We host meetings once a week in Mason Hall typically on the weekends. Meetings last around 2 hours, but members are welcome to come and go as they please during the time frame.

In addition to our typical meetings, we have collaborated with other organizations like SWE or Michigan Games and Cards to host puzzling events. We also hosted our first ever Puzzle Competition in Winter 2024!
Summary: Michigan Puzzle Club aims to create a casual and inclusive space for those interested in doing jigsaw puzzles, whether you’ve done them for years or it’s your first time.

Name: Michigan Reach
Description: Reach is a growing national organization focused on building content creation and digital marketing community at universities. The University of Michigan chapter will regularly bring in industry speakers and provide members with unique, hands-on learning experiences. At Reach, you can expect much more than professional guidance - we also aim to build community among like-minded students through social events, workshops, and more.
