All students with an interest in digital media or fields that intersect with social media marketing are encouraged to apply (even if they lack experience in the specified fields).
Summary: A great club for any students interested in entertainment or social media marketing! Reach provides networking, professional development, and social opportunities to any students in this field and regularly brings in interesting, high profile speakers.

Name: Michigan Real Estate Club
Description:
The Michigan Real Estate Club (MREC) is one of the most diverse clubs at the Ross School of Business with undergraduate and graduate student members pursuing degrees in architecture, business, law, engineering, natural resources and environment, sports management and urban planning. Our mission is to promote educational, networking and career development opportunities within the entire spectrum of the real estate industry for our members at Ross and undergraduates and graduates across the University of Michigan. No prior experience or knowledge is required! 

If you would like to join the club, please visit our website and select your preferred membership option. You will then be added to our email list. 

Please also feel free to reach out to any board members if you have any questions about the club!
Summary: Please visit our website www.michreclub.com for the latest information on the Club, as we do not routinely update our Maize Pages account. Thank you!

Name: Michigan Recreational Tennis Club
Description:
IMPORTANT: To join the organization and receive email updates, please contact rectennis@umich.edu. 

 
Welcome! We are an organization that allows players of all levels to play tennis and have fun. We welcome ALL players, although most of the players that stick around and enjoy it the most are those that have at least high school, USTA, or any competitive tennis experience. Practice is entirely up to members (sets, drop and hit games, etc.).
 
Please note, however, that this is NOT a good place to learn how to play tennis for the first time.
 
Here's how it works:
Rec Tennis meets three times per week, however we are also a zero commitment club meaning you attend as many or as few days as you would like.
 
For Fall 2025, our session schedule is as follows:
 
Tuesday 10:00PM-12:00AM
Thursday 10:00PM-12:00AM
Sunday 6:00PM-8:00PM
 
Price: $80 (for the semester) + $50 VTC membership (annually)
 
-Rec Tennis meets at the Varsity Tennis Center, a facility that requires a one-time $50 membership fee that covers the entire year. Non-members can pay a $10 guest fee.
 
Here is a link to the VTC website, which provides more membership information:
http://www.tennis.umich.edu/index.php/membership/
 
Additionally, organization dues are $80. This covers court rental and balls. Prospective members may try their first Rec Tennis session for free, however the VTC does charge a guest fee ($10) for non-members.
 
We also allow dues to be payed at $10 per session if you do not want to commit to a whole semester.
 
These dues can be paid via our online platform, SuperSaas, whose details of which are pinned in our GroupMe chat, as well in a link as at the bottom of this page.
 
Since Rec Tennis does not try to make a profit, every member's dues is important. Because of this, we will only refund your money within two weeks of payment. We strongly encourage you to try the free trial session if you are unsure about joining. Low attendance will not be considered grounds for a refund, only exceptional situations may be evaluated by the EBoard.
 
If these dues create a financial burden, please contact us. We are determined to work out a suitable payment plan if necessary. Our priority is for everyone to have the chance to play and enjoy themselves.
 
Carpooling
We pick up members 15-30 minutes before the scheduled meeting time in front of South Quad on E. Madison St., Mojo on Observatory St., East Quad on East U Ave., North Quad on E Washington St., and North Campus at the NCRB.
 
If you have a car and can make this intersection a part of your route to VTC, please do so and pick up as many members as possible. Drivers coordinate pickups in our club group chat. If you can consistently provide rides to other members, dues will be reduced to as low as $30/semester. 
 
Rides our coordinated on our online platform, details of which are pinned in our GroupMe chat.
 
 
Please contact us with any questions or concerns. Go Blue!
 
 
Lauren Aragones - Co-President
Hudson Haberland- Co-President
Jordan Fu- Vice President
Claire Eberle- Communications Director
Ethan Grey- Treasurer of Funding
Matthew Nguyen- Treasurer of Dues
Tanisha Aggarwal- Social Chair
Summary: Michigan Rec Tennis is a community of tennis players who meet tri-weekly at the Varsity Tennis Center. We have no tryouts or mandatory practices and pride ourselves in welcoming anyone who has a passion and love for the game of tennis.

Name: Michigan Refugee Assistance Program
Description: The Michigan Refugee Assistance Program was founded with the idea that UM students who are passionate about helping refugees could do so right in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The Michigan Refugee Assistance program works closely local refugee resettlement agencies, including Jewish Family Services (JFS), Samaritas, and Washtenaw Refugee Welcome to coordinate student volunteers. In addition, MRAP uses its various platforms to advocate for and raise awareness about the largest displacement crisis our generation is currently witnessing. The goal of MRAP is to connect passionate students with local resettled refugees to not only provide assistance in areas where it is needed most, but also to facilitate cross-cultural understanding between current UM students and refugees.
Summary: MRAP is dedicated to assisting refugees, asylum seekers, and the forcibly displaced in Ann Arbor and around the world. Working directly with local resettlement agencies near the University, MRAP aims to empower this population.

Name: Michigan Rifle Team
Description: The Michigan Rifle Team welcomes all interested students to attend tryouts, regardless of their prior shooting experience. The team will teach students techniques that will help them improve their marksmanship. Our primary goal is to develop our members' shooting skills, have fun, and make long lasting friends! We compete in several competitions against other universities including Purdue, Michigan State, Akron, Clemson, University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh, Grand Valley State, and more.
Summary: The Michigan Rifle Team is a friendly and supportive group of students who compete in Olympic-style collegiate target shooting in both smallbore and air rifle. All students are encouraged to tryout regardless of prior experience!

Name: Michigan Robotic Submarine
Description:
Michigan Robotic Submarine (Michigan RoboSub) is an engineering student team that competes annually in the international Robosub competition in California. We design a fully autonomous robotic submarine with capabilities that include sonar mapping, object retrieval, torpedo targeting, and others. Throughout the year we work on designing, implementing, and testing new technologies for use on our submarine in competition. 

 

Link to Join

 

RoboSub welcomes Wolverines from all backgrounds, experience levels, majors, and class-standings to join our team in advancing autonomous underwater vehicle (AUV) technology. Our team is composed of the three following subteams:

  • The mechanical subteam designs, manufactures, and builds our submarine.
  • The software subteam develops algorithms to perform perception, planning, and control for our fully autonomous submarine.
  • The business subteam deals with our corporate sponsors, manages team finances, organizes events, and handles our public image.

If you are passionate about developing technology of the future, there is a place for you on our software, mechanical, and business sub-teams!

Meet the Team!

For more information about our team check out our website!
Summary: Michigan RoboSub is a premier engineering team working together to design, build, and test an autonomous submarine for international competition in California. We are the only student team which works with underwater autonomous robotics on UM's campus!

Name: Michigan Sahana
Description:
Michigan Sahānā is a group of Indian classical artists who attend the University of Michigan and was initially formed as ICMD (Indian Classical Music & Dance) during the Winter semester of 2003. Focusing on both performance and appreciation of the traditional art forms of India, we seek to foster the community of students interested in India’s rich tradition of music and dance. This includes putting on unique concerts to showcase the vast talent of the group and organizing educational events to spread awareness. Michigan Sahānā’s performances feature a diverse set of artists, including both Hindustani and Carnatic musicians, and performers of many different styles of Indian classical dance.

Our mission is create a thriving and active Indian classical community at the University of Michigan, through which we hope to fulfill three goals. First, we seek to increase general awareness of the Indian classical arts both on and off campus. Second, we seek to cultivate talent amongst all members. Third, we seek to produce quality performances that equally showcase the various styles of Indian classical music and dance.
Summary: Michigan Sahānā seeks to foster a thriving and active Indian classical music and dance community at UofM that increases general awareness of the Indian arts, cultivates talent within the community, and produces quality performances.

Name: Michigan Sales & Trading
Description:
Our Goals 

  1. To provide a pathway and resources for Michigan students interested in sales & trading
  2. To strengthen the ability of Michigan Students to explore the vast world of finance through weekly education sessions and updates on current market events. 
  3. To build a strong and supportive community of motivated individuals who aid in the growth and advancement of this organization and one another.
Summary: Michigan Sales & Trading Aims to provide an avenue of education and mentorship for students interested in  finance career paths with a keen focus in the world of Sales & Trading.

Name: Michigan Sales Club
Description:
• Connected through the Sales and Business Development Certificate, formerly the Ross Cappo Sales Educational Track
  • Provide educational opportunities in order to increase the personal and professional development of student's interest in Sales and Marketing career paths
  • Establish and create an extensive network focused on active relations between alumni and current members
  • Extend awareness of sales principles and educational opportunities to the students of the University of Michigan
Summary: The Michigan Sales Club is affiliated with the Sales and Business Development Certificate and has developed a network within the University of Michigan for those interested in sales and marketing.

Name: Michigan Sand Volleyball Club
Description:
The Michigan Sand Volleyball Club is dedicated to providing university students the opportunity to play volleyball with fellow Wolverines, enhance physical fitness, make friends, and destress from the intense rigor that is Michigan Academics. 

We accept any students who express interest in playing volleyball. Our games occur weekly and usually last about 1-2 hours. The schedule will change depending on the weather, but all are welcome to use our group chat to coordinate meet-ups outside of regularly scheduled meetings or to make new friends!

Meeting locations will be determined on a week-to-week basis. Just click on "join club" to get more details and be added to the email list or join our Groupme:)
Summary: M-Sand has regular athletic events dedicated to playing volleyball in order to support physical well-being and camaraderie between fellow Wolverines.

Name: Michigan Saving Mothers
Summary: Michigan Saving Mothers is a student chapter of the global nonprofit Saving Mothers which is an alliance of healthcare professionals dedicated to eradicating preventable maternal deaths and birth-related complications among marginalized women.

Name: Michigan Science Writers
Description:
MiSciWriters provides structured training in writing and editing as well as providing platforms for practicing science communication. Writers have the opportunity to work with editors to cultivate a quality publication for a public audience. There are also opportunities for showcasing science illustrations.

Events hosted by MiSciWriters provide individualized guidance and feedback for communicating to diverse audiences. Various scientific communication events include career panels, live blogging opportunities, and talks with established science writers. MiSciWriters is also involved with outreach to the community by working with Michigan DNA Day, RELATE, and the Language Bank to translate our posts into Spanish.
Summary: MiSciWriters is a student organization dedicated to improving the written communication abilities of scientists, improving public understanding of science, and advocating for science communication as a field.

Name: Michigan Semiconductor Student Alliance
Description: MSSA serves to help tackle the incoming talent shortage in the semiconductor industry by bolstering student engagement and providing valuable opportunities for networking, skill development, and career advancement within the field. The ultimate goal is for every major university to form a chapter of Semiconductor Student Alliance to create a vast network nationwide.
Summary: The Michigan Semiconductor Alliance is a student-run RSO dedicated to promoting the semiconductor industry to students at the University of Michigan. We are moved to prevent the potential talent gap in the semiconductor industry.

Name: Michigan Short-Term Trading
Description: MSTT is established to provide members with a platform to learn, develop insights, compose strategies, and generate resources for maximizing profit potential in short-term financial markets.
Summary: MSTT is established to provide members with a platform to learn, develop insights, compose strategies, and generate resources for maximizing profit potential in short-term financial markets.

Name: Michigan Ski and Snowboard Club
Description:
We take two big trips a year, one over MLK weekend and one over Spring Break. For MLK weekend, we depart from Ann Arbor with 2 or 3 motor coaches (depending on trip size). Plenty of partying happens on the ride, which is usually one of the highlights of the trip. Once we arrive you have two full days of skiing before we depart back to Ann Arbor. 

The second trip we plan is during Spring Break. Past destinations have been Whistler Blackcomb, Winter Park, Heavenly, Park City and the French Alps. Join our email list to find out about this year's trip as details become available. 

In addition, we take a few day trips to local resorts throughout the season. More information will be provided both through our e-mail list and the facebook page.

Our club is free to join and skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels are welcome. Check us out on instagram and if you have any questions or want to be added to our mailing list, shoot us an e-mail at scofficers@umich.edu. Can't wait to hit the slopes with you!

Cheers,

   The Scofficers
Summary: Welcome to the Ski and Snowboard Club Maize Page! We organize two ski trips per year, one over MLK weekend and one over spring break. Our club is very fun & free to join! If you have any questions, please email us!

Name: Michigan Snowboard Club
Description:
Whether you ski, board, or have never tried either, there is no reason not to join the best club on campus. Every year the club grows bigger and better. With over 300 members, we remain the largest winter sports organization on campus. Dues are $25 annually and get you access to our rail jams, film premiers, dozens of local trips to resorts, and annual trips over Martin Luther King weekend and Spring Break. If you want to join, fill out the form on our website!

Nothing is better than getting out of Ann Arbor for a day or an afternoon on the slopes. We hope you choose to join the most stoked crew on campus! Here is the link for joining the club, ikon pass, and our Instagram!

Skiers and snowboarders of all skill levels are welcome!
Summary: Focused on getting skiers and snowboarders to the hills during the winter with a spring break trip out west, MLK trip to Canada, and local trips in Michigan. We also do social events so members can get to know each other.

Name: Michigan Social Data Group
Description: Michigan Social Data Group (MSDG) is an interdisciplinary student-led organization that focuses on the use of data-driven analyses to advance the study of various social scientific fields. Whether you're interested in studying the data behind voter turnout and polling models, how humans make rational/irrational economics decisions, or just curious about any aspect of the social sciences, we are here to further your understanding of how data science and computing can advance these fields. We are a NEW club on campus that is currently recruiting members (W25) that want to help start up our club and build this amazing initiative. Interest Form: https://forms.gle/dSyQNx23gK7WySVFA
Summary: Michigan Social Data Group (MSDG) is an interdisciplinary student-led organization that focuses on the use of data-driven analyses to advance the study of various social scientific fields.

Name: Michigan Society of Double Bassists
Summary: The mission of the Michigan Society of Double Bassists is to build community and engagement through the double bass.

Name: Michigan Songwriters Collective
Description: The Michigan Songwriters Collective platforms, supports, and educates student songwriters. Connect with the U-M music scene via our song shares, open mics, production workshops, and retreats. Whether you're a veteran or beginner, MISC can help you shine!
Summary: The Michigan Songwriters Collective platforms, supports, and educates student songwriters. Connect with the U-M music scene via our song shares, open mics, production workshops, and retreats. Whether you're a veteran or beginner, MISC can help you shine!

Name: Michigan Sport Business Conference
Description: The MSBC is an undergraduate student-run platform whose mission is to empower the next generation of sport industry leaders. Since our founding in 2012, the MSBC has strived to inspire creativity and innovation in the sport industry. We do this by connecting current and future sport business professionals and organizations, culminating in the largest undergraduate-run sport business conference in the country.
Summary: The MSBC is the premier undergraduate-run sport business conference in the United States, and its objective is to inspire creativity and innovation in the sport industry.

Name: Michigan Sport Business Inclusion Community
Description: A career in sport is a dream for many, but few fulfill this aspiration and thrive in the industry. Although the University of Michigan offers a premiere sport management program alongside an elite athletic department, it is no exception to the lack of racial diversity that stains sport business. Racial minority students seeking careers in sport business often find themselves marginalized, which places these students at a disadvantage when navigating their academic and professional careers. We, the members of the Michigan SBIC are committed to enhancing the experiences of students seeking a career in sports who identify as a racial minority through building community. Our community serves to empower the next generation of diverse leaders in sports. SBIC Promo Video
Summary: The Michigan Sport Business Inclusion Community serves as a space for historically underrepresented students pursuing a career in sports and entertainment to enhance their undergraduate experience.

Name: Michigan Sport Consulting Group
Description: Using the engaged sport business community at the University of Michigan, the Michigan Sport Consulting Group hopes to find motivated individuals interested in working with impactful sport entities. We expose students to authentic projects in sport business that help them foster relationships with industry professionals and direct their career path.
Summary: We personally and professionally develop students through real-world consulting engagements with companies across the sport business industry. Some of our previous clients include the NFL, Google, Miami Dolphins, SBJ, NASCAR, MLB, and Oak View Group.

Name: Michigan Sport Venture Group
Description: The Michigan Sport Venture Group (MSVG) is an undergraduate student organization dedicated to fostering entrepreneurship within the sports industry. MSVG is committed to cultivating a thriving community where start-ups, venture creation, and investment converge within the sports, media, & entertainment industries. Guided by faculty support and insights from the Sport Management program, MSVG offers a unique platform for students to delve into the realm of sports finance & entrepreneurship. MSVG emphasizes hands-on learning in key areas such as consumer research, investment, and product development. This approach empowers members to translate ideas into actionable plans, fostering the skills needed for successful entrepreneurial ventures and investment practices in the sports sector.
Summary: MSVG is dedicated to cultivating an emerging community for sports entrepreneurship and investment empowering students for success in sport finance and business development.

Name: Michigan Sports Analytics Society
Description:
Statistics and data analysis are the future of sports. More so than ever before, teams in every sport use data to make personnel decisions and devise winning strategies. Learn about how teams do this analysis, find peers for collaboration on research projects, talk to professionals within the field, and build your resume with skills attractive to franchises, agencies, and other sports organizations.

 

Applications for the WN 25 semester are now open! Apply by January 24th to join us this semester through this link.

 

Primary Contact: Owen Yoo, Ben Weber

Leadership Board: Ben Weber, Owen Yoo, Eliana Detata, Bryce Carson, Jack Padron, Max Winnick, Rohan Patel, Zac Spivak, Maya Harb
Summary: The Michigan Sports Analytics Society exists to provide a platform for interested students to collaborate, gain experience, and publish high-level work in the field of sports analytics.

Name: Michigan Sports Law Group
Description: MSLG is an undergraduate student organization dedicated to creating a community where students can explore the dynamic intersection of sports and law. By focusing on key topics like NIL policies, athlete representation, labor law, and intellectual property, MSLG offers opportunities for professional development, engaging workshops, and insights from industry experts. Guided by incredible faculty support and the resources of the School of Kinesiology, MSLG provides a platform for students to connect, learn, and grow as future leaders in the sports law field. Whether you’re interested in pursuing a career in sports law, want to explore how legal issues impact the sports industry, or are simply curious to learn more, MSLG offers a fantastic opportunity to get involved. Note: MSLG is a distinct organization from Michigan Sports Law Society (SLS).
Summary: The Michigan Sports Law Group (MSLG) explores sports and law, offering workshops, networking, and insights on NIL, athlete representation, labor law, and IP in sports.

Name: Michigan Sports Law Society
Description: SLS explores various facets of sports law and career development (e.g., firms, sports agencies, in-house) through events such as guest lectures, informational panels, networking sessions, and other educational and professional activities. SLS also organizes and funds trips to sports law-related events (e.g., MSBC, the UVA Law Softball Invitational, etc.), as well as works with student organizations at the Ross School of Business to coordinate sports competitions between the two schools here in Ann Arbor.
Summary: Michigan Sports Law Society explores legal issues and career opportunities in the area of sports law. SLS is devoted to providing the necessary resources, guidance, and contacts to support the pursuit of professional endeavors in sports practices.

Name: Michigan Sports Viewing Club
Description: Michigan Sports Viewing Club offers students the opportunity to watch live sports, while making new friends with their peers in a safe environment.
Summary: Michigan Sports Viewing Club offers students the opportunity to watch live sports, while making new friends with their peers in a safe environment.

Name: Michigan Stocks and Bonds Organization
Description:
Michigan Stocks and Bonds was founded out of the collective ambition of student investors. Our goal is to help students turn their own ideas and visions into successful investments, and have managed to back many success stories so far. The focus is on educating its members, sharpening their professional development skills, and providing networking opportunities.

To learn more, visit www.michsbo.org
Summary: All-inclusive student organization with the goal of improving financial literacy among members, with a concentration in learning about investing in the various sectors of the stocks and bonds markets. To learn more, visit www.michsbo.org.

Name: Michigan Strength Augmenting Robotic Exoskeletons
Description: This team is looking to advance the field of powered exoskeleton technology to a practical and useful level.  Most powered exoskeletons are confined to a lab area and are not usable by a person in a real world setting.  Our purpose is to change that by designing and building an exoskeleton that can help the user with everyday tasks and make a difference in the real world.  These practical solutions will help show the technology can be useful outside of just labs and military applications, and are a major step toward making this a mainstream technology that is within the reach of anyone who needs it.
Summary: STARX works toward building practical strength augmenting exoskeletons usable in an everyday setting in order to advance the field of exoskeleton technology and put it to use helping people outside of the lab.

Name: Michigan Student Artificial Intelligence Lab
Description:
MSAIL is a student organization devoted to artificial intelligence education and projects.

Website: http://msail.github.io/

Slack channel: https://msail-team.slack.com/join/shared_invite/zt-2amxfx9xj-Twwm6uuT1YCuBfKXn62v8Q
Summary: Michigan Student Artificial Intelligence Lab promotes student interest and participation in AI research, application, and development at U of M.

Name: Michigan Surf Club
Description:
As one of the only surf clubs in the Midwest, Michigan Surf Club (MSurf) provides UM students with unique opportunities to connect with the Great Lakes through surfing and environmental stewardship. MSurf is open to surfers of all levels and connects students with the equipment and resources necessary to surf year-round on Lake Michigan and other waters. By developing shared appreciation and respect for the Great Lakes, MSurf seeks to spread a sense of responsibility for Great Lakes protection which translates into MSurf events and projects (e.g., beach clean-ups, advocacy for clean water, environmental partnerships, etc.). Whether the Lakes are firing or flat, MSurf offers fun times to stay stoked.

Listed below are a few events offered throughout the year:

  • Year-round surf trips to Lake Michigan (weather and waves permitting)
  • Year-round surfing on the Huron River
  • Spring Break trips to warm locations
  • Surfing 101 sessions (includes basic surf skills, wave forecasting, and more)
  • Volunteering w/ Alliance for the Great Lakes and Surfrider Foundation
  • Social events (potlucks, surf-related movie watch events, etc.)

 linktr.ee/msurf.club <-info for instagram, groupme, and more!
Summary: This organization promotes surfing and environmental stewardship on the Great Lakes. MSurf hosts activities for surfers of all abilities, including year-round surfing, beach clean-ups, informational sessions, and other club events.

Name: Michigan Sustainable Aviation with General Electric
Description: The Michigan Sustainable Aviation with General Electric (M-SAGE) is a project team associated with the Department of Aerospace Engineering x88 Product Development course series overseen by Professor George Halow. The team partners with General Electric Aerospace to deliver an RC sustainable aviation technology demonstrator platform and digital engineering environment through the use of MBSE tools and processes. The 2024-2025 M-SAGE Project is a program focused on the incorporation of specific sustainable aviation technologies into an RC demonstrator craft. The core deliverable will be a modified Bushmaster RC craft that incorporates a truss-braced wing design, gas turbine propulsion, and integrated flight controls as a successful baseline. A primary focus will be on the use of MBSE tools and processes to accommodate changing or uncertain customers requirements, and a key deliverable will be the documentation of the effect of MBSE on efficiency, traceability, and design robustness. The project will culminate in a flight demonstration at the end of the project development cycle.
Summary: M-SAGE is a student project team associated with the Department of Aerospace Engineering x88 Product Development course series. The team partners with General Electric to deliver an RC technology demonstrator platform and digital engineering environment

Name: Michigan Sustainable Investments
Description:
Michigan Sustainable Investments is a premier student-led organization at the University of Michigan, committed to the principles of impact investing and sustainable business practices. Our mission is to educate, inspire, and empower the next generation of leaders to use capital as a force for good. We believe that intentional investments can drive positive social and environmental change, and we are dedicated to providing our members with the tools and opportunities to make a meaningful impact.

Our club offers a comprehensive program that includes educational modules, professional development sessions, hands-on projects, and high-level networking opportunities. Members gain valuable insights into the world of impact investing, learning how to evaluate and execute investments that deliver both financial returns and positive societal outcomes. Examples of impact investments include microfinance, venture capital for social enterprises, green bonds (climate bonds), public equity investments in companies with high ESG ratings, and financial services supporting clean energy projects. Additionally, we host an annual symposium featuring speakers from leading organizations who share insights on impact investing, ESG integration, and sustainable business practices.
Summary: Michigan Sustainable Investments shapes future leaders in sustainable and ethical investing, fostering education, professional development, and real-world application to drive social and environmental change.

Name: Michigan Synthetic Biology Team
Description:
2024/25 Application Updates:

MSBT operates around the iGEM competition cycle, with iGEM held in November. We collect interest during the Fall semester, but open the application and complete recruitment in January (2025). 

Please fill out this form to be added to our interest list and be sent periodic updates about our progress, as well as information surrounding applying to MSBT. 

We are currently recruiting for 2025. The application is now open, and will close on January 24th, 2025 at 11:59 pm. Apply here.

 

Check out 2022's project wiki page, 2023's project wiki page, and 2024's project wiki page as well as our team website!

 

We are extremely proud to have been awarded a Gold Medal at iGEM 2022 and iGEM 2023, and a silver medal at iGEM 2024, as well as have been nominated for best undergraduate diagnostics project at iGEM 2023 and best sustainable development project at iGEM 2024.

 

Who Are We?

The Michigan Synthetic Biology Team is an entirely student run research and engineering design team in the biological sciences. We develop and execute our own research projects in the area of synthetic biology. Students have the opportunity to gain hands on experience in conducting scientific research, running a laboratory, engineering novel biological systems, fundraising, public outreach, leadership, and working as part of a multidisciplinary team. Every year, the team competes in the International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) jamboree competition in Paris, France.

 

What is Synthetic Biology?

Synthetic Biology combines biology and engineering to design, construct, and test biological devices and systems. Combining these two disciplines allows us to better understand life, and use that understanding to benefit society. Synthetic Biology is distinct from Genetic Engineering in that the latter only alters existing genes, whereas the former utilizes existing, modified, and man-made genes to make life perform useful functions not normally found in nature. Through synthetic biology, it may be possible to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems such as energy shortage, environmental pollution, and disease. However, we must be wary of potential safety and ethical issues along the way.

 

What is iGEM?

iGEM is an international undergraduate synthetic biology competition. In 2015, iGEM consisted of 259 teams and 2700 participants from all over the world. Every year, teams research, design, construct, and test a novel biological system. Students have at their disposal bits of DNA from the iGEM Registry of Standard Biological parts to help aid them in building their biological “machine”. In addition, students are encouraged to build their own parts and develop new techniques to make life easier to engineer. Teams also help to increase awareness for synthetic biology through public outreach and analyze safety concerns as a part of the project design process. Projects are wide ranging and are divided into the following categories: Environment, Food and Nutrition, Energy, Foundational Advance, Health and Medicine, Information Processing, Manufacturing, Software Tools, and New Applications. For more information, see igem.org.

 

Who Can Join?

Any undergraduate student with an interest in synthetic biology and biological engineering is welcome to join! No previous experience is required. We also welcome members with extensive lab experience, especially with expertise in specific techniques, including human cell culture, Gibson assembly, and plasmid engineering. In addition, we always have places for students interested in mathematical modeling, business, programming, web design, and animation. Our team is composed of undergraduate students from a variety of majors, including (but not limited to) Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mathematics, Biophysics, Neuroscience, Microbiology, Philosophy, and Materials Science & Engineering. We also have graduate students and faculty advisors from multiple colleges and departments on campus. Students will become acquainted with the theory and techniques during weekly meetings from February to the end of Winter Semester, at which point we will transition to working on the year’s project, continuing into the Spring, Summer, and following Fall Semester, until our competition in late October. To join, applications start in the middle of January!

 

Note: Per iGEM rules, students over the age of 23 by March 31 may not perform work. They can however be advisors to the team. Students in a 5-year combined bachelor's/master's degree program who are not older than 23 are eligible to join!
Summary: The Michigan Synthetic Biology Team is an entirely student run research and engineering design team in the biological sciences. We develop and execute our own research projects in the area of synthetic biology.

Name: Michigan Taal
Description: Michigan Taal is a South Asian fusion, competitive dance team that was founded in 2005. The team uses its members’ diverse backgrounds in dance to incorporate a variety of styles such as Bollywood, Bhangra, Hip-hop, Classical, and more into the choreography to compete at competitions all over the country.
Summary: TAAL is a South Asian fusion, competitive dance team that was founded in 2005. The team uses its members’ diverse backgrounds in dance to incorporate a variety of styles such as Bollywood, Bhangra, Hip-hop and Classical into the choreography.

Name: Michigan Table Tennis Club
Description:
The objective of the club is to promote, develop, and implement programs for the sport of table tennis regardless of the player’s experience.

 

 

The University of Michigan Table Tennis Club is open to all students, faculty, and community members, regardless of age, gender, or playing levels. 

 

 

 

Click here for up to date schedule, details, and to join our mailing list!
Summary: Our club provides a recreational and competitive aspect to satisfy the interests of any player. Members of any skill level are welcomed to join and become part of a dedicated and friendly community.

Name: Michigan Taekwondo
Description:
Taekwondo (태권도) is a traditional Korean martial art known for its fluid footwork and the development of fast, fancy, and explosive kicks. Taekwondo has been an official Olympic sport since 2000, has recently been the cause of global sensation through dynamic demonstrations on TV shows like America's Got Talent, and is the most widely practiced martial art in the world (70+ million in over 200+ countries)!!

The Michigan Taekwondo Club (UMTKD) welcomes people of ALL levels of experience: anyone from black belts who have been competing their entire lives, former trainees a few years out of practice, those coming from other martial arts backgrounds, all the way to brand-new first-timers with no athletic experience at all!! NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE IS NECESSARY. BEGINNERS ARE WELCOME!!

We are a member school of the Eastern Collegiate Taekwondo Conference (ECTC) and while competing is NOT MANDATORY (though highly encouraged), we frequently send members to compete at MIT, Brown, Cornell, Princeton, etc. against Ivy League- and other East coast-based schools in both sparring (kyorugi) and forms (poomsae) events. We compete following the WT (World Taekwondo) or Olympic-style rules.

For more information, check out our website: http://umtaekwondo.club

https://youtu.be/oBuSXw0BNU4
Summary: Michigan Taekwondo (UMTKD), functions both as a Taekwondo dojang as well as a competitive collegiate team. We are a part of the Eastern Collegiate Taekwondo Conference (ECTC). NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. BEGINNERS ARE WELCOME!! http://umtaekwondo.club

Name: Michigan Taiwanese Student Association
Description: Michigan Taiwanese Student Association (MTSA), founded at the year of 1986, was a supporting channel for people to discuss diverse issues of the current Taiwanese society. It now also exists to help Taiwanese graduate students with challenges they might encounter in their academic and social life at University of Michigan. By holding social events throughout the year, especially at the times of traditional holidays, MTSA endeavors to establish a supportive network for our fellow Taiwanese students as well as to promote awareness of Taiwanese culture and heritage on campus.
Summary: Michigan Taiwanese Student Association (MTSA) supports Taiwanese graduate students at University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Task Based Robotics
Summary: Michigan Task Based Robotics (MTBR) is a competitive and educational team focused on advancing the field of robotics through innovation, teamwork, and determination.

Name: Michigan Technology Law Review
Description:
Founded in 1994 as the Michigan Telecommunications and Technology Law Review, MTLR was one of the first law journals to use interactive media to promote informed discourse about the interrelated legal, social, business, and public policy issues raised by emerging technologies. As one of the original online law journals in the world, MTLR is a ground-breaking publication.

MTLR publishes online and printed volumes, available through subscription. MTLR is available through Lexis-Nexis, Westlaw, and its website. The Michigan Technology Law Review's primary purpose is to examine the tensions created by advances in computing, telecommunications, biotechnology, multimedia, networking, information, and other technologies.
Summary: MTLR is a law journal which uses interactive media to promote informed discourse about the interrelated legal, social, business, and public policy issues raised by emerging technologies.

Name: Michigan Telefund
Description: Professional development in communication, problem solving, and management skills to build your resume and career prep.
Summary: Professional development in communication, problem solving, and management skills to build your resume and career prep.

Name: Michigan Tetris
Description:
A space for Tetris players to play together and compete. We run tournaments each semester and compete with other schools. Discuss setups, games, and practice here! All skill levels and games welcome!

Join our Discord for updates!

We meet weekly in the Pierpont Commons' Boulevard Room from 7-9pm on Thursdays, feel free to drop by!
Summary: A space for Tetris players to play together and compete. We run tournaments each semester and compete with other schools. Discuss setups, games, and practice here! All skill levels and games welcome!

Name: Michigan Texas Club
Description: The mission of the Texas Club is (1) to host panels, luncheons, and social events for Michigan Law students to learn about legal practice in Texas, (2) to create a recruiting pipeline of Michigan Law students starting their legal careers in Texas, and (3) to maintain a network of Michigan Law alumni supporting each other in the Texas legal market.
Summary: The purpose of the Texas Club is (1) to educate Michigan Law students on the benefits and opportunities of practicing law in Texas and (2) to provide Michigan Law students who are interested in practicing law in Texas with networking opportunities.

Name: Michigan Theme Park Engineering and Design
Description: Michigan TPED immerses students in the themed entertainment industry. This expansive field encompasses zoos, museums, theme parks, and everything in between! We engage members through weekly meetings, hosted speakers, networking opportunities, group trips, and design projects that encourage open conversation, idea sharing, and cross-disciplinary collaboration as necessary preparation for relevant careers in amusement engineering and design. We boast a broad range of majors, have no dues, and are always open to new members!
Summary: Open to ALL majors, Michigan TPED is dedicated to educating and engaging students with the wide industry of themed entertainment! As a member, you’ll be exposed to real-life challenges and be immersed in our social events and park trips!

Name: Michigan Transportation Student Organization
Description: MiTSO was established for the express purpose of developing transportation students' personal and professional interests. Through various events such as field trips, networking events, guest speakers, and more, our mission is to create meaningful experiences and lasting connections for University of Michigan students interested in transportation. Our goal is to foster a community among students and faculty with these shared interests and increase awareness of this area through outreach to new students. MiTSO aims to connect the next generation of transportation engineering students and faculty to opportunities and knowledge that will facilitate collaboration, professional development, and advancements in the transportation engineering field.
Summary: MiTSO is a club for students interested in transportation planning and engineering. We host field trips, networking events, guest speakers, and more to introduce and connect students to the field of transportation. All UM students are welcome to join.

Name: Michigan Undergraduate Law Review
Description:
“The Michigan Undergraduate Law Review is the first and only undergraduate legal publication at the University of Michigan. We provide students interested in careers in law, academia, and policy the opportunity to publish long-form articles on topics in legal scholarship.

Please do not apply to join the organization on Maize Pages. Instead, please refer to our website.
Summary: We are an undergraduate publication writing long form articles on topics of law and all subfields.

Name: Michigan Undergraduate Moot Court Team
Description: Moot court is a collegiate team-based competition where competitors simulate appellate processes via verbal and written arguments. We attend annual AMCA (American Moot Court Association) tournaments and invitationals at various colleges around the country. Join us at our weekly meetings to discuss case material and relevant law, aided by attorney coaches and experienced faculty.
Summary: We are the undergraduate moot court team for Michigan, competing in the American Moot Court Association tournaments. We provide a space for undergraduate students to pursue constitutional law and a competitive moot court scene outside the law school.

Name: Michigan Undergraduate Students of Statistics
Description:
Please email us directly at mugsstatistics@gmail.com to join our club and be added to our email list! We will not respond to Maize Pages. You can also use the form on our website.

Check out our website!

MUgSS is a student-run organization sponsored by the Statistics Department. We aim to provide academic and career resources for undergraduate students interested in the field of statistics and its many applications. We welcome students from all majors, including (but not limited to): statistics, data science, computer science, business, cognitive science, mathematics, and economics. Our mission is to support, guide, and bring together like-minded individuals by forming a greater network of students, alumni, and faculty.

 

MUgSS offers a variety of events, including:

  • recruiting events — industry speakers, interview workshops, intern panels
  • graduate school — faculty and grad student panels, admissions advice, course planning
  • technical workshops, resume workshops, career exploration events, and more!
Summary: MUgSS is a student-run club sponsored by the Statistics Department. We aim to provide academic and career resources for undergraduate students interested in statistics/data science and its many applications. We welcome students from all majors!

Name: Michigan Venture Club
Description: We strive to support a dynamic and inclusive ecosystem of entrepreneurship and venture capital at the University of Michigan. We aim to provide our members with opportunities for learning, networking, and hands-on experience in the world of startups, venture capital, and innovation.
Summary: Michigan Venture Club aims to create an organization that connects the campus and the VC industry. It provides students with the experience of entrepreneurship, industry research, deal sourcing, and other aspects of venture capital.

Name: Michigan Vis Moot International Commercial Arbitration Moot Court Team
Description: The Michigan Vis Moot International Commercial Arbitration Moot Court Team is group of law students that compete at the William C. Vis Moot Competition. The competition focuses on areas of international arbitration and business transactions. The team consists of researchers, oralists, and coaches. Oralists travel to compete in mock arbitrations with teams around the world. Researchers assist with the brief writing segment of the competition. The focus is on developing knowledge and skills that will empower students at competition. As competitors, the team members research international legal problems, draft briefs, and participate in oral arguments. Tryouts for related competitions are held annually.
Summary: The Michigan Vis Moot International Commercial Arbitration Moot Court Team is a group of law students that compete in the William C. Vis Moot Competition. The focus is on developing knowledge and skills that will empower students at competition.

Name: Michigan Voting Project
Description: The Michigan Voting Project (MVP) seeks to provide University of Michigan law students non-partisan opportunities to explore legal issues in elections, campaigning, and voting rights.
Summary: The Michigan Voting Project (MVP) seeks to provide University of Michigan law students non-partisan opportunities to explore legal issues in elections, campaigning, and voting rights.

Name: Michigan Waterski Team
Description:
This organization is a group of students that love to waterski and wakeboard. We compete at collegiate water ski NCWSA sanctioned tournaments throughout the fall and are dedicated to improvement in the sport, friendly competition and camaraderie among fellow schools, and proudly representing University of Michigan to the waterski community.

Interested in joining? The quickest way to get in the loop is to shoot us an email at water.ski.officers@umich.edu

Feel free to check out our Instagram: @michiganwaterski or on YouTube if you want to see more of what we're up to!!
Summary: A group of students that love waterskiing and wakeboarding. We compete at collegiate tournaments and are dedicated to personal improvement in the sport, friendly competition with fellow schools, and representing U of M to the waterski community.

Name: Michigan Wealth & Asset Management Club
Description: Michigan Wealth and Asset Management Club is the first wealth/asset management club on campus. We specialize in member education for students who may be interested in wealth/asset management or finance in general. MWAM provides education sessions, professional development, speaker events with professionals in the industry, case studies, and a community for like minded individuals in a safe and diverse environment.
Summary: The first and only wealth and asset management club at the University of Michigan. Focused on educating members about the field of wealth/asset management through education sessions, professional development, and case studies.

Name: Michigan Weightlifting
Description: University of Michigan Weightlifting promotes a competitive environment for U-M students. We compete and represent Michigan in local competitions and national competitions (i.e. Junior Nationals, Under 25, University Championships, American Open I, II, III).
Summary: Michigan Weightlifting promotes a competitive environment for U-M students. We compete and represent Michigan in local competitions and national competitions (i.e. National Junior, Under 25, University Championships)

Name: Michigan Wolveraas
Description:
Originally founded in 2001, Michigan Wolveraas is one of the oldest raas teams in the nation. A team steeped in tradition and fueled by passion, we have displayed and celebrated Indian heritage on and off campus for over two decades by spreading awareness of the vibrant raas-garba dance form to fellow students, as well as competing and placing at competitions across the nation. This year, we have come together to compete with a set full of creative formations, eye-catching moves, and high energy, all while spreading Indian culture to our fellow students and introducing new members to our tight-knit family. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MKIOH3kZkpc
Summary: Michigan Wolveraas is a competitive cultural dance team dedicated to spreading the tradition of raas and garba to the students of the University of Michigan while representing Michigan at various national competitions.

Name: Michigan Women Empowerment in Sport and Entertainment
Description: Michigan Women Empowerment in Sport & Entertainment (MWESE) is a student organization on campus focused on providing women students with opportunities to create strong connections with their peers and industry professionals, stimulating personal growth, and expanding professional networks in the sport and entertainment industries. Members will have the opportunity to benefit from one-on-one networking, mentorship programs, student organization collaborations, speaker events and round table discussions. MWESE has an unwavering dedication to uphold our values—community, intention, and exploration—in all operations and member offerings.
Summary: MWESE is established to provide an inclusive and safe space for women interested in sport and entertainment careers to expand their social and professional network. MWESE is devoted to the development of women leaders in the industry.

Name: Michigan Women Investment Group
Description: Our mission is to empower undergraduate women by providing a supportive community where we collectively strive to become knowledgeable and proficient in the realm of finance. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment that promotes financial literacy, investment education, and professional growth. By leveraging our diverse backgrounds and perspectives, we aim to equip our members with the tools, skills, and confidence to navigate the complex world of finance successfully. Through interactive discussions, workshops, guest speakers, and hands-on investment opportunities, we endeavor to cultivate a strong foundation of financial understanding and strategic thinking. Our ultimate goal is to empower each member to secure their economic futures and become leaders in the field of finance. Together, we aspire to shatter barriers, challenge stereotypes, and create a lasting impact in the world of finance as confident and well-versed women.
Summary: Michigan Women Investment Group aims to foster financial literacy and professional support through education, collaboration, and practical experience for undergraduate women at the University of Michigan.

Name: Michigan Yoga Club
Description:
Michigan Yoga Club is an energetic, supportive, and diverse club that brings the holistic practices of yoga and pole to students and other U of M  affiliates. We welcome all body types, ages, racial and ethnic identities, and expressions of gender and sexuality. MYC and our sister organization, Michigan Pole Dance Society (MPDS), partner with Polarity Fitness to leverage their knowledgeable and tenured instructors, inspire growth and development, promote wellness and tranquility, teach love for self and others, and bring a playful awareness to our club members. We are deeply committed to building a strong community, fostering connections between people, and cultivating our own intangible heritage. Our members have access to regularly scheduled yoga, pole, flexibility, cardio, and core classes through paid dues. Additionally, MYC runs community events through the Polarity Fitness space to recruit and retain members and grow our mindfulness mission. We encourage students of all levels to partake in these varied class modalities.
 
Classes follow the UM academic schedule and are held at Polarity Fitness 1220 South University. To become a member, check out MYC's Instagram for more details @michiganyogaclub. 
 
WANT TO JOIN NOW? EMAIL: reeseo@umich.edu and vsab@umich.edu
Summary: Find Balance.  Find Friends.  Breathe Blue.

Name: Michigan Youth Sports Initiative
Description: The MYSI aspires to evaluate the inequalities in sport due to pay-to-play costs that neglect many lower income families the opportunity to have their youth participate in organized sport. To bridge this gap in surrounding communities, MYSI will provide these opportunities to youth through an acquisition of monetary and in-kind donations from interested sponsors to provide student-led youth teams and programs in the greater Ann Arbor area.
Summary: MYSI is a student led initiative aspiring to provide sports and structure in the lives of youth who have been previously neglected the opportunity to do so due to the pay-to-play costs that make sport inaccessible for many.

Name: Michigan-Blue Origin Payload Project Team
Description:
Project Overview

Design, build, test, and launch a project aboard New Shepard

MBOP-1 (2022-2023 project): Redundant, dissimilar system designed to measure simulated lunar gravity during sub-orbital flight. The data will be used to verify Blue Origin capsule sensor data
Summary: The Michigan-Blue Origin Payload Project Team is run through the Aerospace Engineering x88 course series; our mission as a project team is to design, build, test, and launch a payload or project aboard New Shepard.

Name: Michigan-Leidos Autonomous Persistent Intelligent Swarm Demonstration
Description:
Project Overview

Design, build, test, and compete our machine learning drone in a Leidos/NASA/x88 sanctioned competition

  • Fault-tolerant drone swarm able to exchange information on ad-hoc basis and coordinate actions.
  • The system uses ad-hoc mesh networking and experimental swarm autonomy algorithms to create a system able to function independently, cohesively, as well as on a fractured basis.
Summary: The Michigan-Leidos Autonomous Persistent Intelligent Swarm Demonstration  Project Team is run through the Aerospace Engineering x88 course series; our mission as a project team is to design, build, test, and employ an autonomous drone swarm.

Name: Michiganensian Yearbook
Description: The Michiganensian Yearbook is the only publication at the University of Michigan that can truly capture the spirit and character of the entire year. The Michiganensian is a full color, 376-page book featuring campus life, special events, sports, student organizations, and more. It also features the graduates from both the fall of 2020 and winter of 2021 academic terms.
Summary: The Michiganensian Yearbook is the official yearbook of the University of Michigan, and has been published annually for 124 years. Our staff proudly extends an invitation to help us continue this time-honored tradition by ordering your copy today!

Name: Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association
Description: The Middle Eastern and North African Law Students Association (MENALSA) seeks to foster an inclusive environment and community network for Michigan law students who are interested in the Middle East or identify as Middle Eastern, including Arab, North African, Iranian, Turkish, and Armenian students. MENALSA hopes to provide a space at Michigan law where students of Middle Eastern descent can feel comfortable speaking out on a range of social, legal, and political issues central to their identities. MENALSA also works in tandem with other affinity groups to give Middle Eastern students and other minorities a stronger voice on campus. MENALSA hosts a range of events, including engaging the campus community through panel discussions and events that touch on matters pertaining to the Middle East, its people, and the diaspora. MENALSA seeks to provide opportunities to connect Middle Eastern students with resources to support them in law school and beyond.
Summary: MENALSA seeks to foster an inclusive environment and community network for Michigan law students who identify as being of, share an interest in, or are committed to the welfare of the Middle East and North Africa.

Name: Middle Eastern North African (MENA) Business Student Assocation
Description: The MENA Club plays a vital role on campus by showcasing and advocating for these varied cultures. Our objective is to enhance comprehension of this frequently misconstrued region through a range of social, educational, and cultural activities, while also serving as a platform for the voices of MENA members within the Ross Business community. We aspire for the MENA Club to assist its members in discovering avenues through which they can contribute significantly to the business community. We aim to facilitate connections with like-minded business partners at Ross who can support their initiatives. Additionally, our goal is to cultivate an inclusive and interconnected social atmosphere, both within the Ross community and extending beyond. We will maintain strong ties with other university departments, providing opportunities for our club members to engage with the wider community surrounding the University of Michigan
Summary: The MENA Club aims to strengthen the ties between MENA club members and Alumni and increase awareness about the MENA region on campus.

Name: Midnight Book Club
Description: Midnight Book Club (MBC) is a long-form comedic improvisation team. MBC has monthly improv comedy shows on campus that are FREE. Email us at mbcimprov@umich.edu if like doing and/or watching comedy.
Summary:
Midnight Book Club is long-form improvisational comedy troupe. 

Comedy, improv, fun, "friends"! We wrote those words so we pop up in your maize page search. Hit us up.

Name: Migrant Farmworker Outreach Clinic
Description: The Migrant Farmworker Outreach Clinic works in partnership with the Community Action Agency of Lenawee County to provide annual primary care services to migrant and seasonal agricultural workers in Michigan during the spring-summer growing season. In addition to providing quality care to patients accessing the clinic, our goal is to foster a learning environment in which medical trainees and faculty can learn to provide medical care more effectively and with cultural humility to this unique patient population.
Summary: The Migrant Farmworker Outreach Clinic works in partnership with the Community Action Agency of Lenawee County to provide annual primary care services to migrant and seasonal agricultural workers in Michigan during the spring-summer growing season.

Name: Mindful Community Club
Description: Mindful Community Club is a student organization within the U-M School of Social Work that will offer free in person meditation sessions. The e-board hopes to offer leadership opportunities as well, as such meditation training workshops or retreats to attend together. Our opportunities will be open to those new to meditation, in addition to those who are not. It will be a safe, inclusive space to talk about meditation and mindfulness while learning new skills and strategies to advance our practice.
Summary: At Mindful Community Club we foster community on campus through mindfulness and meditation

Name: Mindful Michigan
Description: Mindful Michigan was established to create an open and welcoming community by practicing mindfulness together, in every sense of the word. We learn from each other every meeting through our conversations, and boost each others' mindfulness practices through our group meditations. Mindful Michigan does other community building activities like camping, hiking, and seasonal events (raspberry picking, cookie decorating, etc). This club is no commitment, come to any meetings you want at any point in the year! Email us to be added to our email list :).
Summary: Mindful Michigan is a community of like-minded individuals interested in mindfulness and all things surrounding it.

Name: Mindfulness Circle
Description: Mindfulness Circle is a club that focuses on welcoming a variety of people and their beliefs while discussing topics surrounding spirituality. It encourages the act of mindfulness during the meetings and in everyday life. No matter what someone’s lifestyle is, they are accepted and have a voice in the club. Additionally, the club supports being open-minded and a patient listener.
Summary: Mindfulness Circle aims to create a spiritual community of people no matter their belief, background, and disposition. We value connecting ourselves to our true nature.

Name: Minerva Lab
Description:
Minerva Lab is a multidisciplinary research group in Psychology and Behavioral Science helping students to break into academia and applied research.

 

Our primary goal is to help you prepare for graduate school or your first corporate experience by building both soft and hard skills relevant to your academic pathway.

 

Our mission is to make research education and hands-on experience in applied psychology more accessible, fostering a supportive and inclusive environment for students to explore, learn, and contribute meaningfully to the field.

 

Through innovative projects, collaborative learning, and a focus on accessibility, Minerva seeks to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world application in Psychology and related fields, preparing students to thrive in both academic and professional research settings.

 

We are currently (Winter 2025) working on Decision-Making Psychology research and going to expand to all the branches of Psychology including Biopsychology, Neuroscience, Cognitive Psychology, Social Psychology, Human Relationships Psychology, Clinical Psychology, Abnormal Psychology, Developmental Psychology, Health Psychology, Positive Psychology, Personality Psychology, Family Psychology, Linguistics, Philosophy, Well-Being, Therapy, Coaching, and more.
Summary: Minerva is a multidisciplinary research group in Psychology and Behavioral Science helping students to break into academia and applied research. # Making Interdisciplinary Navigation of Education and Research Visible to All

Name: Mintify
Description: Mintify is the User Experience (UX) Design club at the University of Michigan. We provide educational workshops to our members to boost their portfolio pieces, become familiar with current design software, and prepare for upcoming internship / full time opportunities. Our members include students from a large variety of majors outside of UX Design, such as Data Science, Libraries, Archives, Knowledge Environments in Society (LAKES), and Information Analysis.
Summary: Mintify, UX-centered student project hub, is all about creating a space for problem-solvers, thinkers, and collaborators here at the Umich! Just like a curious and quick rabbit, Mintify brings together students from different fields.

Name: Mission Possible Organization
Description: Mission Possible Organization or MPO is a Detroit-based non-profit organization that aims to make the impossible, possible. It utilizes its resources, time, and effort to partake in various acts of charity work for anyone in need of assistance, aid, or community service. We support unity amongst all races, ethnicities, and backgrounds, seeking endless opportunities to help improve our community. MPO never allows the idea of “impossible” to affect the measures taken to create a better world.
Summary: Mission Possible Organization (MPO) is a non-profit organization that operates exclusively for charitable purposes within the meaning of a 501(c)(3), and to relieve the distressed by providing assistance to low-income and underprivileged persons.

Name: MIST
Description: MIST is an organization geared towards bringing students together to develop leadership, communication, and other creative skills, all while gaining a deeper understanding of Islam and Muslims.
Summary: MIST is an organization geared towards bringing students together to develop leadership, communication, and other creative skills, all while gaining a deeper understanding of Islam and Muslims.

Name: Mixed@Michigan
Description: Mixed@Michigan is committed to fostering a community of multiracial, multiethnic, transnational adoptee, and international students. Together, we strive to further understand the complexities of the mixed-identity experience and actively participate in advocation, education, and support for mixed students’ well-being, identity exploration, and other pertinent issues.
Summary: Mixed@Michigan fosters a community of mixed, biracial, multiracial, multiethnic, and transnational adoptee students on campus in an effort to create a safe space for cultural exploration and connection.

Name: MLaw Rocks
ShortName: Law Student Rock Climbing Club for Law Student Rock Climbers
Description: MLawRocks! aims to facilitate a rock climbing community among students, faculty, & staff of the University of Michigan Law School to help provide a mental and physical balance to their academic & professional pursuits
Summary: MLawRocks! aims to facilitate a rock climbing community among students, faculty, & staff of the University of Michigan Law School to help provide a mental and physical balance to their academic & professional pursuits

Name: MLead
Description: MLead is a collective of leadership educators that connect students to opportunities that empower them to create social change on their campus and in their community.
Summary: MLead is a collective of leadership educators that connect students to opportunities that empower them to create social change on their campus and in their community.

Name: MMA Club
Description: MMA Club offers students at UofM the opportunity to learn and practice Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Find us here: https://t.me/mmmaize
Summary: MMA Club offers students at the University of Michigan the opportunity to study and practice Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and Striking

Name: Mock Trial Team
Description:
Michigan Mock Trial (MMT) is a nationally ranked program within the American Mock Trial Association. MMT prides itself on competitive excellence through the development of analytical, legal, and communications skills, which will serve members regardless of what profession they choose. Through dedicated practice and fierce competition, members develop a complex understanding of legal rules, craft case theories and arguments, and perform as both witnesses and attorneys in high-level competitions. Michigan Mock Trial is entirely student-run, allowing members to take ownership over every step of the process - from the classroom to the courtroom. And of course, traveling to competitions around the nation leads to lifelong friendships and memories.

To learn more about how to join the Michigan Mock Trial, check out our website at michiganmocktrial.com.
Summary: The Michigan Mock Trial Team is a powerhouse in collegiate mock trial. We participate in a form of competitive performance and legal debate, traveling across the nation to portray witnesses and attorneys in trial simulations.

Name: Model Federal Open Market Committee (MFED)
Description: MFED was created in hopes of better understanding the Federal Reserve, specifically by modeling the Federal Open Market Committee’s actions using possible real-world economic scenarios. We aim to host professional speaker events, predict federal interest rates and monetary policy, as well as participate in an annual Mock FOMC competition hosted by the Federal Reserve. MFED works to improve financial literacy and prepare members for the professional world. Email MFED-eboard@umich.edu for more information and/or follow our instagram @mfedumich to stay up to date on recruitment cycles.
Summary: MFED works to spread financial literacy and prepare members for the professional world by modeling monetary policy, global relations, and competing in the annual Mock FOMC competition.

Name: Model United Nations at the University of Michigan
Description:
Model United Nations at the University of Michigan (MUNUM) is a student organization that puts on a Model UN conference for high school students completely organized and run by students at the University of Michigan. Our goal is to provide delegates a space in which to broaden their understanding of international affairs and develop the skills to tackle global issues. The 2026 conference will take place in the winter semester and marks our thirty-ninth iteration!

Membership is open to any student, faculty, or staff at the University of Michigan. We welcome students of all experience levels from diverse fields of study. If you are passionate about international affairs, diplomacy, education, or simply want to spend time with an incredibly dedicated group of students, consider joining the staff of MUNUM!
Summary: MUNUM hosts an annual four-day conference for over 800 high school delegates who are passionate about global issues and diplomacy.

Name: Moli Dance Troupe at University of Michigan
Description:
History:

Moli Dance Troupe was established in 2013 by a group of enthusiastic Chinese dance lovers. In the fall of 2013, Moli's very first debut dance "Xiu Se" (The elegance of the sleeves), performed in Mendelssohn Theater, was a huge success. "Xiu Se" and the dance troupe have since attracted many more students who are interested in Chinese culture and Chinese dance.

Mission:

Our dance troupe aims to promote Chinese culture through the beauty of performing arts. Moli brings to our audience an eclectic collection of dances and performances that evolve from China's thousands years of history: from ethnic dances, to classical dances, and eventually to modern chinese fusion dances. Through Moli, we bring to the University of Michigan community a unique set of eastern movements, thinking, and arts.

Growth:

Moli's literal meaning is the jasmine flower, which is a symbol of friendship in Chinese culture. We welcome both experienced and inexperienced dancers to join the dance troupe. In the long run, Moli aims to expand the realm of performance to Chinese Drama and Chinese costume modeling. We firmly believe that while Moli brings to our audience the best pieces of performing arts from Chinese culture, the strong interests in Eastern arts and dancing in the University of Michigan community will continue support us and help Moli grow.
Summary: With choreography ranging from k-pop, hip hop, jazz, to traditional Chinese dance, Moli Dance Group aims to promote Chinese culture and provide opportunities for those interested in dance through high-quality dance cover videos and performances.

Name: Money Management at Michigan
Description: Club at the University of Michigan for students interested in personal finance and a career in fields within finance.
Summary: Organization for students interested in personal finance and portfolio management. Brings together a group of people with a common interest in money management with meetings, activities, and professional development.

Name: Morgan's Message University of Michigan
Description: Morgan's Message is a worldwide nonprofit organization that was founded after Morgan- a Duke Women's lacrosse player took her life after struggling with mental health issues. This organization expands the dialogue on mental health, normalizes conversations, empowers those who suffer, and supports those who feel alone to reduce the stigma associated with mental health in the world of athletics.
Summary: Morgan's Message strives to eliminate the stigma associated with mental health within the student-athlete community.

Name: Mosaic Students
Description: This organization consists of a community of college-aged students who are unique and imperfect individuals with complementary gifts, strengths, experiences, and abilities. Mosaic Students encourages its members to engage in the community in many different ways, whether it be through another organization, individual projects, or serving as a group. Our unique gifts allow us to serve in many different ways, which we do joyfully and lovingly.
Summary: Building a church as diverse as our city to multiply passionate pursuers of Jesus Christ who engage the world with His love.

Name: Mosher Jordan Hall Council
Description: Mosher-Jordan Hall Council is a community council designed to program events/activities, purchase building improvements, and assess the needs of the residents in order to better serve the community. The Hall Council executive board consists of Mosher-Jordan residents that are democratically elected by the residential community.
Summary: Mosher-Jordan Hall Council is a community council ran by the residents for the residents. The council provides programs and serves in order to serve the needs of the community and make MoJo a better place to live.

Name: Motley Crew
Description:
Motley Crew at the University of Michigan is a student organization dedicated to enriching the lives of children with disabilities and their families by organizing, volunteering at, and hosting themed events at a variety of facilities in Southeast Michigan. We work with the Down Syndrome Support Team, Down Syndrome Guild of Southeast Michigan, Penrickton Center for Blind Children, Children's Hospital of Michigan at the Detroit Medical Center, and more.

In addition to volunteering, Motley Crew strongly values membership commitment, membership bonding, and community. As such, we host numerous social gatherings for members throughout the semester such as blanket making, pumpkin painting, trivia, going to cider mills, movie parties, study tables, tie-dye parties, and more. 
​
Founded in 2009, Motley Crew got its start volunteering at Mott Children's Hospital with a small but dedicated crew. We have since expanded to over 100 members and volunteer at many facilities. We are always looking for ways to improve our ties to the community, the overall club experience for members, and the scale of our events.
Summary: Motley Crew organizes, volunteers at, and hosts themed events for children with disabilities and their families in partnership with community institutions throughout Southeast Michigan.

Name: Movement of Under-represented Sisters in Engineering and Science
Description: This organization is designed to provide a unique support structure for women from underrepresented and underserved backgrounds who are pursuing advanced degrees, particularly in STEM at the University of Michigan. MUSES utilizes three principles that are critical to creating an effective support system: empowerment, harmony, and mentoring.
Summary: An organization designed to provide a unique support structure for women of color pursuing advanced degrees at the University of Michigan.

Name: MPowered Entrepreneurship
Description:
MPowered Entrepreneurship is the largest and oldest entrepreneurial organization at the University of Michigan. MPowered brings together a group of highly motivated, detail-oriented students who aren’t afraid to take risks. Our group consists of innovators and on-campus leaders. We pride ourselves on the lasting impact we have on the entrepreneurial community on and off-campus. MPowered members gain lifelong connections as well as valuable skills needed to become better people, students, and entrepreneurs.

 

A taste of what we do:

Makeathon: a 36-hour product design competition and recruitment fair that engages 200+ students and attracts sponsors including Amazon, Google, Texas Instruments, etc

 

Startup Career Fair: a recruiting event that connects 750+ student developers, designers, and talent interested in entrepreneurship to career and internship opportunities at 40+ startups

 

1000 Pitches: a low-stakes, high-energy pitch competition that engages thousands of students on-campus each year

 

Consulting: a pro bono venture support organization focused on solving real business challenges for startups to promote innovation and growth within the local entrepreneurial community

 

TrailBlaze: an outreach program that brings U-M’s diverse skills and resources to low-income, first-generation middle school students to learn about technology, entrepreneurship, and innovation

 

Product Showcase: a launch platform for small startups that want to bring their product into a physical space.
